Summary: What a perfect little family hotel.   Our room was simple but large enough for our family. Nothing fancy but clean and quiet.  Staff was great and felt welcoming! We had a large fridge and microwave in our room. Perfect for breakfast. Pool and hot tub were a welcome sight after a long day in the parks.   Perfect location.  This is a budget hotel but clean and comfy. Can easily recommend for a family who just wants a comfy bed and simple accommodation!

Summary Heading: Deal Sol in Feb - just ok
Summary: Del Sol hotel is a no frills no thrills place to sleep after a busy day at Disneyland. Very easy walk to the park and close to iHop for breakfast.  Staff were all responsive and friendly. With any requests. The room was clean overall and it was nice having the bunk beds so kids could have their own beds.  We did find the room to be lacking - We are a family of 5 who travel very heavy- there were zero drawers / dresser to unpack in- a handful of hangers.  We had brought a hanging packing cube because I suspected this to be the case but we still ended up storing clothes in the suitcase.  This should be communicated when bookings are made. The seal around the door was in desperate need of replacing- a good inch+ at the bottom of the door was open.  We did not have a vehicle but the

Stayed for 4 nights in February 2023. Had a great stay. Such a close walk to Disney. Stayed in the room with 2 queens and a bunk set. Loved having enough beds for everyone. Room seemed clean. Nice hot water in the shower. Used the mini fridge in The room. Room also has microwave and single cup coffee maker. (Not keurig brand) we didn't use that. The lobby has a coffee machine with creamer that we used each morning instead. Had a late arrival. Someone was there at the front desk. Check in and out was easy.  Only thing that I could add to the room is some kind of curtain or divider to block the light from the sink bathroom area to the rest of the room. The lights are so bright that if you are trying to quietly get around while everyone else is asleep you will just want to turn on

Very poor experience with the customer service at this hotel. I had booked months ago to reserve a room, and shortly after I cancelled through the online system. Months later, this week, a charge appears on my card and at the same time they send me an email the day of the trip saying I still had a reservation despite cancelling so long ago. They would not waive the $370 fee or offer any alternatives. I was considering booking here early next year, but I would advise to stay away as their communication seems to be lacking. I‚Äôm very disappointed as a frequent park attender.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location, nice room and good for families.
Summary: I'll start with the pros, because they far outweigh the cons with this property: - LOCATION! This is just about as close you can get to Disneyland's Main Gate. It's a very easy walk right to the security lines, and it's very easy to get to/from the parks and even go back for a midday rest.  - The room comfortably fit our family of 6, which is rare for properties such as this with smaller single rooms. The use of bunkbeds is great and everyone had a place to sleep.  - The AC worked great and, while a little loud, was a good white noise. We never had any issues with noise intrusion or anything like that. The property was quiet (or we just couldn't hear it).  - Staff was very helpful and they use a text system that made it super easy to ask questions and get help.  - Rooms are

We spent 4 nights here with 5 people. I had seen some reviews making me expect this to be a "cheap motel" with a good location, but I was happily surprised that the quality was great. Our room felt like it had been recently refurbished and was very clean and nice. The staff was super friendly and helpful with us needing to store luggage before check in. The bunk beds were so nice to have compared to having people share beds. (One caution -- they are a little shorter and wider than normal beds, so 6-foot people need to sleep diagonally). And the location is about as close to the park entrance as you can stay. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is clean, comfortable, and a nice play to stay while enjoying Disneyland.

Summary Heading: THERE ARE THIEVES HERE, AND THE MANAGEMENT DOESN'T CARE
Summary: After spending an average night here with a loud air conditioner, I spent $30 to leave my car in the parking lot while we were at Disneyland for the day. Investigating the warning light that came on as I left the parking lot, I realized my gas cap was missing.  I HAVE A LOCKING GAS CAP!! The only person that had the key was the valet....  After 3 phone calls asking for the manager, I finally reached someone who said they would review tape and have the manager would get back to me. Three weeks later, still no call back and another call got me the response that "someone should call you next week" and "we'll send you the phone number for the valet so you can talk to them"  Never again will I stay here. They just don't care.....

I booked a room for  July 2nd to July 4th. The room was dirty with trash by the door bags and unmade beds.  Hotel walked us to another property as they did not have another room.  Told us the other property was expecting us and the new hotel would bill them.  When we got to the other property they told us we would have to pay again because del sol had decided to emaciate a refund. Even though I had asked not to do that.  Meaning I was out $1200 in one swipe.  Yes, they refunded me for first hotel but that took 3 days.  Meaning we could not do everything we wanted during our vacation.  No manager from del sol ever reached out to apologize.  ,

Summary Heading: Wouldn't stay here again or recommend.
Summary: Pro: Location, about a 10 minute walk to the parks.   Cons: Parking lot is very small, cars had to be moved anytime we left the property. No hot water in our room for a day & a half. This was not fun, ice cold showers for everyone including my toddler. I asked about a different room & was told they only had one vacant room but wouldn't move us. We weren't offered any kind of sentiment for the inconvenience.  Our room was incredibly loud at night and early morning, you could hear everything through the ceiling & walls. Housekeeping only empties trash.  Overall we didn't have a pleasant stay and wouldn't stay here again. There are better options in the same price range.

The room was clean and tidy the day we got in. While there wasn‚Äôt much to the room, our family always felt comfortable since we just wanted a place to rest. The staff was also always nice to any of my concerns and happily helped with anything. While they have some services not currently being offered due to the pandemic, they replace it with small gestures like Denny‚Äôs coupons or taking out your trash. If I were to come back soon, I‚Äôd stay here again because I loved how close it was to the parks.
Room tip: I heard parking is a hustle at the hotel. Also, if you‚Äôre a light sleeper I‚Äôd recommend staying...

Summary: The Location of this hotel is awesome. The customer service is great. The room was clean and the bed was good. However the parking here is horrible. They have to move cars around so you can move your own . They are nice about it, but this is a huge inconvenience if you want to go anywhere you don‚Äôt have to walk to. Luckily we only had to move ours twice. The rooms are way to light at night. You might as well leave your lights on because it will seem like you did. The doors are not sealed correctly so light and cold air come through, luckily the air conditioner/ heater to work well.  Also the no breakfast is a disappointment but it is what it is.  We did not use the pool, it was to cold and rainy but it looked clean and decent.Overall if you are staying here for the location and

I'll start with the staff are friendly and nice. Half way on a 6 hour drive qe received a call saying they won't be able to accommodate our reserved(6 months out) room which was supposed to be with bunks for the kids. The only reason we were booking at this hotel. They did comp us a roll away cot. We were placed in to a room location that probably shouldn't exist. It's in the corner near the old breakfast room we're they store all the luggage carts so all hours of the day we here the carts rolling in and out.  The door has plenty of gaps so we hear everything and fell all the wonderful cold air at night. There is no view unless you enjoy a stucco wall. I've stayed here probably 3 times before in the last 8 years but it will be my last.

Summary Heading: Same if not higher cost for less quality
Summary: When we got here, the greeting from the front desk was less than friendly or helpful. We were given no information about how the cleaning in the rooms is now ‚Äúminimal.‚Äù When we got to our room there was a funny smell. I didn‚Äôt make an issue of it because I knew they were booked to capacity so I hoped it would go away. But by the second day I realized the smell was akin to what a stack of wet diapers would smell like. Someone either urinated on the carpet or the walls. Each day we got back from Disneyland we were met with unmade beds, some of the trash removed and towels that I would only use for rags at home. One time we received ONE towel that you could consider an actual towel albeit the size was that of a hand towel. The first day we found they had given us NO hand towels and

Pros:   -One of the closest hotels to Disneyland, probably even closer than the actual Disneyland Hotel.   -Next to Denny's and one block from a convenience store for room snacks; water; cereal; milk; etc. -room has a mini fridge and microwave for cheap morning breakfast -pool was small but clean -relatively quiet  Cons:  -no housekeeping during Covid (though we asked for and received clean towels on the 3rd day) -no free breakfast as advertised (during covid) -Air conditioning cooled the room just fine but we had to put an ice bucket underneath or the carpet got soaking wet from leaking  Definitely a BUDGET hotel.  The only reason to stay here is to have a short walk to Disneyland.

Basic hotel that was great for our trip to Disney. It was just across the street and we could quickly get in line in the morning and be home quickly after a long day.  The hotel was clean when we arrived but no housekeeping during stay due to COVID . The front desk said that they could bring towels and toilet paper as needed and they did.  The air conditioner was a champ even though it was running 24/7. We couldn‚Äôt hear any other patrons for our weeklong stay until the last day when the room above us had very active children stomping around and yelling outside the room for hours.

1st and last time staying here. Three nights stuck in room 201 above the office and its 24 hour office with an electric sliding glass door that opens and closes constantly day and night. Couldn't sleep after three exhausting days in DL and awaken through the night and morning. The hotel knows of the problem due to a ton of bad reviews i read regarding that room, yet they still put people in there! No housekeeping even though their website and hotels.com states "one housekeeping service per stay.' Trash piled up, no clean towels or bed made. Dirty bathroom with hair on floor, dirty used shower curtain and brown spots on the shower wall and near toilet. No wifi available to connect to on any device which meant no streaming. Cable tv consisted of pixelated and frozen pictures on

Summary Heading: Zero housekeeping, no functional Wi-Fi, bad communication, short on basic supplies
Summary: We had a room for five people--two queen beds and a bunk for children. The room was clean when we arrived, and that is all that can be said for this motel. After a lovely but exhausting day at Disneyland, we arrived back to find no housekeeping had taken place, no towels, no soap, no trash removal, nothing. We were out of toilet paper. I called the front desk and was informed that housekeeping didn't come unless we requested it. My husband went to the front desk and they put our names on a clean list. Next evening: came back to the same situation, and was told by the front desk that they didn't do housekeeping under any circumstances during a stay. My problem with this is that many other motels DO continue with housekeeping, safely, during the pandemic. If this one decided

The room was very clean, staff was very friendly. The hotel is located right across from Disneyland and next to a Denny's and IHOP. The hotel charges $16 additional for parking. They do not offer free breakfast due to Covid at this time. The family room had 2 queen beds and a bunk bed. Check in is at 3pm, check out 11am although I was able to check in early.

This was my first time here and I've always stayed at the hotel next door, which is around the same price, but they were closed. First of all the room had no toilet paper, none in the room at all, the tissue holder cover fell off the wall, the remote didn't work, and the room smelt like dust, a lot!!, maybe from the air unit but it left me congested for 2 days.  On top of all that they had a sign at the check out counter about parking prices and what it will be for a second car. When I told them I had a second car they said they don't allow 2 cars. I didn't want to argue that they had a sign 5 feet away saying they do but they "let" me pay for a second car anyways.

pros: Close to Disneyland (5min walk), price is reasonable, staff is excellent, rooms are clean. Cons: extra resort fee when this is not a resort, limited parking (but valet on sight helps), rooms need a dresser to properly unpack clothes. Overall the pros outweigh the cons and I‚Äôd definitely stay here again.

We chose this hotel because we wanted one that was near Disney Adventure Park.  It is really just accross the street and it is very convenient not to have to ride the shuttle bus and go back and forth to the hotel anytime.  The double room was big with two queen size beds.  It has the usual amenities like fridge and coffee maker.  We only stayed one night so I cannot comment about house cleaning and staff as we did not have to deal with them.  Our check in was quick and efficient.  The room seems clean and very spacious, however, our room was located right beside the breakfast room and we could hear all the commotion in the morning.  Breakfast choice was minimal, can be better.  Front of the hotel is Denny's and the hotels beside also give you different choices of restaurants

This is by far the best hotel we‚Äôve stayed at for a Disney vacation.  We stayed in a room with bunk beds and it was perfect. The cleanliness alone makes me want to stay there every time. We enjoyed the pool, however it was a little chilly for us.

we loved this hotel....had a bottom floor, right at the back. Room was comfy, 2 queens and a bunk for 3 adults and 2 kids.The location for disneyland is perfect, closest we have stayed so far. The only thing I have to say, is the staff were not that helpful or friendly at all. we are used to staying in higher quality hotels, and used to real 'customer service'. these epeople could definintely use a course in that. I guess being that close to the park, they know that people are going to stay there no matter what, right? I would defintiely stay again, as we didnt; have to interact with them that often. Being able to just pop back acoss the street is worth it. I did laundry a couple of times, we were there for 6 nights, and even only having 1 washer and 1 dryer, I could get in

We stayed here for three nights on our trip to Disneyland in Dec 2018. It took me a while to finally review it. We picked the place because of it's location and price. I didn't know what to expect but it turned out to be pretty good. There were two queen beds and a very good size bunk bed for my two older ones and we asked for a crib for my then 2 year old. There were plenty of beds for a family of 5. The room had a fridge, a microwave and a safe. The hotel itself is pretty dated but the room was kept fairly clean. There was no elevator and we stayed on the 2nd floor (which we requested for), but getting the stroller up and down the stairs wasn't too bad. The continental breakfast like everyone else said was basic, and not much space to sit down and eat. What we did was grab

Del sol has everything that you need. Rooms are clean and the staff are awesome. They will do what ever to make your stay enjoyable. Very close to the Disneyland main entrance. Also there are many different restaurants to choose from.

Our extended family of 6 spent a week here in a family room and a separate king bed room.   It's a very basic motel with "loofah" towels and basic breakfast, but its clean, quiet and very close to Disneylands gate.  A special thank you to Kyle,  the night auditor. He was a fountain of information and very helpful

This hotel is kinda great! Price was decent, it was super clean and the best part..you are directly across the street from Disneyland so after a long day at the park, you have very few steps to make to get to your hotel. The breakfast was just cold cereal and toast so nothing special there. No biggie since we wanted to eat in the park anyway. My only complaint was that the floor and walls are not very thick and we had a lower room. It was right next to the breakfast area back in a nook and people have zero common sense or respect for others so at 6 am it started getting loud. The room above us sounded like they were doing an Irish jig in steel toe boots. We were only there to sleep and the rest was spent in the park so we just rolled with the noise. Aside from thin walls and

This was a great room with plenty of space. Entrance to Disneyland right across the road. 24 hr dennys right in front was very convenient. Rooms were clean and quiet. Laundry facilities on site was very handy. Parking is first in and was always full.

Summary Heading: Solid motel, great staff and location!
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights for a Disneyland trip.  The location is fantastic, and the room was pleasant - beds were comfy, room was quiet for a motel and well maintained.  The breakfast was basic, but plenty for a quick bite to tide you over through morning to enjoy a nicer lunch later in the parks.  I appreciated that it included hard boiled eggs for a protein source instead of only carbs.  We would happily stay there again for another trip to the parks.

This is a clean, well maintained, and very friendly place to stay. The people working the desk are always helpful and kind, and the rooms are pretty big, and always extremely clean. You really can‚Äôt beat the walk to the park, either. I wish there was more parking, the lot is small especially in comparison to how many rooms there are and one of my friends that came to stay had to park elsewhere, which would‚Äôve been nice to know about beforehand. Breakfast is small but kept well stocked. Bagels, waffles, hard boiled eggs, and cereal. Nothing too fancy but all tasted good.

Exactly what everyone else has been saying. Great location, clean rooms, pool food places on the main road. Breakfast was a small selection but honestly we didnt want to be too full going on all those rides. Excellent place to stay. Loved it.

Summary Heading: Stay here- same time and money
Summary: First time visiting Disneyland, did not want to have to take and Uber or have to walk much after being at the parks all day so went with this hotel and it was perfect. Double beds in a large room for 3 people, has fridge and microwave. Save yourself time and money by staying here, you pay more to stay further down the road at other places and after an exhausting day you‚Äôll be happy to walk 5 minutes top to your room. Took an Uber from the airport which was about $42 and about 30+ minutes away, didn‚Äôt have to pay for parking and you could have breakfast there or eat right across at Denny‚Äôs. Staying  here was so convenient for us adults I can only imagine how helpful it will be if you have children if you need to go back to the room throughout the day. Room was very clean, all I

I was there on my wifes birthday with my 3 grown kids I got a 6 person room which had 2 queen beds and a bunk bed, I though the room was not super large it did acommadate all of us, the price was great and it was just really close to the front entrance to disney land about a 2-3 minut walk people staff are great the room was quiet I definitly would stay there again only negative I saw was the breakfast could have been better.

Thrilled with the customer service. We checked in on Sunday night, got help with parking an additional car which was unexpected. The fee is $28 a day for the second car and only when they have room, but we were able to get a spot and were more than happy to pay the fee to have our vehicle close to us vs offsite lots. The room was clean, well stocked and we were able to get an extra blanket for those sleeping next to the air conditioning since it's always hard to regulate those units. The breakfast was minimalist but sufficient. It's close to the front entrance, right behind Denny's. We had a large group, 3 couples (adult children and spouses) and we had 1 room. It worked great. Would definitely stay here again. We have at this point stayed at every hotel on this stretch on

This is the perfect place to stay if you smoke and your olfactory senses are impaired. There is insufficient parking for the number of rooms and yet we could not walk to our room without passing 3 designated smoking areas close enough to one another that the smoke from adjacent smoking areas mingle over the pool. The first night our air conditioner blew hot air that smelled like old pee. Also, the windows don‚Äôt open. In the morning, the manager offered us a paltry discount and assured us the issues would be addressed. When we returned to our room, the AC was, in fact, blowing cold air...that smelled like old pee. They just renovated and yet in both our original room and the room they moved us to, there was rust on the bathroom fixtures. The renovations included making the hall

First time I ever stayed here. We were passing through and had to book last minute. It was so much better than we hope - real family atmosphere, friendly staff, great clean rooms with extra bunk beds. My only issue is they charge you $14 for parking each night and say nothing about it on the reservation system. However it so nice and amazingly cheap I didn‚Äôt care.

Well, I WILL NOT be booking at this hotel anymore!  I received a phone call earlier this morning, from a woman clerk.  She wanted to 'confirm' our reservation for 7/2/19.  I confirmed the reservation.  She asked if I was interested in a king room instead of a double queen room.  I told her no.  The reservation was for my daughter and myself.  She said okay and we concluded.   Three hours later, the manager called and stated that since I made the reservation two days ago (I have a confirmation number), they are unable to accommodate my reservation!!  Instead, they are going to move me and my daughter six miles away to another hotel:  'sister' hotel.  He stated that it was a MUCH BETTER hotel, and he would 'try' to get an upgraded room.   First, I made my reservation specifically

Summary Heading: 12 nights at the Del Sol in a family room. Fantastic!!
Summary: We had a family room, downstairs by the pool which was great for us.Breakfast was included each morning if we wanted it and the Hotel is very close to the Disneyland entrance which was fantastic when it was time to walk home after a busy day out!! Plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from, rooms were serviced every day. We loved our stay at the Del Sol. Would stay there again.

Rude nasty front desk help, So bothered that we were there. Down right mean. Will never never stay there again, Pitiful.I dont need at parade to be welcomed but the girls at the desk day or nite never made eye contact and acted like we were lower class citizens. Disneyland isnt a place to be mean. Everybody is so nice and helpful but these ladies were our and out vicious

We‚Äôve stayed at so many different hotels in the area and this hotel was by far the best and the best value. We had the family room with the bunk beds (which my kids enjoyed very much) The front desk and valet were very friendly and anytime we needed something they were extremely attentive and didn‚Äôt make us feel like a burden. Free breakfast included donuts, toaster waffles, toast, cereal, fruit and there were some hard boiled eggs and coffee, which was all great considering it‚Äôs free, you can‚Äôt be too picky. Denny‚Äôs is right in front of the hotel too so if you wanted legitimate breakfast, it‚Äôs just a few steps away. You obviously can‚Äôt beat the 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland. Thank you for such a positive experience!

The rooms were big and clean, better than they looked online. The room was dark and very quiet at night. I was nervous because we were right by the pool, but it wasn‚Äôt a problem at all. The bed was comfy and they had good pillow options. It was too rainy and cold for us to go on the pool. Breakfast was nothing exciting, but my kids enjoyed it. Literally 5 minutes from entering Disneyland. I will stay here again!

Myself and 4 of my coworkers traveled to Disneyland for a 3 day weekend. Bunk beds sleep someone 5' 9‚Äù easily.Great location! Wonderful staff! Fantastic time! Walking distance to Walgreens. Will visit again.

We stayed at this property at the end of our trip the location was close to Disneyland however the front desk clerk looked as if she hated her job no customer service whatsoever. She had posted parking charges to my room which did not have a vehicle and refused to adjust the parking off and charge to the correct room which had a vehicle. Her response was to give the party the cash for the parking so she would not have to refund the guest's credit card that she already had charged so unprofessional. The bed sheet had brown stains along with the towels, the refrigerator was making a loud sounds as if it was going to break down. When the maid serviced the room they took all bath towels and did not replace them. The breakfast rooms had two tables so we had to eat breakfast outside

This is a great place to stay , especially with families, there was 5 of us and it was perfect. Being so close to Disneyland is so convenient! They had a calendar with the time schedule which helps. Breakfast was included which is always a bonus ! The staff are lovely and very helpful. We will definitely be back!

I loved the location. We took the room with 2 queens and bunk beds. Bunk beds were great! Breakfast okay but in a very small room. Nice pool and hot tub. Tucked in enough that we didn't hear Disneyland noise. My biggest complaint was that on of the beds was the noisiest bed I've ever heard. Every time we moved, it moaned, groaned, and squeaked. Kept me up all night. If that is a problem for you, don't take room 215. I did not hear noise from the neighbors, so maybe the walls are well insulated... or we didn't have noisy neighbors. Who knows. Overall, I would stay again if I knew I wouldn't get that noisy bed.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during a 6 day California anniversary trip. We really loved it here! The staff was friendly, the rooms were spacious, updated and super clean. The breakfast was better than expected- eggo waffles, donuts, cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee & tea. The best part is the proximity to Disneyland. The hotel is right across the street from the main entrance. Literally a 5 minute walk. We would stay here again without hesitation. My only complaint, the towels were super thin and rough. New towels are desperately needed.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, bad maid service, only okay rooms
Summary: I stayed at Del Sol Inn back in 2005 and I remember thinking that it was a fine place to stay, as it provided only what you needed as a guest: bed, bathroom, fridge, microwave, close proximity to the park.  So I was happy to stay again as I figured it would be adequate at worst, and fantastic at best.  Let's start with the good thing: the front desk staff and parking attendants were kind, polite, and accommodating.  They were great.  I really appreciated the kind service, and the woman at checkout gave me some fresh cookies and Disney-themed Zip-loc bags.  I give the desk staff and parking attendants two thumbs up.  They are the saving grace of this review.  The biggest pain point of this trip is this: I came back to my room in the afternoon and was surprised to see that it had

Rooms seem updated from our last stay a few years ago. All was nicely clean and the front staff was friendly. Parking was crowded and charged per day but we had taken Uber from LAX so not a worry this trip. The breakfast wasn't bad with eggos and toast, hard boiled eggs, a couple cold cereals, instant oatmeal, and milk and juice.

Nice place to stay at okay prices. It is set back off Harbor BLVD so you avoid the masses as they arrive/leave Disney. 5 minute walk to park entrance.  Rooms seem to have been remodeled, probably getting ready for Galaxy‚Äôs Edge next year. Beds are okay, but feel great if you are exhausted from an full day at Disney.   However, craftsmanship leaves a lot to be desired. The plumbing is VERY VERY loud. Wether it is someone showering or using the toilet you hear the water running through the pipes and the walls especially when trying to sleep. And not only from your own room, but if the other rooms next to you or below you are using the bathroom.  The curtains they use for the bathtub don‚Äôt keep all the water in, no matter how much you try the floor gets wet.  Be careful with the

Summary Heading: A Good Location to Walk to Disneyland
Summary: The Del Sol is a good location to Disneyland it is across the road from the Entrance. The rooms are adequate a bit noisy with walkways outside door and cars just outside.The breakfast is not much. Donuts were okay no hot food except toast.

Fantastic location, one of the closest hotels to the Disneyland park entrance.   Stayed at the Del Sol with 3 kids and grandma; 2 queens + bunkbeds. Bunkbeds were great for the kids (stairs rather than ladder), but were not full-length twin mattresses, so bottom bunk was too short for grandma to sleep on as planned. No dresser in room, so clothes had to stay in suitcases; housekeeping promptly delivered 2 extra luggage stands when requested.   Hotel is only 2 floors, with no elevators. This was tricky with our fully loaded stroller! Windows in the room did not open (solid windows that weren‚Äôt designed to open), which made the room extremely stuffy if we didn‚Äôt have the door open; air conditioner worked well, however.   Room had microwave and fairly large mini-fridge. Continental

Family of four stayed here for Disney. Super close to entrance, and he room was spacious and clean for an affordable Disney option.  Basic breakfast included and cheap on site parking. Good family option.

Stayed here for a few days with my kids the rooms where a good size and very clean. The parking is very convenient. The only down side to it is that they don't have an elevator to go up and down. The breakfast is decent.

We stayed for 7 nights at Del Sol Inn recently. The stay was fabulous! All the employees of the resort were very friendly and super helpful! We always had plenty of towels and a clean room to come back to after touring Disneyland resort through the day. The valet attendants were excellent and so friendly. We had horrible delays and cancels of flights for our arrival day. We ended up arriving a full 12 hours later than we were supposed to as a result. The front desk attendant at Del Sol Inn was ready and waiting for us when we arrived. He was so helpful and cheery. It was so nice to arrive to after all the flight problems we experienced. Also we were sprinkled with pixie dust and upgraded to the bunk bed room!  We do appreciated this gift!  Thank you to all those at Del Sol Inn
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you had a perfect stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We try our best to make your stay the best possible. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope you are able to come back and visit us again soon!

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland. Large, clean rooms complete with fridge and microwave. Great beds. Nice pool. Small continental breakfast offered. You pay to park at the Del Sol and parking spaces are tight. Place is quiet at night. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Dennys and IHOB are right next door. Will definitely stay here again and will recommend to all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope you will visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for a perfect trip to Disneyland!
Summary: While booking this trip, I was looking for an affordable hotel with free breakfast that was within walking distance of Disneyland for a four-person bachelorette trip. This hotel was perfect.  ROOM: The hotel is an older property but it has been very well maintained and the hotel rooms have been updated recently with new counters and lighting fixtures. The bathroom sink/vanity was separate from the bathtub and toilet, which was great for getting ready in the morning. The beds are comfy (but we were also exhausted after spending our days in the park so I don't think it would've made a difference). There was a mini-fridge and microwave, both newer appliances. We asked for a room closer to the front of the property, which shaved about two minutes off our morning walks to get to the
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us! We hope you will visit again soon!

Summary: We just got home from an 8 night stay at the Del Sol Inn, and we loved our stay!  This is a rather small motel VERY close to the Disney entrances, set back from the road, behind Denny‚Äôs.   We had a family room with bunk beds, perfect for 2 parents and kids. The room was large and we had plenty of room.   There‚Äôs a basic breakfast, nothing fancy but enough to start your day.   Location! It is literally across the street from Disneyland. We loved being so close.   There‚Äôs a lovely pool and hot tub with plenty of towels and lounge chairs. It was nice to take a break from the heat and have a swim.   The staff are excellent! So friendly and helpful. We interacted mostly with Pablo, Guadalupe, Cristina, Jesus and Patricia and they were amazing.   Clean! We found everything (rooms,
Manager Response: Dear Jamie H,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you had a perfect stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We try our best to make your stay the best possible.   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope you are able to come back and visit us again soon!

Summary: We have stayed at a number of motels bear Disneyland, this is our new favorite.  The room was lovely, not super fancy, but aesthetically pleasing.  The pool was small but roomy enough and parking was reasonable.  The absolute best part is how close it was to the park and still totally reasonably priced.  We would definitely come back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us!  We hope you will visit again soon!

Summary: The housekeepers are not to be trusted. Use the safe or lose your valuables. Wallet with money was taken during the day after house cleaning had cleaned the room. Will not stay there again if you can't feel your things are safe.

This hotel is a hidden jewel directly across the street from Disneyland! We had a clean oversized and updated room. A most helpful staff with a restaurant beside it. An excellent bargain for the Disney area!
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad that you chose our hotel for your visit and enjoyed your stay here.   We hope you will visit again soon!

Summary: We stayed here last week for spring break. The location is great, just a 5 min walk to Disneyland.  They charge $11.00 a day to park, which most hotel/motels in the area do as well.  It‚Äôs valet parking because there are not enough spaces for each room. I don‚Äôt mind that, the valet‚Äôs where very nice and there was always one there if I needed to get my car key to get something out of my car.  The front desk staff where very friendly and gave us cookies when we checked in. üç™ Our room was a good size, it was clean but a bit dusty. We only noticed this when the A/C was on. My daughter was stuffy in the morning and my travel mirror had dust on it each day. Otherwise, it was clean.  House keeping came each day and we always had fresh towels.  The beds where very hard!! Not comfortable

Summary Heading: Location is a 5, Lodging is a 3
Summary: We stayed for a full week while we (2 adults, 2 4-yr olds) visited Disneyland. Check-in was easy, even as we arrived at about 11:00 pm.  The front desk attendant and parking attendants were very friendly.   We got lucky and were assigned a room on the first floor. The room was clean, but here are some observations: The bedding/comforter was very thin. I would've liked a heavier blanket.  Fortunately the room had bunk beds so we took the blankets off those if the bunks weren't being used by the kids. The microwave was super old and had a hard time making popcorn.  The outlets in the lamps between the beds couldn't hold plugs.  Phone chargers and hair dryer plugs would fall out.  The bathroom was impressive and looks to have been recently updated... looked really modern and clean.

This was our 3 stay and once again we were happy.  You can not beat the location.    The rooms are basic motel rooms but beds are comfy after long park days.  Rooms are large enough to be comfortable.  There is a safe in the closet and the sink is outside the bathroom so you can get ready while someone else is showering.    There also is a microwave and a small bar sized fridge in the room along with a coffee maker.  A breakfast room is located close to the office and has basics. Toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, donuts and apples and oranges.  Juice as well as coffee and tea are also available.  We just ran down and got coffee from there instead of making coffee in our room.    Parking is tight and valet only.  We didn‚Äôt park but the guys manning the valet were very friendly and
Manager Response: Dear tlccanada,   Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will be able to visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Just OK but with a terrible breakfast
Summary: Let's be honest. The hotel is just OK. Bed is good, bathroom is good. Local is good. What really bother me, was the breakfast. Come on! It a 50 room's hotel, but you can't put more than 12 persons on the breakfast room! And the food is bellow average. That's why my 3 stars rate.

Right by the crosswalk to go to Disneyland.  The rooms are your basic motel room, but enough space to move around and they were clean and comfortable.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Great price. Parking is a separate charge, but worth the small cost per day.
Manager Response: Dear Jolynn F,   Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will be able to visit again soon!

Summary: My sister and I stayed here on our last visit to Disneyland and we would probably stay again. It is located right across the street from the main entrance hub.  The rooms were decent, they had a continental breakfast which was average, and the staff were friendly. Overall, we had no complaints.
Manager Response: Dear v_becks5,   Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will be able to visit again soon!

Summary: Location is great. This is off harbor Blvd and only 2 hotels are closer to the crosswalk to the park. The room was clean and roomy for a family. We had 6 in one of the bunk bed rooms. Price was the best for the hotels within a 15 min walk radius. It is back from the street so almost no noise from the street or sidewalk but it could be noisy if you are on the first floor and people are loud at the pool, you will hear them.  customer service was excellent. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of 5 is that the breakfast room was tiny and there were few options beyond cereal, frozen waffles, toast, and donuts. I knew this before hand from reviews so I wasn‚Äôt surprised. Also it is good to know that parking is valet only because the lot is so small and if there are lots of vehicles
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie M,   Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will be able to visit again soon!

Summary: I stayed here when visiting Disneyland for two days in December. The location is perfect (across the road from the parks) and the staff were very kind and helpful. The rooms are very spacious, so perfect for families even though I was travelling by myself. The breakfast room is quite small, but there's a table/chairs in the bedrooms if you were in need of a seat. The breakfast was good for a quite bite (toast, fruit, cereal and pastries) before heading to the park.
Manager Response: Dear cmtallbot,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will be able to visit again soon!

Summary: ok, You're not going to get 'turn down' service in the evening, but if you're only mission is the Disneyland Parks... then you can't beat it.  It's as close as you can get.  Need something from the room that you forgot?  it's doable.  A little one needs a nap?  they're not far from the park gates.  You can still go back afterwards.  I've stayed at nicer places further away... and they're not worth it.  Go for the convenience.  NOTE:  I did upgrade to the bunk beds.  My daughter (who at 18 is too old for them)... loved it!  the bathroom was recently renovated and was nice.  (shower pressure is mediocre but that is probably due to all the drought restrictions).  If i go back... I'll stay here.

We love to stay here when we come to Disneyland.  It is right across the street from DL so we can nap in the afternoon if needed.  The rooms are large and the family room can sleep 6 comfortably.  The room and pool are very clean, hot tub is hot!  The employees are all wonderful and accommodating and the valet Pablo took great care of us.  Just get to breakfast early for the powdered donuts!
Manager Response: Dear Victoria D,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: For convenience and location to Disneyland, the Del Sol Inn, is perfect. When looking on the map, it doesn't give you the right perspective of how close you really are to Disneyland. It is right there and a good price. I was most impressed with the manager prior to coming to the hotel. I was looking for a accessibility in rooms and he was willing to find me another property if I needed one. With that, he offered a shower chair and that worked perfectly. He went above and beyond for accommodating us. We are so appreciative.   The outside of the hotel really becomes a huge parking lot. It doesn't give the property much to look at, but I think most of the guests are there to be at Disneyland. They offer a continental breakfast. It is small, but can get you started on your day.
Manager Response: Dear MNfamilytravelers,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We really enjoyed our extended stay at the Del Sol.  It was an excellent location as it was so close to the Disneyland Park entrance and Downtown Disney.  We loved the pool and hot tub here.  The breakfast was small, but was all we really needed.   The room was more spacious then expected and was laid out really well.  We appreciated the staff and all of their help to make our stay great.  We will definitely come back here.
Manager Response: Dear Carolyn A,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Pros and Cons of Del Sol
Summary: We stayed from Monday, Nov. 20 until Sat., Nov. 25, 2017.  Let me begin with the Pros: The location is only 2 buildings down from the pedestrian entrance to DL. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. Now for the Cons: We stayed in a King room. It was right on the corner where the stairs were. Very noisy at all hours if any other hotel guests or traffic was near. The lights in the parking lot are very, very bright and stay on from dusk till dawn. It looked like daylight through the shutters. The room is very small and dated. There were liquid stains on the couch that didn't look like they'd been attended to. The other furniture in the room was chipped, worn or warped. The bed...it was the MOST uncomfortable bed we've ever slept in. Extremely soft and no support. I ended

Summary Heading: great location.  nice people working at the front desk.  great price.
Summary: I have been to Disneyland 14 times and have stayed someplace different every time.  The Del Sol Inn was a very good price and excellent location.  The breakfast was standard continental breakfast, something quick and easy to eat.  I just wish they had water available at breakfast.  The room was quiet and clean and the bed was very comfortable.  I have nothing really to complain about. I would stay here again for the right price.

The pros: room is clean, beds are comfortable. Cons: Fridge doesn‚Äôt keep anything cold, no elevator, so you‚Äôre picking up your stroller and carrying it up the stairs. We originally booked for 2 nights. For $189 a night (as you can see). On Monday, we went up to the front desk to see if we could stay an extra day. The lady gave us a good rate and all was well. Until I got the bill. I was charged $207 before tax for a room I booked at $189 before tax.  Complete refusal to make it right. Too shady for me. Won‚Äôt be back. Many other hotels along the Disneyland entrance side to deal with this.

If you want to stay close to Disney park entrance, this is the place. We stayed for five nights and would walk back from the park twice a day to eat, take a quick break and freshen up. This is not a high end hotel but it is clean, safe and the staff is friendly. I thought I would be bothered by having to leave my car key with the valet but it was no biggie. I actually really appreciated staying at a smaller motel than one of the huge mega motels surrounding it. If we take another Disneyland trip I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear rookiegrl,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: First of all this hotel is our home away from home. My family and I love staying here. this is our 5th time coming this year. we have been coming here to Del Sol Inn for about 3 years now. I highly recommend this hotel, they remodeled all the rooms and they look really nice! the staff in office ALL of them know me and ALL are friendly and respectful. Another thing they are pretty much across the street from Disneyland! I love this place and we will be coming here probably for a LONG TIME! great rates and close to Disneyland nice rooms! cant beat it!
Manager Response: Dear morenoyadira100,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here for a few nights on our trip to Disneyland.  We have four kids and it fit everyone comfortably without having to get creative. I liked the bunk bed option, which was a nice change of pace from the sometimes-dubious sofa bed.  The room was very large and clean.  The bathroom was nicely configured with toilet and shower in a separate room from the sink and fridge/microwave area.  We did have an issue with a clogged sink late one night, but management was able to send someone out the next morning.  And like everyone says, you can't beat the location!  When you have young kids it's so nice to be able to hop back from the parks for afternoon naps and weird potty training issues.  Breakfast is basic, but the kids sure loved the mini-donuts.  I'd stay here again when we
Manager Response: Dear meisum,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We spent 4 nights at the Del Sol, Anaheim and it was even better than expected.  Because the hotel is actually behind Denny's on South Harbour Blvd,  it was very quiet and a great place to relax at the end of a long day at the Park. We had a king room which had been renovated, it was very spacious, as was the bathroom.   The staff were very friendly, helpful  and courteous and held our bags until our room was available.   They have a free breakfast and though basic, is enough to get you started for the day.  The location to Disneyland and nearby restaurants and price makes it a perfect place to stay and we will definitely stay at the Del Sol again.
Manager Response: Dear JEDNewcastle,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I wish we could have given more stars but the lack of communication and the promises made to me by the staff is where the stars come off. We booked our reservations weeks out and requested the bottom floor because we have two under two. This hotel has NO ELEVATOR, which we knew about hence the request. We have a double stroller and after a long day at the parks we did not want to carry both babies upstairs and come back for the double stroller. When we called the morning of we spoke to Nenetzen (sp?), requested a crib and wanted to make sure they would be able to honor our first level request and also let them know we would be checking in late, we were told the crib would be in our room (it was) and we would get the first level. I also called 30 minutes before arrival to also

Great little hotel, clean, mostly quite. Only issue I had were kids running up and down the outer walkways are not the hotels fault disrespectful parents are to blame. Don‚Äôt depend on the ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù to be a big to-do. It‚Äôs basic.  But Denny‚Äôs is a min walk away. The pool and hot tub are clean and well maintained.  I will be staying there again.
Manager Response: Dear AZR6Lady,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: nice hotel close to park, behind Dennys, rooms are basic but cant bet the price and the location, parking is valet only and parking lot is small.The breakfast was vary basic and the breakfast bar was small with long lines. But you are paying for the location and one block walk to Disney
Manager Response: Dear Ray G,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This hotel doesn't have parking unless you ballet, it isn't cheep, they say they serve breakfast, it's only dried out rolls, fruit that's going bad, juice and coffee. Not worth the money! The staff isn't friendly either.

I have seen this small motel across from Disneyland many times and did not think much of it but I snagged a last minute reservation on Priceline so I decided to try it out.  I was pleasantly surprised the family rooms with queen beds and bunks were spacious and comfortable the staff friendly and accommodating.  I liked the fact that they kept the property well lit so coming back from Disneyland late at night was good and all their windows had shutters that could be closed tight. Will stay here again if I can get an online reservation from them.  I believe that if you really want to try this place you should try their own website as a lot of their business is repeat visitors and they do not put many of there rooms on line.
Manager Response: Dear Christena W,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Excellent location. Disneyland across the street.  Denney's next door along with a variety of other restaurant's.  Kind front desk clerks, in particular, Nenetzen, went above & beyond what was required. We had checked in at a competitors motel a mile away less than an hour before, due to the rude staff their we decided to take a chance to see if Del Sol had any vacancy's, as we had stayed their a few times before. As luck would have it, Nenetzen was able to find us a room.  Very comfortable beds, two queen and bunk beds.  Nice.  Very clean.   Valet well mannered. We stayed four nights. Look forward to staying here again.   Joe and Julie
Manager Response: Dear joesjul,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Had a great time here, close to everything you could ask for in Disneyland, room was comfortable with two adults and two kids, pool and hot tub was great after big long days out, easy to access buses for LEGOLAND and SeaWorld, bathroom was small but who cares, you only use toilet and shower in there anyway! Breakfast was enough to fill the kids up till lunch, have booked again here for March 18
Manager Response: Dear katian64,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Very convenient hotel...across street from Disneyland. Easy walk to the front gate to parks and downtown Disney Nice remodel...perfect for family Disney stay! Will definitely stay again! Reasonable valet parking.
Manager Response: Dear Cheriann H,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great Location to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed three nights at Del Sol Inn for our Disneyland trip.  Great value and location.  The front desk personnel, Jesus & Patricia, were very helpful.  We checked in at midnight from a late flight and our room was ready without any problems.  Two queen beds and a bunk bed.  The room was far bigger than we needed for two people but would be great for family of 5 or 6.  The free continental breakfast was basic - fruit loops & corn flakes, apples, oranges, bread for toast, toaster waffles,  hard boiled eggs and donuts.  Juice, milk, tea, & coffee. The pool and jaccuzzi were clean and felt good after hours in the parks. The best part was the location - literally across the street from the Disneyland park entrance - closer walk than Paradise Pier.  Less than a 5 minute walk from
Manager Response: Dear hicksspa,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Stayed 3 nights, we had a family room 2 Queen beds& bunk beds, with microwave,fridge with small freezer box,p  nice pool area good free parking just a a short walk to Disney great location, no hassle and staff were very friendly and helpful, they have mobility scooter charger ports for free to great.
Manager Response: Dear Cazzyben,  Thank you so much for your review. We are so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you here again for your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Friendly clean and a location that can't be beat!
Summary: Both the front desk staff and specifically the valet were so helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and we can not say enough about location. So close to Disney you can come back for swim when it's too hot.
Manager Response: Dear Sixtysgirl,   Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are indeed right across the street from Disneyland so very glad that you were able to take advantage of being so close with breaks from your busy day at Disneyland.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times. I love how close it is to Disneyland and that I do not have to hassle with the trams. They recently remodeled and it is really nice. I wish they did have a better breakfast selection.
Manager Response: Dear Amy A,  Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and liked the remodel. Thank you for your suggestion regarding our breakfast selection. We appreciate all guest feedback as it helps us to improve our offering for all future guests.   We hope to see you again soon on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Cute, quiet, and close to Disney!
Summary: I stayed at the Anaheim Del Sol from August 26th to September 2nd, 2017 on a sibling trip. We arrived at the hotel before check-in so I was planning on leaving our bags at the front desk and exploring Downtown Disney .  Pablo at Front Desk informed us that we could check in but they didn't have our room option available instead Pablo upgrade my brother and I from a 2 queen room to a Family Suite! (2 queens, 1 bunk bed, fridge, microwave)! It was an amazing start to our vacation and my brother was so excited to sleep in the top bunk! Thank you so much Pablo for providing us with a magical start to our vacation!  The breakfast area is on the smaller side but well stocked I recommend going early just to avoid a pre-park crowd that can occur. The breakfast options are 2 types of
Manager Response: Dear Kaitie P,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad that you had such a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff member Pablo. he is a great member of our team and we are very luck to have him. so glad he was able to make your vacation more magical.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you here again soon!

Summary: My sister and I stayed here in January.  I was a little bit nervous when I booked it because I have never stayed here before and sometimes hotels aren't as good as they look online.  My sister and I were both pleasantly surprised.  The rooms were renovated and looked nice and they were clean.  It was close to Disneyland and we loved not having to walk far after a long exhausting day of fun at the park.  They were renovating where breakfast was while we were there but they took good care of us. They gave us free breakfast vouchers to Denny's which is just in front of the hotel.  Everyone that worked there were very friendly.  We really enjoyed our stay and plan to stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear BlaineTW,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay with kids for Disney vacation!
Summary: We stayed here the beginning of August 2017. We were able to park in the parking lot prior to check-in, spend the day at Disney and check-in late that night. Our car was parked and cared for by Hoang the valet. He was excellent! We left all our luggage in the car for the day with no trouble. Hoang kept our car and valuables safe and had excellent customer service. The room we had was in excellent condition and very clean and comfortable for our stay. We would DEFINATLEY stay here again! Thanks Del Sol and Hoang!
Manager Response: Dear Brittany W,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our valet staff member Hoang. He is a great member of the team and we are so lucky to have him at our hotel. We will definitely pass on your compliments to his manager.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next Disneyland vacation!

Summary: Del Sol Inn is one of the best hotels I have ever got the pleasure of staying in. When we arrived staff was very welcoming, our room was perfect,clean we were very satisfied. The valet were extremely helpful and nice. Hoang our valet was so awesome he was such a character and a joy to be around. We will be booking this hotel everytime we come to disneyland..
Manager Response: Dear Dunkinfam5,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so honored that that you consider us one of the best hotels you have stayed at. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon for your next Disneyland Vacation!

Summary: We stayed here for a week during our Disney Vacation. Although our booking wasn't correct when we got there, they immediately made it right and upgraded us. We were even let into one of our rooms early.  This is a very comfortable clean place to stay. The rooms are sizable, the wifi is good, staff is friendly. There is a small pool and hot tub, we used them a little, that's not what we were there for.   Continental breakfast is the normal a few fruits, toaster waffles, doughnuts, cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee & milk.  It is a 3 min walk to the gates of the parks. It is the closest most convenient place I have stayed to date.  My only complaint would be that the bed was hard.  There is an $11 a day valet fee. The parking lot was very well lit and safe. The valet Hoang  was
Manager Response: Dear Us3ts,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We love the Del Sol Inn, this was our third stay!   We always find the staff so friendly and welcoming!  They even let us check in a few hours early. The hotel was just renovated, we found new windows, doors, carpet, bedding and mattresses.  The bathroom had new tile flooring, granite shower and counter tops.  We loved the new look! we did a family room with bunks, but found that the bunks aren't full size and are only suitable for younger kids, my 13 year old barely fit in length.  The room was very clean and we came home from the park each day to a tidy room, house keeping is very friendly! This hotel is clean, steps away from the Disneyland entrance and affordable for family's on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear Stacey H,  Thank you for your wonderful review! We are so glad that you had such a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: Fantastic for visiting Disneyland. Directly across the road, right next to Denny's, IHOP, Captain Kids Buffet... lots of room, pool, great staff, public transport, Uber, walk to shops and many other restaurants... really well priced and will definitely stay again
Manager Response: Dear Fiona H,  Thank you so much for your fantastic review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We try our best to provide a great vacation for all of our guests.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Good value and super helpful staff
Summary: We recently stayed at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn for a Disney trip and were super happy with our choice. The hotel is set back from Harbor, almost directly across from the parking lot bus and footpath entrance to Disney. This made it much quieter and of course, the closeness to the parks was a boon. The room, though small (we had a standard King room), was clean, and had all the amenities we needed (fridge, microwave and an AC that cranked!). Since we were on the second floor above the carport, the room was super quiet too. The breakfast was OK, cereals, donuts, coffee, pretty basic. It was still nice to start the day with a little bite than have to eat out each meal. The staff, however, was what made this standout for us. Our valet, Hoang, was super friendly and went above and
Manager Response: Dear Rachel E,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are very luck to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to recommend us to other families traveling to Disneyland. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Nice motel in front of Disneyland
Summary: In our family visit to Disney Anaheim we stayed in Del Sol Inn. It was a good choice. The room was clean and quite wide to accommodate 3 adults and 1 child. The staff was friendly and did not hesitate to provide more sheets or blankets to the room. We did not have breakfast there since we heard that it was poor so we rather had breakfast in IHOP. Nearby there are plenty of places to have breakfast or dinner too, for example Denny's is just few steps away. I would come back to this motel if I visit again Disney!
Manager Response: Dear NewlyTina,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: If you want a five star hotel, this isn't it, but if you want a short walk into Disneyland or California Adventure, this is perfect. The hotel was clean, and daily maid service did a great job. We booked a room with bunk beds and loved having the bunk beds for the kids. The pool is small, but we didn't go for the pool. The breakfast is fairly minimal--but again, that's not why we went. Be aware that parking is valet only, and there is a parking fee for each night. This may not be a stellar place, but if you want somewhere clean and comfortable to sleep close to Disneyland, this is an excellent option.
Manager Response: Dear Amy C,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and found our location to the parks to be convenient.    We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The parking attendant Hoang was great! He was very helpfull and called me a ride to the train station. This hotel was clean and very close to everywhere i wanted to be. The breakfast wasnt much but enough to get me on my way. I do wish that the breakfast started at 6 am instead of 7 am.
Manager Response: Dear tink3180,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We very much enjoyed staying so close to Disneyland! It was handy to be right across the street. We needed to leave one day earlier than planned and they were very gracious to allow that to happen with no extra charge.
Manager Response: Dear Gailem68,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: When you book a room within steps of the crosswalk to the entrance to Disneyland, you just know that you're paying for the location. I've tried a number of them over the years and perhaps that set my expectations at a certain level.  So that said, I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived early. They had called to confirm our arrival and I had said we might be early, so they did - really, truly did - have a room ready for us. Everyone we worked with was polite and friendly. The room was clean, tidy and had all the basic amenities for that area. I was pleased at the reasonable size of the fridge, and there were plenty of towels.  Sure, the location can't be beat. But there are a good handful of hotels at that intersection, and this one was comparably nicer than I had come to expect.
Manager Response: Dear Izzytart,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: What can I say, great location ,5 minute walk to disney security check at a snails pace. Clean rooms ,2 queens and a bunk bed, small heated pool to cool off. close to dennys, mcdonalds, capt Kidds buffet ,Panera bread. Parking was 11.00 a day, and valet only, breakfast was cramped , could use another toaster in there to speed things up, but hey im not complaining its free. we had a ground floor room ,next to the pool. 24 hour laundry room. would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Perrymahoe,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests and thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We usually stay at the Anaheim Hotel but were disappointed last visit, so decided to try something new. Because we got a good rate, we thought we would give the Del Sol a try.   We had to have a ground floor because of my mom's wheelchair. We were leery because of noise from room above us, but really was no problem. We heard them a few times but nothing too bad.   The room was very clean and housekeeping did a good job. You can't beat the distance from Disney gates. Was so nice to go back and forth easily.  The wifi was fine. Fridge and microwave worked well. Beds were a bit on the hard side but got used to it.  My only complaint is that they have no lobby restroom. We had to wait in the lobby for our shuttle to the airport since it was after checkout. They would not let us use
Manager Response: Dear Grace C,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our housekeeping staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you sharing you experience here with other travelers and hope you will visit again soon.

Summary: Stayed here for our trip to Disneyland, the location was a plus, the rooms were nice and clean, friendly staff, the continental breakfast was the bare minimum. The pool was nice but to small for that big of a hotel, the only con I have about this hotel is the parking, you have to valet park and if you need anything out of your car you have to go get the keys from the valet desk, get your items and take the keys back or if you want to run and grab some food or whatever you just can't get in your car so it was a bit of a hassel and they do charge $11.00 a day for parking but the valet attendants were all very nice.  Overall it was a nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Rene875,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and our location, right across the street from Disneyland. We hope you will visit us again soon.

Summary: We typically stay at a higher end hotel but due to the ages of my niece's children, we wanted to stay closer to the parks.  After looking at various hotels across the street, we decided on the Del Sol Inn.  The valet guys were friendly and helpful.  We were greeted at the front desk with cookies for the kids.  We immediately felt at home.  We loved that the sink was separate from the toilet and tub.  It made it easier for us to coordinate between showers and teeth brushing.  The closet was nice and big.  We used it as a pantry for all of the snacks we brought for the kids.  The pool was the perfect temperature for the kids to play in.  The walk to and from the park was the perfect distance and not to harsh on the legs.  There were two things we had to work around.  The
Manager Response: Hello Pvang380,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel to be super convenient to the Disneyland Resort.   Thanks for sharing your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again very soon!

Summary: The staff are very friendly and helpful. Great little heated pool and hot tub. The price is right and I love that the main entrance to both amusement parks is directly across the street! we will definitely be staying there again!
Manager Response: Dear Sgoss1,  Thank you for your great review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: My daughter and I came on a spontaneous trip. We had an early flight, so we arrived early to the hotel on 6/15. The front desk person was extremely helpful and very sweet. She let us leave our luggage while we played at the park, we returned back to the hotel around 2 and our room was ready. I felt very safe, as we had a room above the lobby, a big plus because it was just us two. The location is great, it was directly across the street. I would definitely come back! Thanks again!
Manager Response: Dear Laurittac,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We strive to offer all of our guests the best value and service. Thank you for your compliments to our Front Desk Agent!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We spent three nights at the Del Sol Inn. The good parts are it was really right across the street from Disneyland. We did not have to get in the car, just walked over and into the park.  The pool at the motel is nice, not big but a good place to cool off and is very clean. There is a very minimal but okay for children who can get by with cereal and toast. They also have Coffee, OJ, store bought donuts, not bakery donuts, two types of dry cereal, milk, hard boiled eggs etc. It is served in a room that is really too small. It has a few tables but they do need a bigger place. My son got the room behind the little breakfast room. For him and his two boys, it was very dark and had a window looking out into a dark walkway. The room was 160.00 before tax, resort fee, and parking.
Manager Response: Dear Puggiegirl,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback, we are always trying to improve our offering to provide the best experience for our guests. We hope you will consider giving us another try our your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Really enjoyed our two night stay here, literally less than a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. 24 hour Dennys in the same parking lot and you can order out. Be prepared for the extra fees like mandatory valet for $11 per night. Also, expect noise from the foot traffic but it's just excited kiddos. $404 out the door for 2 nights with 2 queen beds and bunk beds, plus a small fridge, microwave, and a safe. Very friendly staff, as well. We'll stay here next visit for sure.
Manager Response: Dear BaseballDad505,  Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: Stayed there for my most recent RunDisney event. I like to stay close by since we have to walk over at 4:30am...it's just a little more convenient to stay across the street on Harbor blvd. Over all its a nice, clean hotel. Small and quiet. Its pretty far in from Harbor blvd. If you have to Uber or Lift anywhere, it's difficult for them to find you of you stay/wait near the lobby. We had to walk out to the Dennys which is right in from of the hotel. Staff was nice and tended to our needs. I would stay again.   They do have a laundry room for you to use as well.
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer Y,  Thank you for your great review! We are so glad to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We hope you had a great time at your RunDisney Event.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location when travelling with young children!!
Summary: Our family (3 adults and 2 young children) had a ground floor family room. It was exactly as in the pictures.   The kids enjoyed the bunk beds, and took turns in who slept in the top bunk.   As we stayed for 6 nights we missed having drawers to put our clothes in (didn't think of that when we booked) so had to live out of our suitcases the whole time.
