A small table to sit at to eat meals would have been nice also, but would not have fit in the room. There is a small desk in the room, but not suitable to eat at.   Unfortuately when we were there, there were some inconsiderate guests who let their children play in the pool area unsuperivised at night (our room was opposite the pool) so we had to put up with shouting and yelling (they were having fun, but we were not having fun
Manager Response: Hello 77Natasha77,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us. We hope to see you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Best value hotel in the Disneyland area!
Summary: Before I write this five star review, let me explain why my opinion matters.  Me and my family have been coming to Disneyland about 4 times a year every year for about the last 10 years.  We have stayed at multiple hotels near Disneyland and have a lot to compare with the Del Sol Inn.  To name a few we have stayed at the Clarion, Desert Inn and Suites, both Super 8's, Eden Roc, Riviera, Best Western Stovall Inn, and many more. Del Sol Inn exceeds every hotel that I have stayed at in comfort, cleanliness, location, practicality, and value.  As I am writing this I am enjoying my 4th visit in a row staying at this wonderful hotel.  To start with the rooms are immaculately clean.  They have a sleek contemporary look with a modern decor.  They  have shutters instead of curtains and
Manager Response: Hello Jteninty,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you have such great stays at our hotel. We appreciate all of your feedback and have let the manager know about your breakfast suggestions, and thank you for helping us to improve. We strive to offer the best service to all of our guests. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with other travelers!  It is our pleasure to be your home away from home during your visits to Disneyland and look forward to many more years of having you has our guest.   See you on your next visit!  Sincerely, Del Sol Inn Staff

Summary Heading: Clean and very close to the parks
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights, place is clean and tidy. Beds comfortable. Very close to the park. Breakfast is basic. Good value for money. Family friendly place. Happy to recommend.  We didn't go in the pool, had no time for it.  Good friendly staff, they arranged transport to take us to Anaheim train station.
Manager Response: Hello Karishma_nz,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for recommending us to others! We try our best to offer the best service and amenities for our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback. We hope to see you again soon on your next visit!

Summary: Very impressed with the layout and quality of our double queen room #204.  The room was spacious. The tile work, shutters, and moldings nicely accented the room and bathroom. I liked the clever animal character folded towels.  We were told that the carpet is being replaced in all the rooms. The hotel is near the crosswalk into Disneyland, so very convenient location wise. The breakfast offering is the basic continental breakfast, though we did not partake.  For us, the bed was a bit firmer than we are used to. We have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor with similar pricing and found the room at Del Sol to be a better value.
Manager Response: Hello Utahman0,   Thank you for your email. We are very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and found us to be a better value than nearby hotels. We strive to offer the best service and amenities for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback here with other travelers and hope to see you again soon for your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: We were happily surprised on this hotel.  It's right across from the entrance to Disneyland.  Free continental breakfast was typical continental. Very clean hotel. All newly painted and carpeted. Nice pool and hot tub. We had the kids room with bunks....2 queen beds and 2 bunkbeds. Kids loved their own beds.  Free wifi in our room which was usually really good....sometimes it would drop but not very often. The staff were very pleasant and the service was great. They were very knowledgeable and helped us with anything we needed.  Hotel has a room to put your belongings in if you are staying later than check out time which we needed so that was awesome.  Denny's was right in front of the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Laurie1958,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to recommend our hotel to other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights during spring break. Loved the room with 2 Queen beds and bunk beds for our family of 5.  Very clean. Great friendly service. Kids loved the hard boiled eggs, donuts and muffins at breakfast. Will definitely stay again on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear Erin G,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We are also glad to hear you enjoyed our free breakfast.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here and we look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: ‚ú™ BEST LOCATION ‚ú™ Clean, Bunkbed, fridge & microwave ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
Summary: I wouldn't say this is 5-star hotel, but it's Clean!  Older, but updated.  It's wedged in behind the Denny's.  But right across the street from Disney entry.  We loved it here!  ~ Pro's ~ * Right in front of the crosswalk that takes you into the park * Slept 5 of us comfortably.  We had to double beds & a bunk bed.  Our teenagers loved that.  WE always go back and forth between reserving 2 rooms, but then we have to split as parents or our teens on their own.  So having the bunk bed in there was a PLUS. * Fridge (although small - but we needed it) * Microwave - for a quick hot cereal in the morning. * Our room key were the keyless entry - so we could store them in with our Disney lanyard.  That way if anyone needed to go back - they could. *  Served a continental breakfast, but

This property is truly ACROSS THE STREET from the pedestrian walkway into the main esplanade for Disneyland and Disney California-great for tired feet at the end of the day! Many places state that they are "across the street" or "close" and then offer a shuttle on the street -if you need a shuttle- you are NOT CLOSE and sure you may be across the street ...from the backside of Disneyland...so be careful.  Check in was at 3pm. Parking is in a very small lot but the lot is contained off of the street and it is Valet parking so you don't have to worry about parking the car.  We were also able to access our car with no problem while we stayed there and the valet staff were very helpful and nice. The room was small in comparison to some places (true to the pictures on their website

You can't beat the location, literally at the traffic light in front of the main park entrance.  This is a small hotel with basic no frills accommodations. Pros: - friendly staff - location - recently updated rooms - accommodates up to 6 at an affordable price  Cons: - parking is $11/day valet only and the lot is small so the cars are generally double parked.  This is only an issue if you are planning to visit other locations during your stay or need to access your vehicle often. - noise - the hotel is shaped like a horse shoe with the pool in the center.  Plumbing from other rooms is noisy.  It's pretty loud until after 10.  Tip: run the AC or fan to mask the noise.  - breakfast is bare bones: coffee/oj/milk, cereal, hard boiled eggs, donuts, bread, Pre made toaster waffles,

Summary Heading: Disneyland 1 night stay after 5 nights in Grand Cali
Summary: For a budget hotel I would stay here again. No, it's not a resort but breakfast, wifi, location, staff was very polite and professional, pretty good bang for your buck. We wanted to add a day to our trip and the Grand Cali was booked.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, great for family!
Summary: Our family stayed at the Del Sol Inn for 3 nights in March 2017.  We are a family of 5 and booked a family room... We were not disappointed.. with the 2 queen beds & bunks beds.. each kid had their own bed... Awesome!  The room was clean, beds comfortable and the property very clean and the staff friendly.   Location, location, location... Being right across the street from the Disneyland entrance made it easy to come in and out during the day!   Nice pool area and hot tub... small but nice and clean.   The biggest disappointment about this property is the included breakfast bar.. very small room and poorly laid out... only open 7-9am (some days Disney opens at 7 and we couldn't get breakfast) and the choices are extremely limited and even then by 8:30am there was little left to

I was so delighted with my room I have mobility issues and need room, the staff put me in a room with extra room for the scooter a big bathroom with a seat for the bathtub!  The room was clean and nice and I did not have to pay extra for the fridge and microwave.  Breakfast was basic but fine and you can't beat the location.  I did not mind the parking fee of $11 + dollars a day because the guys valet the cars and are there 24 hours a day. Basically being with the cars and on site. The location is perfect too it's right across the street from the entrance to Disney and California Adventure
Manager Response: Hello DGramze,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We try hard to offer the best service to all of our guests and we are so glad that we were able to do that for you.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you here again soon!

Summary: Loved it! I would definitely stay here again. Everyone was very nice, desk clerks, car attendants, house keeping staff, they were all great. We had 5 of us in a double queen room w/bunk beds. It was a good size, plenty of space. Located very close to the Disney land gates. Lots of restaurants nearby. Pool area was nice. Everything was clean.
Manager Response: Hello Victoria,  Thank you for your review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are also glad to hear that you found our rooms to be spacious and clean.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.   We hope to see you here again soon!

Summary: Wow i was so happy with our stay everyone was so nice, the place was clean, room was big for our family of 6,the location was grate 5 min walk to Disneyland, the price was the best! Thank you! ill definitely be going back now that wer seasons pass holders.
Manager Response: Dear Victoria M,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad that you had a wonderful stay with us. We pride ourselves on offering the best service for our guests.   Thank you for sharing your review with other travelers. We look forward to all of your future visits!

Summary: We stayed three nights this week.  service was great hotel was directly across the street from the park and all was great!   The room was a family room we had 2 queens and a bunk bed which worked out great.  Breakfast was the basic fare toast, waffles, donuts, cereals juice and coffee.  Denny's next door is very convenient.  I would suggest a top floor the floors above a ground floor are super squeaky.  Not a quiet hotel by any means but being at Disneyland from open to close we were exhausted and slept great.  Beds were comfortable.  Thanks Del Sol Inn we will see ya the next time we come to town.
Manager Response: Dear Terri R,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are very proud to be in the perfect location for Disneyland vacations and appreciate your positive feedback.   Thank you for sharing your experiences here with other guests. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The del Sol Inn, which is almost directly across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland, has been a hotel we've stayed at numerous times. After nearly a year's absence, we returned to discover that it has been renovated and updated. The room had a new bathroom, new moldings, carpeting, and most importantly, had been reconfigured for a more spacious feel. There's also a private safe for securing your valuables. Parking is now $11 a day but is 100% valet, which removes some of the fear of door dings or parking lot bruises. Staff is friendly and helpful. There's a small breakfast each morning with the standard donuts and coffee.  Good value for the convenience of being so close to the Park!
Manager Response: First and foremost welcome back to the Del Sol Inn. We truly appreciate your loyalty to our hotel and we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay in our newly renovated rooms. We are also glad we were able to make your stay that much better by improving our parking to 100% valet. It was an absolute pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to be your home away from home when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Made reservation last minute trip to Disneyland. Upon check in Neznethene was great, she remembered seeing my reservation  I made that morning.  I haven't stayed at this hotel in awhile.  Rooms are updated, very nice, clean.  Neznethene even remembered me when I came back to get my room key,  at check out and retrieving my luggage. Across from Disneyland no need to catch shuttle to park.  Will be returning to this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Troy H,  Thank you for your great review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff member Neznethene. She is a great member of our team and we are lucky to have her.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We recently visited Del Sol Inn.  We'd been there before and had a great experience.  We booked early so that we would be assured of getting a room.  It is right across the street from Disnelyland so it was nothing to walk into the park.. In addition, there is a Denny's next door for meals.  They had recently remodeled so it was even better than before.  Nenetzen was at the desk.  She was competent, friendly, and efficient.  Once again she met all of our travel needs, and made our experience that much better.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to the Magic Kingdom!
Manager Response: Hello Warren_Love,  Thank you very much for your great review! We are so glad to hear that you had another wonderful stay with us. We strive to offer the best service to all of our guests and we are so glad we were able to do that for you. Thank you for your compliments to our Front Desk Agent Nenetzen. She is a great member of our team and we are lucky to have her.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you here again soon for your next visit!

Summary: After a horrible experience at Anaheim main gate inn on West Rd. (We left after immediately walking in) and was able to find a room at Del Sol. We always stay here when we visit and not sure why we went astray. As soon as we pulled up we felt like we were home and walking into the newly renovated room was the icing on the cake! We were welcomed with cookies at check in and the rooms are spacious. The atmosphere is family friendly and the staff is exceptional. It's only a few minute walk from Disneyland and Dennys is also conveniently located right in front. We will ALWAYS return.
Manager Response: Hello Mhorta0518,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad that you found your way back to us and had another great visit. We loved to hear that you liked the new renovated guest rooms and thank you so much for your compliments to our staff.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to greeting you again on your next visit!

Summary: Great place to stay for Disneyland. Nice updated rooms, free breakfast, cozy pool and hot tub. The pool area was my hang out when we took our mid day break from Disneyland.  Which I recommend. Also give her kids a chance to have a nap for the other half of the day. They were even kind enough to upgrade our room so the kids could have a bunkbed. The rooms have refrigerators and microwaves so we were able to buy inexpensive lunch materials at the store and save money by eating just before naptime at the hotel. Internet is very spotty hard to connect to from the room but was able to go to the lobby Where I got good connection so I could get some work done. Not that big of deal. Who really wants the web when you have Disneyland?
Manager Response: Dear dvcurtis,  Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear that you had a great stay with us. We are in the perfect location for a midday break from Disneyland and are glad that you were able to take advantage of that. I apologize for the problem you had connecting to the Wi-Fi, We will definitely have our IT department make sure the Wi-Fi is functioning properly in all areas. I appreciate you letting us know.   We thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and hope to see you again soon for your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: Every visit to Disneyland is a must stay at Del Sol Inn.  The staff is professional and great to deal with.  One particular employee (Patricia) gets us just about every check-in and remembers me and my family.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  Most importantly within walking distance to Disneyland and rooms are affordable.  Thank you Del Sol Inn!
Manager Response: Hello Cassandra Y,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. It is such a pleasure to have you and your family stay with us for your Disneyland visits. Thank you for your compliments to our staff member Patricia. She is a great member of our team and we are very lucky to have her with us. We are so glad to hear that you always enjoy your visits with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland clean and updated
Summary: My kids and I just stayed 3 nights here. I was pleasantly surprised how clean and nice it was. The room had just been updated. The manager was very accommodating due to our flight being canceled and were delayed one day getting there. The front desk and valet employees were all very nice. The distance to Disneyland was less than a 10 minute walk to the front gate. Dennys restaurant was right out front for convenience also if you present your room key you can get 10% off your bill. I would recommend anyone to stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your recent visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and hope to see you again soon for your next visit.

Summary: We were met by very courteous front office with cookies!  The parking lot is tiny, but we didn't have a car so this didn't affect us.  Not sure how they handle overflow.  The pool was right outside our room, which made me nervous, but as it was January I didn't think it would be an issue. People did use it and it was a bit annoying.  Kids were in it at night and their parents clearly had no consideration for surrounding rooms as they screamed non stop.  I am a teacher and a kid lover, and I was annoyed by this!  The pool closed at 10:00 and there was never an issue after this time.  The rooms were average motel quality, a bit dated but clean.  Our beds were doubles, not the queens as they advertised. We left our luggage in the office after check out to enjoy more park time. I
Manager Response: Thank you for writing us a great review, I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay with us. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,  Parveen

Summary: We stayed at the Del Sol Inn again over Halloween weekend and had a great experience. It is a three min walk to Disneyland and located right behind Dennys. The beds are comfortable which isn't easy to find on Harbor Blvd. The rooms are updated and clean. This hotel is perfect for those enjoying Disneyland. We didn't use the pool but did eat the free breakfast. It was your standard continental breakfast. My only suggestion is to add water to the breakfast room. Not everyone wants juice. Thanks for a great trip.
Manager Response: Dear aw0211,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel, and THANK YOU for being a loyal guest we appreciate you choose us for so many years. We do offer return guest discount which is available to all our returning guest, please mention it to our reservation specialist for appropriate discount towards your next reservation, you can also call me directly at 714-234-3411. We hope to see you again in near future.   -Parveen

Summary: Great stay! rooms were remodeled and looking really clean and professional ! I recommend to everyone! ive been there 4 times this year and will keep going back.. flat screens mounted on wall and new tile! the mirrors were LED lit! beautiful room! going back 2017!
Manager Response: Dear 244mmoreno,  THANK YOU for being a loyal guest we appreciate you choose us. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to see you again.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: When we go to Disneyland this is where we stay.  It isn't perfect but here are the pros and cons:  Pros: -Rooms are being renovated.  Our last stay was in a renovated room.  It was very nice. -Super close to Disneyland.  This is probably the number one reason we stay here. -Kids love the bunk beds. -Microwave and Fridge are great...and again it is so close you can run back to the hotel for lunch and save some money. -Affordable. -Breakfast available. (more on that in the cons) -Pool area is nice.  Cons: -Have to pay for parking. -Parking is now valet. -Parking spaces are super tiny and people had a hard time parking, as in once I could not open my car door as the car next to me was so close....thus the valet parking now. -Breakfast is pretty lacking...I am glad it is there, you
Manager Response: Dear Camille G.,  Thank you for taking time to review our hotel, Bunk beds rooms are most popular and I'm glad your kids liked them. It makes Del Sol Inn team proud knowing the guest like yourself leave happy with our service.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: Nice remodeled room, clean. Many of the rooms were under construction so it was loud during the day which wasn't a huge problem for us since we weren't there most of the time. Had a bad interaction with the man who works the front desk. Told us we wouldn't be able to park our second vehicle, would have to take it elsewhere; also told us we would have to change rooms halfway through our stay due to the construction. He was rude and not helpful. Luckily, a woman took over for him and got us a room we wouldn't have to switch out of, allowed us to park our second vehicle (why not? We had to pay for it anyway),and she was just genuinely friendly. Would come back, but now I'm prepared for a possible negative interaction. Positive is that it is very close to the Disney park!
Manager Response: Dear Robynn E,  We apologize for any inconvenience that it has caused you, please contact me directly to resolve this issue immediately. I'll do anything i can to earn your business back. I look forward hearing from you. Thank you.  -Parveen

Summary: I had read several recent reviews that were pretty negative about the hotel, so was very leery of staying there. I had no problems what so ever! I got in around 11 am, and asked to park my car. They have valet parking since the spots are pretty tight, and I was helped right away. The valet asked if my room was ready and I went back inside to make sure it wasn't.  The clerk there apologized for not having anything (hey check in isn't until 3pm, I was complaining!) The valet takes the car, I walk around the corner and almost made it to the traffic light that crosses to Disneyland when I got a phone call saying the room would be ready in an hour. Couldn't ask for more than that!   When I got back to the hotel a couple hours later, I had a king room downstairs near the breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Patrice W  Thank you for the awesome review on your most recent stay at the Del Sol Inn. We're so glad that you had a great experience and that our overall cleanliness and spacious rooms exceeded your expectations. I also appreciate the great feedback on our awesome staff. Thank you once again for choosing us and for your kind words we hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: I've been staying at the Del Sol Inn for the past 14 years and have been very satisfied with all of my visits.  On this past visit, I was suffering from an injured knee and using a crutch; since I was solo and unable to climb stairs to my preferred room over the carport, Paul (office staff) put me in a downstairs accessible room near the front of the resort which perfectly suited me!  The location to the Disneyland Resort is very close (about 5mins motel-to bag check) and they have a small breakfast offering (cereal, toast, juice, coffee, milk, fruit, & pastries).  The staff have always been friendly and helpful and we have never had any major problems with our room; we LOVE the Del Sol Inn!
Manager Response: Dear Pam R,  Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to write us a great review. I‚Äôm so glad to hear that you enjoyed Del Sol Inn service, I will also pass on the message to the staff for doing such a great job. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at.  -Parveen

Summary: Del Sol Inn on Harbor Blvd. is all about the location if you want to go to Disneyland.  The rooms are charming, but if you are looking for upscale accommodations, this is not the hotel for you.  The hotel offers a free breakfast, which is filling and convenient.

We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Del Sol. The rooms are currently being upgraded so there was construction noise, but we were in a newly remodeled room and it was quite pleasant. The front desk staff were very helpful even greeting us with fresh baked cookies at check in. The walk to Disneyland was quite short so that was a huge benefit with two younger kids, we were able to go back and rest during the afternoon. Breakfast was not to impressive but it did work.  They had hard boiled eggs, toast, oatmeal, and donuts.  The kids loved the donuts everyday and we were on vacation afterall. The housekeeping staff were fantastic, even making towel animals for the kids.  The room size was surprisingly larger than other places we have stayed at onHarbor Blvd and the kids
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member Thank you for sharing your great experience at the Del Sol Inn. We truly appreciate the positive review and that our staff, ideal location to the Disneyland Resort met your expectations. Our bunk beds are always popular amongst the kids and were pleased to know that your children loved them. We hope to see you and your family again in the near future!

Summary: This motel is about Super 8 level. The people working at the front desk were always very pleasant and nice to deal with and gave us cookies upon checking in at 10 p.m., which my kids appreciated.   We had two rooms with two queens and a set of bunk beds in each, which is handy for families. The carpet was a gross as I remembered from a previous stay 4 years ago - it'll make your feet black - and overall the rooms feel dated and not incredibly clean (probably just because they are dated and old - I didn't notice anything super gross.)   But the price is right and the location really can't be beat - it's right across the street from Disney. So since basically all you do is fall into bed at 9 or 10 p.m. and wake up the next morning to leave all day again, I don't think it matters

Summary Heading: Small and Underwhelming for such a small property
Summary: Our initial thoughts when making this reservation were that it should be decent seeing it is a small property with not very many rooms. Well, not only is the property small, the rooms are TINY too. The "bathrooms" are horrendous. You can't even close the door without needing to stand in the shower/tub to do so. Let's not even begin to talk about the [non existent] water pressure. Valet is an entirely different issue in and of itself. First off we were not told of valet until our 3rd day, but even then we were not told, we were accosted as if parking our own vehicle was wrong.   I will however say, there was a nice younger lady at the front desk (who could use some professional language etiquette). She was very nice and helpful and the only one who was during our 4 night stay.

I was here during October with my family. I had booked a trip through Getawaytoday.com. I booked what I thought was a two room family suite, but what I got was far from that! I had a total of 5 family members. I was supposed to get a 2 queen room with a separate smaller room with a bunk bed set in it. When we arrived we could barely get into the location due to the over crowded parking lot. Most of the hotel was under construction, which we were never made aware of. When we walked into our room it smelt of stale mold and the two queen beds and bunk beds were in the same room all crammed together. A small fridge was in our "closet" area, with a small microwave on top of it. The bottom bunk had a light switch that had no cover it, this is where my 5 year old was supposed to sleep.

Summary Heading: Take a photo of your valet ticket when you receive it!
Summary: Room is clean enough and perfect for close walking distance to the Park.    I knew parking was going to be tight from reading previous reviews and that using their valet service would be required because most people are double parked.  We're a pretty easy going family and did not find that to be a problem.  Did not even raise our voice when we found our rental car had the rim scratched and red paint along the edge from being squeezed into a tight parking spot along a red curb.  Notified the hotel who called the valet and filled out the claim form so they could have the rim repaired with their insurance company then went in to check out of the hotel.    You have to hand the valet your parking ticket which shows scratches and dings on the car that were circled upon arrival to

I rented the family room which is supposed to sleep six. This room is the smallest room I have ever rented at any of the hotels near Disneyland. The beds are not queen size and the carpet is filthy. My daughter's feet were black 10 minutes after she took a shower. I have been here one night out of a four night stay. I don't know if I will make it to night two.

Just returned from four nights at DS and enjoyed our visit. You cannot beat the price for the size of these rooms. If you are looking for a roomy place to stay near the Mouse's House check out Del Sol Inn. Friendly staff, continental breakfast, and great location.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel! I‚Äôm glad to hear our location was convenient to the Disneyland Park. We appreciate your kind words and we look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Checking in was nice and easy the girl was lovely and gave us cookies. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Its not the greatest hotel but your staying because its close to Disneyland not to stay in the hotel all day. The swimming pool was nice and clean as well.

Don't know what happened but we stayed there (maybe our 4th time) on 9/5/16.  The staff was rude.  They have a parking scam going on with the valets.  I agree with the other negative reviews: horrible experience, shady billing practices.  As close as we were (easy walking distance) we were left no choice but to drive over to, and pay for, parking at Disneyland.  And they're too cheap to heat the pool.

I tried this hotel twice to give them the benefit of the doubt but both times were horrible. The first night I turned on the lights about 12 am so my grandson can use the restroom and roaches went scattering on the night stand all over our things. I had to throw away my grandsons light up spinner toy that he just got from Disneyland in fear of roach eggs, didn't want to bring those things home. When we went into the restroom again baby roaches scattered into little holes in the floor. I caught one in the cup and took it to the front desk and the guy working said that he could help move my grandkids to another room. No, I'm not going to let some guy touch my sleeping grandkids. We had to sleep with the lights on and shake out all of our belongings to make sure we didn't bring

Pros:  The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our special needs. Cons: Water pressure needs to be addressed. Was almost impossible to take a shower. This hotel is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance. So convenient to come and go all day long. I have found that all hotels are about the same. Definitely not a 5 star place but its just a place to lay your head and rest up to play again the next day! Breakfast was very simple. Pastries, toast, oatmeal, cereal and juice. A very limited fruit selection was available as well. Water pressure was extremely low which made it difficult to shower. The hotel includes a pool and hot tub. The staff was super friendly. I will definitely plan to stay here again!

Summary Heading: Horrible Experience at Del Sol Inn Anaheim, CA
Summary: We've been staying at Del Sol Inn for a few years now, BUT NEVER AGAIN!!  This last trip in June 2016 we had a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE & I feel the management blew off our experience like it was no big deal.  We were put in a room with a urine soaked mattress & mattress pad. The first night we slept in the bed thinking the sheets were wet because they rushed to put the room together for us (they gave us the key & sent us to the room before the room was clean/ready).  The second night at 11pm after a long day at Disneyland, we got to our room & were going to go to bed & immediately we could smell the strong odor of urine. We pulled the covers back & could see the URINE STAINED SHEETS, GROSS!!  TO THINK WE SLEPT IN THAT BED THE NIGHT BEFORE!! DISGUSTING!!!  Our stay was for 5 nights &

If I could give zero stars I would.  We just stayed here for 4 nights on a family vacation.   We occupied three rooms total.  Two were the double queen bunkbed rooms.  First, the rooms were filthy.  Carpet was stained, walls were filthy, there was a wire hanging out of the ceiling above the bunkbed and the refrigerator was plugged into an extension cord.  Most of that I was willing to deal with for just this visit because it was so close and we really didn't spend much time in the room except to sleep.  Then started the shady practices.  One of our rooms received mysterious charges on their credit card the first night we were there.  When she showed them the charges they said one of them didn't show on their computer so there was nothing they could do about it (it was $183 and

Even tho this hotel is a little dated, it is a perfect location, across the street from Disneyland!  the bonus?  We left something behind in the room and did not discover it missing for hours after checkout. I called and they found the item! I sent a self-addressed stamped envelope and they returned the item promptly. Great customer service.

From room door to inside the Disneyland entry 10minutes total - that includes waiting at traffic lights to cross the road! We were able to be at Disneyland first up in the morning, go back to room in the hottest part of the day then back to Disneyland again for the afternoon, evening and nightly fireworks.  All staff friendly, rooms clean, nothing to complain about!!  Would definitely recommend and stay again :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review on your most recent visit at the Del Sol Inn. I'm glad that you had a great experience and appreciate the kind words on my amazing team and location. Thank you once again for your review and we hope to be your hotel of choice when travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary Heading: Great for families on a budget
Summary: I love this hotel and have used it many times.  It is right across the street from the main Disney entrance, so walking there is easy.  The rooms are very spacious and clean, it had a small refrigerator and microwave which came in handy for storing and making our own food.  It also has an in room safe.   The bed was comfortable and the kids loved the bunk beds.  The free breakfast could use more options, like less sugar and more protein, but if you need something quick, it works.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, we will continue to use this hotel for all our future Disney vacations!

We recently stayed at the Del Sol Inn for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  It is right across the street - easy walk to Disneyland, Disney California Adventure or Downtown Disney.  We had a good rate since we stayed for 3 nights.  Room was a little dated but clean and spacious.  My family doesn't spend a lot of time in the room when at Disneyland so it was perfect.  Breakfast didn't offer a lot but to us, it was enough to get us out of hotel quickly and into Disney. We like to eat lunch and dinner early when at the park so a light bite worked.  I would definitely recommend if you are visiting Disneyland. There is a $9 valet parking fee per day - but I knew that going in, still worth it.
Manager Response: Dear Konameisters  We're so glad that you had a great stay with us and that you were pleased about our close proximity to the park.  We appreciate your feedback and are glad to inform you that we have just finished renovating all of our rooms this December. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: More like a 2.5. Stayed on 8/20/16. Wanted to go to Disneyland and we have stayed here before. It is really close to the main entrance. Also it was the cheapest rate in the area.           Tried to check in at 1:30 was told rooms were not ready, but they took my cell number and said they would call. They have a valet service, so we let them park the car and went to Disneyland. It was a good day not to hot and not to crowded and we never got a call or text for our room.            Went back and got our room at about 11:00. Odd room had two queen beds and two bunk beds. Room was also pretty warm, and it took awhile to cool down. Their AC is only fair.  My wife took a shower. There was no hot water, but since it was late we just figured that they were out. Wrong! In the morning

Summary Heading: Dont sell your familes health for a discount
Summary: We stayed there for multiple nights and from a family of six  three of us became sick and after passing it off as exhaustion we later found black mold on our clothes. Headaches sore throats and rashes and coughing all night .we stayed in a room right across from the pool which may have increased the mold and to honest I'm not from a high humidity area so maybe this is common but we have stayed other places in Anaheim  for longer and have not experienced this. Everyone says we just need a place to sleep and nothing great .that's what you get here.

While this hotel isn't the Taj Mahal, it has location! Located behind Denny's across the street from Disneyland's main entrance.  Quick and easy walk, even with tired kids in tow.   I have stayed here mutiple times since 2010. Staff are great and very helpful. Rooms are clean and have been updated. The family suite offers 2 queens and a bunk bed. There is a typical continental breakfast offered, with hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal and juice. Pool with hot tub.   Only suggestions I have, is that if you can, get a room upstairs, preferably away from the pool.  Especially if you are noise sensitive. This is an older hotel (one of the originals that is still standing) and the walls are thin. Parking is also tight and limited.   They do have great discounts that include AAA and

Del Sol Inn was a great location while traveling with two teenage boys.  Everything is close to the Inn;  Several restaurants (with good food and reasonable prices), the gate into Disneyland (just across the street) and the bus to Knottsberry Farm also just across the street.  The Inn sets back from the street so there is no street noise.  The rooms are well equipped with hair dryer, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, safe, a/c, flat screened tv and excellent wifi.  Breakfast is 7-9 with cereal (including instant oatmeal), hard boiled eggs, toaster waffles & bread, donuts, juice, milk and coffee.  Oranges and apples are also available.  The beds are comfortable and there are even some rooms with bunk beds.  Our boys spend at least an hour in the swimming pool everyday while
Manager Response: Dear 1mahalo  Thank you for sharing your recent experience at the Del Sol Inn. We truly appreciate your review and pleased that our ideal location and great amenities exceeded your expectations. I will also share your great comments on my staff and how they provided the friendly and helpful service during your stay. It was an absolute pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to be your home away from home when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: Del Sol Inn is a small location, perfect to get to Disneyland and California Adventure as it is across the street from Main Gate Disneyland.   Del Sol offers a nice selection for breakfast.  As for me all I need is a place to get ready and go then come back to at the end of a fun-filled day to sleep.  With this in mind, Del Sol Inn worked out great for my daughter and me. The room was clean with two queen beds, a TV, a small refrigerator and microwave if needed.  Room was keep clean by the service staff and the office staff were pleasant and helpful.  In fact Patricia was the one I most interacted with and she was wonderful, beautiful smile and always a pleasant greeting for my daughter and me.  As for parking, I did not have a car but noticed you would have to pay for the
Manager Response: Dear Yolanda A  Thank you for sharing your positive review on your most recent visit with us. We're so glad that you had a great stay with us and that the cleanliness of our rooms and amazing staff met your expectations. We truly appreciate your review and we hope to see you again for your next trip to Disney.

Summary: Across the street from Disneyland, fridge, micro, coffee, breakfast (needs more protein and bananas and maybe longer hours).  Mayte, is in charge of the breakfast area and she is super friendly and helpful. The staff as a whole were great.

We stayed at the Del Sol Inn for our three days at Disneyland. We have 4 young kids so the room with the bunk bed was perfect for us. The parking is very tight and it seems like they must double as a paid parking lot because the lot is always full to the point that you can't get out without an employee moving cars out of the way. Other than that this is a great place to stay while at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Cory H Thank you for sharing your recent experience on TripAdvisor. Although we're glad that you had a good stay, my sincere apologies that we had some missed opportunities with our parking lot. We truly appreciate your feedback and will certainly address your concerns. Thank you again and we look forward to your return in the future!

Summary: can't do much better than an inexpensive little motel across the street from Disneyland! Rooms have fridge, coffee, microwave and ok spotty wifi. Pool and hot tub are clean and fun. Rooms have fan, heat, and A/C. Denny's at the front of the property. Easy access to anywhere from this place. Free breakfast is cereal, donuts, toast, apples, oranges, hard boiled eggs - not great but enough to get started for the day

My 11 year old daughter and myself stayed here recently.  We booked with short notice.  The price was very overpriced for what we got, however, it was comparable to other nearby hotels.  When our plane landed, I noticed a voicemail from the hotel confirming that we were still coming (the plane landed at noon).  I was a bit worried there wouldn't be a room for us, but there was!  We arrived at 3 pm and checked in with no issue and no line.  We had asked for a top floor and it was granted without issue.  We were given chocolate chip cookies when we arrived which was nice.  The room was pretty basic, with a very tiny bathroom, but was fine for the two of us for 3 nights.  We had a major issue with our shower where it would not turn off.  I called the front desk and housekeeping

Stayed here at the end of June,hotel staff were very friendly. We arrived close to midnight to check in and the kids were cranky,the man at the front desk was nice enough to give my sister some milk for her kids,so she didn't have to leave and get some. Parking in this place was a bit challenging... however,the valet are very helpful. We even were upgraded to a unit with bunk beds for our stay,right next to the pool. It was so convenient to walk back and worth to the park when the kids and adults need to rest.  The decor is a bit outdated,but my room was very clean. All in all I would stay again.

This was the worst experience of my life the people were very rude there is no parking for the cars. They are put in like sardines and you can't take your car out or you won't have a place to park. The breakfast was really gross.  So we had to go somewhere and pay for breakfast some unexpected expenses.  Word to the wise pay a little more and check out the place you want stay before booking cause if you stay at a place like and  have a problem it is your own fault cause you've been warned

We LOVED the convenient location of this hotel. We were right across the street from the entrance of Disneyland. The maids are VERY nice and helpful and did a great job of cleaning our room without disturbing the stuff we left out. There WERE a couple of downsides to this though. The parking lot is SO small that you HAVE to use their valet service (which is an added $9 per day...mandatory to use). The valets were SO polite and friendly and did a great job of not denting our van doors (which was hard because the parking spots are so small). This hotel offers free breakfast which included hard boiled eggs, toast, toaster waffles, donuts, packets of oatmeal, fruit (apples and oranges), cereal, and juice. They open at 7 and if you want to be able to use the toaster at all or want a

Don't stay here unless your primary concerns are location and budget. There are many things about this motel that will make your stay less than ideal unless you are prepared for them in advance.   We are annual passholders and travel to the Disney resort from northern California three or four times a year. We stayed at the Del Sol Inn once a few years ago, on the recommendation of a friend. The room we stayed in then was under an exterior staircase that blocked all natural light, and the room was lit with the dimmest bulbs I have ever seen. It was the most depressing motel room we had ever stayed in and in spite of being at the Disney resort, that awful room ended up being a major takeaway from the trip.   I recently booked a last-minute trip to the resort, and could find no

Summary Heading: Decent and affordable- Family suite for 5 days.
Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We stayed for 5 days with 3 adults and 3 children. The Good: The location is unbeatable for Disneyland visits.  Price is competitive if you book early. Room is clean and comfortable for six people. Air conditioner worked wonderfully. It was the temperature of Satan's armpit (106) on a few days, but our room was a welcomed relief.  Continental breakfast is better than most in the area, and the serving hours are perfect. The Bad: Tub faucet was broken and was hard to stop from dripping (Very concerning for being a severe drought area) Valet parking is forced.(Bring a second key to access your vehicle, or you have to go to the valet just to retrieve items from vehicle.) Only one car parking per room. (We were on a road trip with two

Summary Heading: Can't be beaten for the price
Summary: Just back from a 3 night girls trip stay. There were four women in the room so a bit of a squeeze but just do-able. The room was clean, had everything you need and was adequate sized. The staff were friendly and the location unbeatable.     The free wifi was intermittent but better than nothing.  Also because the pool is in the middle you can hear conversations around it very clearly at night in your room - we did have to call reception and complain our first night about a loud group which staff dealt with promptly.   For the location the price is unbeatable and I would definitely stay again.

This is the second time we have stayed at this site. We have had the same room both visits and loved it! So clean and friendly staff. This is our hotel of choice, when visiting Disneyland. You can't beat the price or location, right across the street from the park. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the area. We will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay on a buget (closest you can get for the cost) Annual Pass holder
Summary: We have stayed here twice and will stay here again. Best deal on the harbor strip!!! Annual pass holder discounted rooms (big plus). Rooms are average size, clean and beds are comfy. Parking is the only reason i didnt give it 5 stars, its a little tight. However they have valet there so, hey your on vaca... let them help ya :)

The location is great. It was really nice to be able to walk back to the hotel quickly and take a nap.  The first night the AC in one of our rooms was noisy. We let them know when we headed to Disney, and when we came back, the AC unit had been replaced with a new one.

Room was pretty descent but the bathroom was really small. Overall is was ok and right across the street from Disney land and right behind Denny's. There wasn't enough parking spaces so they had to vallet park our truck and park it wherever they had space.

We called months ahead and told them we had 2 mobility scooters and requested a 1st floor room. They noted our request but said that if needed we could charge and keep our mobility scooters in the lobby and that they'd be safe there. When we got there we couldn't get a 1st floor room (which we understood may happen), but we were told that we could park our scooters just outside the lobby, near the vending machine but we'd have to unplug the vending machine to charge them a the same time. We ended up having to break down the scooters and haul them up and down the stairs each morning and night. Thankfully there were helpful hotel guest and one hotel valet. Parking was awful. The valet people earned their pay. Location was great but that's about it.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Hotel was what it is, but the staff were very friendly and accommodating. We asked for a crib and bottom floor room near the pool (as per other reviews). Arrived to a crib in the room ready to go and a bottom floor room as it was easier to haul kids to and from park when sleeping. Patricia called the day before to confirm our reservation and was very kind. The best part of this hotel is it's convenient location to Disney. Couldn't be better.  Breakfast was sub par, but there was fruit and snacks to bring to the park for the day.  We had 2 rooms. One with the queen beds and bunk beds. Had a fridge, small bathroom, safe.  Our other room was a King room which also had a refrigerator and nicer bathroom. Our only complaint was the flooring of the room with the bunk beds. The carpet

Everything was fine the room was nice and clean. close to disney entrece... the wifi was not very good but i will still stay again because is close to disneyland... the brestfast can bee improve is only old donas and cereal.

We do a trip up to Disneyland for multiple days 3 or 4 times per year.  Each time, we stay at one of the properties right across the street from the entrance.  We bop from property to property, mostly happy with our experience.  We chose Del Sol Inn for our last trip.  It was our Anniversary and we left the kids at home for a few days to escape our day to day routine.  We arrived about 12:30 PM and Patricia greeted us warmly and got us right into our room.  She was very efficient and friendly.  It was a great way to start our stay.  Our room was fine.  Clean, fairly comfortable bed.  Everything is a bit dated, which is fine.  Bath and shower work.  Our only complaint was that the room didn't black out that well and a lot of sunshine came in through the front window.  The room

My family are Disney annual passholders so we wanted to drive up for an overnight and get an extra evening in. We decided to stay here because some of the other hotels we normally stay at  were booked. I read the reviews re: the parking, so I was prepared. Also ready the reviews re: the bad coffee...nothing still prepared me for the horrible stuff they serve.  No hot water for tea either. The room just had a general feel of being old and tired. My eight year old grandson panicked when he went to take a shower. He felt as if he was using towels someone else had used. What was the true kicker was when we left.  My daughter-in-law left her makeup bag in the room. When we had left a different Anaheim hotel a few months before, they called immediately because I had left my sunglasses

Stayed here with 7 rooms of friends last week and had a great time. We had reserved rooms a couple weeks ago and they were ready when we arrived. No problems checking in about 9pm that night. We stayed three nights and did Disneyland. Had no car since we flew in and shuttled to the hotel. Valet parking is $9 and lot seemed to stay full. They move the cars around for you.  Rooms were exterior doors (not inside hallways). Rooms were big, with a desk, 2 queens, flat screen tv, sink outside the bathroom. Beds were comfortable for us. I saw a pile of mattresses outside under a shelter and presumed they are in process of updating rooms. You might ask this if you visit. Pool was small and since we spent all our time at Disney we did not get to use it. Breakfast was adequate to start

I think that this hotel is a solid four stars when you take into account the price; of the hotels located directly across the main Disneyland entrance, their rates are consistently very competitive. The rooms are older and could definitely use some freshening, but nothing during our stay was dirty or not in working order. Sure, there were a few chipped tiles in the bathroom, the lamps looked like throwbacks from the 70's, and the bedding was outdated. That being said, the room was clean, we felt safe in the hotel, and it was a very quick walk to Disneyland. When we are traveling to Disneyland Resort on a tight budget, Del Sol is a consistent go-to; my husband and I have stayed here 3 times over the course of the last 4 years, and while we're never blown away by anything, we get

After a very bad experience at the Anaheim Plaza and a stay at one of our favorites, HOJO, we decided to find another budget option and one closer to the entrance of the park this time.  The Del Sol had the lowest price and the closest distance so we decided to give the place a shot.  Not bad!  The place is older but clean and well maintained.  The rooms have been remodeled at some point in the relatively recent past.  Parking isn't ideal but we rarely drive once we get to the park anyway and we did manage to grab one of the covered spots.  The room, 204, was big with two queen beds, a table with chairs, a desk, refrigerator and microwave.  Our room was tucked into a corner which made it extra quiet.  The walls seem well insulated, we never really heard our neighbors, and the
Manager Response: Dear danmcmartin,  Thank you for writing us a great review, I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay with us. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.   Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: Nothing fancy but clean.   Parking very tough.   Don't plan on driving in and out, as valet costs can run half of Disney parking cost.   You are right next to family restaurants and a 2 minute walk to Disney entrance.
Manager Response: Dear Mbalch30,  Thank you for taking time out of your schedule to write us a review, I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay with us. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: We chose this hotel because of its location only. The rooms are old & new re modeling. The parking was horrible!! The front desk people take forever when checking in :-( it took nearly 25 mins. We will not stay again. We got the kids room so it had 2 queen beds & 1 bunk bed. The kids liked the bunk beds.

I'm an annual pass holder and have stayed at most of the good neighbor hotels. I go into these hotels in the mindset that this is a place to sleep at night and I'm not expecting 3 or 4 star hotels.   Pros:  very nice front desk person who greeted me with a very easy check in and cookies. Room was clean and large enough for 6 people. Location is pretty good as well.   Cons:  parking is extremely small and we had to back our van out to leave on our departure date. Shower had the worst water pressure. Beds were the hardest beds I have ever slept on, but as tired as you get as Disneyland this wasn't a huge issue after a couple days. Breakfast was lacking even for a motel free breakfast. I was fine with the choices, but they lady stocking didn't seem to put enough out at a time.   I

I stayed here a couple of weeks ago. The pool was wonderful, and heated. This is a quaint older hotel, with a friendly staff. The breakfast provided include hard boiled eggs, oranges, apples, waffles for the toaster, toast, donuts, cold cereal, oatmeal packets,  juice, coffee and milk. They only offer it for a couple of hours in the morning, so if you are a late riser, you will miss out. The parking is a little crazy, but valet is free. And there are lots of conveniences within walking distance. They do charge you for parking and a resort daily fee is added. Plus all the taxes, so it ended up being more than I had originally thought. The best part was that after a day at Disneyland, we were able to just walk across the street. My siblings stayed at other hotels and chose to park
Manager Response: Dear Lori,  I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed all of our amenities. It makes Del Sol Inn team proud knowing the guest like yourself leave happy with our service, Thank you for giving us opportunity to serve you and we hope to see you again in near future.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary Heading: Good beds, across the street from Disney (2min walk)
Summary: We have stayed at our fair share of hotels near Disneyland. Most recently we spent two nights at the Del Sol Inn.  I must say from start to finish I was pleased. (And I tend to be picky). The man Jesus that checked us in was very friendly. My request to have an upstairs room was met. Our room was somewhat large. It was a big square and had two queen beds, a fold out leather sofa, and a dining table with two chairs. The square shape of the room made it feel larger. The air quality was improved when we turned on the AC. The room did smell a little humid prior to that. The beds were COMFORTABLE. The TV had a good selection of channels. The room had a microwave and fridge. They had a free breakfast with pastries, waffles, boiled eggs, and cereal. No water though; only juice and
Manager Response: Thank you for writing us a great review, I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay with us. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.   Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: We booked a standard room, two queen beds, and it was totally fine.  We didn't spend much time in the room, because we were at the Park all day and night, but the room was clean, quiet (even being on the first floor next to the pool) and the beds were comfortable. The air conditioning worked well and the TV worked.  What more can you ask for?  The price was also really on point, especially considering we only made our reservations a couple of weeks in advance.  Other hotels in the area were either sold out or $100 more expensive per night.  I'd stay here again. Don't expect to use your car while you are there.  You don't really need to, but the parking lot gets really jammed up at night, and you'll need the help of the valet. Again, you're right across the street from
Manager Response: Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to write us a great review. I‚Äôm so glad to hear that you enjoyed Del Sol Inn service, I will also pass on the message to the staff for doing such a great job. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.  -Parveen

Summary: Okay, it is right across from Disneyland. That's the saving grace.   Rooms are "Okay." AC worked, otherwise, it would have been a hot box. When the AC is on you can't hear the noise from the pool.  My main problem with the place is NO parking. They had to valet my car and charged me $9. a day to do it. This was not part of my agreement, but I had no choice.   Crowded, crowded parking lot.  The person there at check in made me wait 10 minutes to check in since he said he was changing shifts and I had to wait on the next person. Not sure why. He was still there just milling about. After a long day of traveling, this seemed  rude.   Breakfast was minimal, and served in a room that must have been a converted storage closet. Hardly even any room to move around when there are 4 people
Manager Response: Dear EvaInkOne,  I am very sad to know that you didn't enjoy your stay with us, please contact me directly at 714-234-3411 and I will do the best I can to correct it.  Thank you -Parveen

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to Stay for a Disney Getaway
Summary: I just wanted to compliment the staff at the Del Sol Inn Anaheim Resort on a great stay.  My room was clean and very comfortable.  The location was perfect.  Right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland and right next door to Denny's.  The hotel also serves a complimentary continental breakfast, which is a huge plus, because it saves on the expense of a meal out.  The parking was very tight, but valet parking was available so that was not a concern.  Staff was very friendly.  I want to put in a special good word for Paul (Pablo, I think his real name is) who was especially nice as he was checking us in,  Great place,  Great location,  Great staff,  We'll be back.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff,  Thank you for taking time out of busy schedule and writing us a great review. I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us specially our service as we take pride in what we do. once again on behalf of team Del Sol I would like to thank you and we look forward see you again in near future.  Thank you -Parveen

Summary: Perfect place to stay for your Disneyland Vacation, It's right across the street from Disneyland. Rooms are clean & the prices are very reasonable. The staff is super friendly & helpful. We've been coming here for years & will continue to do so!
Manager Response: Dear Bev S,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel, and THANK YOU for being a loyal guest we appreciate you choose us for so many years. We do offer return guest discount which is available to all our returning guest, please mention it to our reservation specialist for appropriate discount towards your next reservation, you can also call me directly at 714-234-3411. We hope to see you again in near future.   Thank you, -Parveen

Summary Heading: Great location; everything else is just ok
Summary: The location cannot be better; it is literally right across the street from the Disneyland entrance. That is the best thing about this hotel. I liked that there was "complimentary" breakfast, which wasn't the greatest, but it was enough to get the day started with hard-boiled eggs, toaster waffles, cereal, donuts, etc. The breakfast room is very tiny, so get there early! The rooms are actually pretty spacious. The beds were fine, but the walls are very thin, so you hear everything, especially when the next-door neighbors are taking a shower! The parking is ridiculous; there are not enough parking spaces for each car, so you have to leave your keys with the attendant so they can double-park the cars. If you need anything from your car or want to leave, you have to get the key
Manager Response: Dear Jane,  Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to write us a great review. I‚Äôm so glad to hear that you enjoyed Del Sol Inn service, I will also pass on the message to the staff for doing such a great job. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.  -Parveen

Summary: With the reviews that I had seen I wasn't expecting a pleasant experience, but since I had my disabled mother with me this was the closest we could get to Disneyland without spending hundreds of dollars a night. When we got to the hotel everyone was nice and the room was spacious. In the morning, being that most are up early and running over to Disneyland, it did get a little loud but that is because there were excited children. Who could blame them. We were going to Disneyland as well. The beds were comfortable but when you sat on them it sounded like you were passing gas. We thought it was funny however it could annoy others. For the price we paid this is a great hotel if you are going to Disneyland, are trying to be close to the front gates, and don't mind noise at 7am. I

Every time we go to Disneyland, we stay at the Del Sol Inn.  We have never had a bad stay.  It is a dated hotel, but no more so than most other hotels in the area.  The rooms are not very sound proof, so be prepared to put up with neighbor noise.  It is clean and the service is great.  We used the valet parking, but certainly if you were to park on your own it would be rather a tight squeeze, if you are able to find a spot.  Small repairs were needed.  Our tv did not work, was very fuzzy, and the door to the bathroom kept sticking.  The location however makes up for a lot.  Easy, quick access to the parks.  Would stay there again.  The wifi was very weak.  Barely working, and kept kicking out.

Perfect location, decent room, will definetly stay here again because it's  just across the street from entrance to Disneyland:) continental breakfast is basic but good pool was nice, was planning on having to get a rollaway but we were given a bunk bed room without even asking and paid for a regular room:)

This is so close to Disney - directly across the street from the entrance to the park! Takes 2 minutes to walk over - it was perfect! The rooms were big and the King Bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but the water was good and it had a pool. The breakfast was decent (nothing spectacular, but good for a couple of days stay - they had donuts, bread, cereal, fruit, boiled eggs, toast, oatmeal, juice and coffees). Good pool, the only thing was the parking lot was a little small but valet was there if no spots available.
Manager Response: Dear Renee C,  Thank you for taking time to write us a great review, it makes team Del Sol inn proud knowing you enjoyed our service. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to serve you again in near future.  -Parveen

Summary: Our family has been coming here for at least 5 years now and it is always our go-to hotel when we visit DL. If I could guess, I'd say we've stayed here a min. of 20 times. Sadly I think our little secret spot has been discovered because it seems that they run out of rooms more often now. The hotel is easy to walk to and from the park when we want to take a break from the crowds. Unlike the larger hotel chains, we find that its nice and convenient to be able to walk directly to the room rather than through a lobby, down a hall, up an elevator and down more halls. By the time most people are getting on a shuttle to do MORE WALKING .. we've walked directly to our room relaxing! ha ha   Speaking of rooms, they're very large. Large enough to have 2 Q beds as well as room for a full

This is an older motel and the age does show. However they do keep it clean and well maintained. Their so called complimentary breakfast is disappointing and their coffee is simply gross. With that said, if you are looking for no-frills, comfortable clean room that is very close to the main gate, this your motel.

I have stayed at this hotel before and I like how close it is to Disneyland. I also like that it has a fridge and microwave in each room. I also love the fact that they have free continental breakfast and wifi. However,the beds aren't really comfortable at all. A long day at Disney, I would love to come back to a  comfortable bed. I also had the problem of  coming to the hotel at about noonish and not being able to check into a room. I realize that normal check in is 3pm. The problem there is the hotel has no public restrooms to change clothes?? The lady at front desk was so nice and said she could hold my stuff until the room was ready but I needed to change clothes to go to the park?I'm a flight attendant and I was in uniform) Luckily, as we were discussing it the maid put in

The room is huge! The walls look a little dirty, & the beds aren't as comfortable as some we've slept in, but the size of the room, & the bunk beds are great. The pool is heated, & it had a continental breakfast, & although you have to be there right as the breakfast opens or you might not get any, it is a nice perk.

The Del Sol is an older motel, but the rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  The rooms have a microwave and fridge for convenience. The motel was only about a block away from the entrance to Disneyland so that was wonderful.  There were several restaurants near by within walking distance and a Denny's in the parking lot. I would stay here again.

Stayed here as the only hotel that had rooms available for a last minute 10 days trip to Disneyland. Rooms were clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. Did not eat at the complimentary continental breakfast. Denny's is right in front of hotel. Parking is tight but 24 hour valet will always park or dig your car out. Extremely close to Disneyland main gate. Laundry facility was great.

Summary Heading: Nice room, Across the street from Disneyland
Summary: Room was nice and clean. Bed was comfy. Staff was friendly. And VERY close to the Disneyland. Only thing we didn't like was that since the parking lot was so SMALL we weren't able to park there past noon so for the 2nd day we had to pay for parking at the park.

Summary Heading: Clean Room but Noisy, Convenient Location, Poor Breakfast!
Summary: We stayed here during the Christmas Holiday (2015). The room was very clean and the location of the hotel is excellent if you are visiting Disneyland. I had 3 issues with this place... The walls are paper thin, for we got very familiar with the activities of the adjacent rooms (next and above). One of the queen beds had a sagging mattress and one sank in it (not in a comfortable way). the continental breakfast is of very poor quality (day old donuts, generic cereal, bad fruit, and the worst tasting coffee I've ever had), but I was not surprised as all the neighboring hotels offer the same rubbish for a continental breakfast, so this place was not any different. I would recommend an upstairs room to avoid the added noise from potential heavy footed neighbors.

We stayed at this hotel to surprise kids with a Disneyland trip! Perfect for location but room and parking was horrible. Beds were hard and when I went to bathroom early morning of check out day turned light on and seen 2 cockroaches! Parking is ridiculous!!! Front desk woman got in an argument with my wife regarding valet my wife asked for manager and she said their was absolutely no supervisor or manager to talk to or get in contact with.. Honestly pay the extra 20$ and stay somewhere else!! To pay almost 200$ to stay a night here was not worth the hassle we had!!!

Worst worst worst  never book it. I will say only one thing I asked for pillow and they said "we don't have " I mean are you serious right now. I had a video recording as well for that I hope there some negative rating which I can give. I am giving this review on the same day I checked in.

We enjoyed our stay here with our family. It was a nice room that fit my large family with having the two beds and bunk beds. It was a little cramped with having a table and chairs in there. It was very close to Disneyland which made it very easy for my family. The breakfast was a little to be desired but it worked. Will stay here again with the large family.

Summary Heading: Clean Room and Easy access to Disneyland
Summary: This place is great to stay if you are going to Disneyland. You can literally walk across the street and up to the main gate. There are also several restaurants close by so you don't need your car for anything. The parking arrangements were a bit strange but it worked. My car was safely parked and not damaged and available for us if we needed it within minutes. The rooms are clean and affordable and the staff is nice. Free Wifi and a safe place to sleep...No complaints on my end. I will stay here again whenever we visit the Magical Disney Parks.

While the staff was great, there was a lot about my stay I found puzzling. I work at an inn and this was no inn or resort, despite the resort fee I was charged. I was also charged a fee for the safe, that was never used. And their breakfast was average. I did like that the room was clean and that they were able to move me to a room that accommodated my needs better than what I had booked. There was a coffee maker in the room, a refrigerator and a microwave, they have parking on site (for a fee), and you can walk to Disneyland! I would stay here again for convenience, but I don't get all the extra fees.

In June 2015, my family of 15 stayed at Del Sol for several nights.  The hotel is an easy walk to the Park.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  The hotel staff were great to work with on each of our stays at this hotel.  We had a total of four rooms, which were centrally located. My husband and I have stayed here a total of four times and are looking forward to our next stay in December!  I have recommended Del Sol to family and friends.

This motel sits almost directly across the street from the Disney entrance. We had two queen beds and a set of bunk beds. The six of us were very comfortable. They have a modest continental breakfast, a pool, hot tub and laundry facilities. The management is super friendly and accommodating. Very moderate priced for this area.

Yes this motel is close to Disneyland. That is the single good quality this place has going for it. It is in need of some serious refurbishments. The beds are like sleeping on a board and the linens are really scratchy. The drain in the shower was clogged up and two hours after calling the front desk to have it fixed they came to fix it. The parking is $9 a day and it's a disaster. If you are lucky enough to get a parking space you may not be able to exit your vehicle because you are basically an inch from the other cars. I would definitely not book this place again. I would definitely not recommend it to anyone else. Yes it's close to Disneyland but there are better hotels all about the same proximity.

Del Sol has been a great Hotel for us. We have stayed here 3 times and are going back next week! We love the service we receive there and have yet to have any complaints. Location of this hotel is fantastic, can't beat being directly across the street from Disneyland. I love that the hotel is a non smoking hotel! So family friendly! :) Thank you Del Sol!!!

The Anaheim Del Sol Inn, like so many other properties in the area, is an older one, that is obvious, still everything was clean.  The location doesn't get much better.  The kids loved the bunk beds and we all enjoyed the pool. The continental breakfast was... continental.  But where the Del Sol really shined was in the courtesy of the staff.  We arrived very early, yet they were very accommodating, welcoming, and helpful.   As a travel agent, I like to stay at different properties all the time, but I wouldn't mind staying here again.

My husband, my mother, and I just stayed at the Del Sol Inn for four nights. I have been staying at different hotels around Disneyland trying to find the perfect one. This is my experience with this hotel.  It is located very close to Disneyland. The location is really excellent, you literally just have to cross the street.  The rooms are large and come with a refrigerator, microwave, safe, wifi, and a TV. They also gave warm cookies to us when we checked in.   I didn't use the wifi because when I checked in they told me the password was changing and I would need to request the new one in the morning. I never got around to asking.  There is an additional fee for the safe. I don't remember the exact price but it is about $2. You cannot decline the safe or fee. There is also a fee

Like so many other reviewers, you can't beat the location.  I was there during some very hot days and the fact that I could walk across the street made it so I could ignore how dated the hotel is.  It is an older hotel, with older furniture.  I did not mind the AC as I needed it on all night and it did provide a sound barrier, so I heard nothing while sleeping.  The breakfast is minimal.  Staff were great.  No problems while there and I also got it at a really good price. It was definitely clean when I arrived.   For me, it was a good stay.  Make sure you read all about the extra charges because it is listed when you book that they do charge above the room rate for parking, safe and resort fee.

This hotel is pretty average. The management is amazing! They are so thoughtful and help you work through any problems that may arise during your stay. I love how close it is to Disneyland and many resturants. The rooms are spaceous and mostly clean. I love the towel animal they make and the cookie at check in.
