The shower and toilet part of the bathroom is pretty small but hey it is a hotel. If you want a quoted morning ask for a 2nd floor room. Don't even try to eat the free breakfast it's disgusting. The only edible stuff was the cereal. Donuts are stale and out of a store package that's just loaded into the case. Just go to a resturant.

The hotel is old and noisy. I had to run the air conditioning all night long just to drown out a vibration noise coming from another rooms air conditioner or bathroom fan, the fan in our bathroom had to be at least 50 years old. The nicest thing about the room was the shutters. The breakfast area is a joke and so is the parking the smallest parking spots on the planet at $9 a day for parking there trying to fit in as many parking spots as they can. For the same money you can stay in a much much nicer hotel like hotelike like any hotel

The location of this hotel is great.  Directly across the street from Disneyland and easy to walk through.  The price is a little high for what you get.  The rooms are very tired looking and the bunk bed are designed for kids not teenagers.  Parking is not good at all.  If you book here it's best to just park your car and not expect to leave. They probably have 30 spots for the entire place.  So the Valet must double and triple park.  So you cannot be in a hurry to leave.  If I didn't have a last minute change in our numbers I would have paid the same for a higher quality place.

Big rooms at a good price, with a great location. Small pool which was great to come back to mid day while others were at park. Staff were great as well, and the beds were comfortable to come back to at night.Heard other reviews about noise, well wether it was the excitement over Disney or lack of consideration of certain guests it's at every hotel we have stayed at  in past trips to Disney.We would have given it a 5 star rating but the Wifi was sporadic and had to work at getting it up. For the location and price it would be really tough to find a better deal.

We really enjoyed the very clean and spacious room.  The air conditioning unit was efficient, quiet and easy to control.  Really loved the shutters, added a homey touch to the look of the room.  Very close to the entrance of Disneyland and just steps away from Denny's.  Really great price, much less expensive and nicer room and closer to Disneyland entrance than the last place we stayed.  We will definitely come back again, and we have already told lots of people this is the place to stay!!! Front desk personnel was very pleasant and accommodating. Terrific value for the price.  Not a very large property which is probably why rates are so reasonable.  We really loved staying here.

We went to check in and said they were upgrading our room to a suite at no extra charge. That was fine with us. We had 4 people with us and now 2 rooms, so it was nice being able to spread out. The beds were comfortable, nice modern feel. Breakfast was alright. Could have more options. It's nice that we could just walk across the street to Disneyland. They charge you to park your car at the hotel though.... although it's a lot cheaper than parking in the structure.

We stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland. The motel is on the smaller side. But it was very clean and well kept. we stayed in their kids room with bunk beds. The room was clean, but a bit small. we didn't find this to be a problem, because we planned on spending most of our time at the park. My only complaint is the beds were on the hard side. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool while small was terrific, warm and very clean. As was the hot tub. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay, and will most likely stay here again on our next visit.

Located directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. Ideal for a one night stay after a long day at the park. The room was very clean and the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We will stay here again on our next Disneyland trip.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's right across the street from Disneyland. This is our second time staying there and probably the last. The beds were not too comfy which I could live with.  I just cannot get over the yucky carpet. Ours felt disgusting walking on it barefoot and had a large (vomit) stain between the two beds. We also found a large, dead, cockroach right in the middle of the floor when we woke up the first morning. When I told the front desk clerk about our roach problem, she didn't seem surprised or apologetic and said she would send someone to our room while we were out. Our room was next to the breakfast area, which seemed to have a line out the door. The selections were not too impressive, we actually paid to eat breakfast at a nearby
Manager Response: Dear Brandie M,  I'm sadden to hear what you had to go through during your stay, on behalf of my staff I would like to you apologize to you and hope that you give us another chance to make it up. Please contact me directly to resolve this issue immediately. Thank you I look forward hearing from you.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at Del Sol for four nights for the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend.   Good: Location! Next to a few restaurants and across the street from Disneyland.             It was really clean. The employees were very friendly. They held our luggage before we checked in and after we checked out.  The free wifi  was good to have, although it was slow at times and kept logging me out.   Bad:  The bathrooms really need to be updated. They are super small, like imagine a half bathroom, but take out the sink and add a full tub/shower. The door knob kept sticking and  wouldn't close. The shower controls took some upper arm strength to turn on. The shower curtain wasn't quite big enough.   The other bad thing about Del Sol was the breakfast. Premade waffles, doughnuts,
Manager Response: Dear Jusacuz,  We appreciate you for giving us the opportunity to serve you, we hope to you see you again in near future again. Thank you for the great review.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: My friend and I spend a week in Anaheim for her 21st birthday and stayed at the Del Sol Inn. It was the perfect location, only a few minutes walk to the Disneyland Park which was great for us! We had the three day park hopper so it was good to be able to just walk back across the road to the hotel (I think it was a 7 minute walk to the gate from our hotel room) The beds were comfy and the room was lovely, nothing too fancy but it was just enough for us.  The walls are pretty thin so you can hear people in the next room but it wasn't too bad. We were on the second floor so no one would be walking above us. The air con is also very loud but nothing some ear plugs can't fix. We kept it on all night because it was pretty humid.  The pool was sooooooo nice and all the staff were
Manager Response: Dear Hey_Dw,  Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to write us a great review. I‚Äôm so glad to hear that you enjoyed Del Sol Inn service, I will also pass on the message to the staff for doing such a great job. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again next time you are in the area.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights in August. We arrived before check-in and were able to park our car and go over and enjoy Disneyland for a little bit before our rooms were ready. We were traveling with another family and had called ahead to request the rooms be together if possible and to have a first floor room. both requests were accommodated and we had rooms right at the front of the hotel. It was nice to not have to walk to the back of the hotel after a long day in the parks.  The room itself was basic, but it was so spacious! We had plenty of room to just park the stroller at the end of the day and not be tripping over it all night. The beds were okay. If you like firm beds, you will likely be good with these. The A/C works great. This is a huge must for me when traveling to
Manager Response: Dear Wendy C,  Thank you for taking time to write us a great review, it makes team Del Sol inn proud knowing you enjoyed our service. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to serve you again in near future.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: if you are looking for somewhere close to Disneyland that is affordable, this is the place, as it's right a cross the road from the entrance.  The room decor is 70s but the bed is comfy and the showers are hot. There is a small pool and a light breakfast is included in the room tarrif.  Very handy spot.
Manager Response: Dear Gioia M.  Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. I'm Glad to know you enjoyed our room amenities. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to serve you again in near future.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: Excellent location to visit Disneyland within 5 min walk to the park entrance. There is a parking lot (9$+tax a day extra) with parking attendant. Right next to Denny's. Good breakfast - although breakfast room was a bit small. Friendly staff - very tasty cookies are given on arrival (available only in the afternoons) & towels are made into a fun sculptures (we had an elephant and a basket). Swimming pool with hot tub was convenient to relax after walking for the whole day. A couple of minor points: in-room fridge was noisy, and room was hot on arrival.
Manager Response: Hello Nicolas B.  Thank you for taking time to write us a great review, it makes team Del Sol inn proud knowing you enjoyed our service, We take pride in what we do. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to serve you again in near future.  Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: We stayed at the Del Sol from 10-15 August, this being our fourth stay. Whilst the hotel is comfortable, and the rooms are showing their age, it's still number one for its location to Disneyland.   If you choose to drive, there is limited parking at the hotel. They offer a free breakfast (donuts, fruit, porridge and cereals, tea/coffee, waffles) While not the best, you can't beat the price. If you wish to eat out, there is a Denny's in front of the Del Sol bit we would recommend the IHOP, just down the road at the lights on Harbor Blvd. The hotel also had an excellent free wifi service as well.  About 500ms East down Harbor Blvd you will find CVS pharmacy, which carries all,the essential items including milk, cereals etc, including alcohol - a bigger selection and much cheaper

The rooms are old, but functional. The air conditioning is too nosy. . They are not really nice, BUT.. this hotel is the best cheap option (even when in anaheim everything is so expensive) to go to Disneyland cause is just in front of the entrance. You just cross the street and there you are. The breakfast is very flavor limited; boiled eggs, juice, waffles, coffee, milk, apples, donuts and that's it. The chocolate donuts are goof but are the first to finish.   If you are looking for groceries, walk to the left and you'll find a cvs pharmacy. Walk to the right and you'll find a mini mart with the disneyer prices ever! Sorry! I mean, with the more expensive prices ever!

Summary Heading: Better places to stay for the same money
Summary: Stayed in July for the 60th Anniversary at Disneyland Resort. My mom called several times before we checked in to ensure that they had a handicap accessible room reserved for my grandmother (who is 88 and cannot do any steps at all) and they assured us that they did. However, when we arrived, all the handicap rooms were occupied and the only room that they had on the first floor (because there is no elevator) had the bed on top of some sort of platform, which put my grandmother at great risk of tripping and falling. There also seemed to only be one handicapped parking space in the whole lot as well.   My brother and I stayed in a separate room that had constant problems with the toilet. When we called the front desk about it, they were pretty prompt in sending someone to take a

This place is really convenient if you are planning to visit Disneyland or California Adventure. It's practically just across the street. Less than 5 minutes to arrive to the ticket booths. The place is clean and it serves its pourpuse of being a roof to sleep after walking 10 hours in Disney. They have free wifi that it's not fast but it works. The breakfast consists of coffe, juices, cereals, boiled eggs, waffles, donuts and fruit (and it's also free). It's a great deal for visiting the themed parks.  P.S.  In the counter you can buy your Disney Tickets but just for 2 or more days. If you are only going to visit 1 day, you'll have to go to the ticket booth of Disney.  P.S. 2 There's a "Convenience" store to the left of the hotel, but the prices are really high, better walk to
Manager Response: Dear Mariano,  Thank you for write us a great review, I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay with us.Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. we hope to see you again next time you are in the area.   Sincerely, Parveen

Summary: Arrived on a Saturday morning about 9:30 am.  Check-in is at 3 pm so we had some time before we could get into our room.  They do have a room to store luggage.  Our room was clean and ready by 1:30.  Check-in was quick and the front desk person was friendly, professional and very helpful.  We were four adults and 2 children (age 6 and 2) so we had quite a bit of luggage.  The hotel has carts to load all your luggage and take to the room all at once.  The room was pretty cramped with two queen beds, bunk beds, refrigerator, small table and two chairs.  We weren't in the room that much so it wasn't a problem.  The parking lot is small and it looked like parking was performed by valet.  Some of the cars had to be double parked so it could take a while to get your car if you're

Summary Heading: The Noise - My God - The Noise!!!
Summary: Stayed here two days for our family Disneyland visit.  The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the South Harbor Disneyland entrance, behind a Denny's Restaurant.  We arrived to check in.  I requested an upstairs room, which they said they could not accommodate.  I turned my keys over to the valet (all parking is $9 a day - they park and move your vehicle multiple times as cars are double parked).  The room was appointed to average levels, I was surprised to find bunk beds in addition to the 2 queen beds.  All rooms have shutters instead of curtains.  While we had a non-smoking room; many people were smoking outside in the corridors and pool area and their smoke permiated the area.  Now to the noise...  I totally comprehend that near Disneyland you have lots of

Summary Heading: Very nice motel with a perfect location to DL!
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Del Sol Inn for two nights when visiting Disneyland. The location couldn't have been better - Disneyland was literary right across the street. Our room was large and well kept. There was a towel that had been shaped into an elephant, very cute! The free wifi worked well. Be advised that the password for the wifi is changed every Monday morning. We were not told of this when we checked in Saturday evening (and were staying two nights). Breakfast was ok I guess, I've definitely had better, but it was included in the price. There were many sweet options to choose from, but extremely few healthy ones. The seating area was very cramped. The rate was affordable when comparing to other motels / hotels with the same great location. I would definitely consider

Stayed there this past week.  Very nice there was a couple of things wrong.  I didn't have time to let them know but the alarm clock in room 228 is broken.  I used my cell phone to try to wake up every morning. Also donuts for breakfast wasn't my cup of tea.  I went there a couple of yrs ago and they had muffins much better Also why is the pool heated in the middle of july? Also the salt water wasn't good for my little niece she got a earache and didn't want to go in the pool again. But the motel has very comfortable beds clean rooms and so close. Very friendly staff. Will recommended this motel.  Just don't drive there the parking lot is a mess too small.

I had an amazing experience here! I planned to take my daughter for her first Disneyland trip with grandma and myself and both of them came down with a terrible flu. I called the hotel in tears due to the disappointment and the hotel staff let me reschedule my trip for 2 weeks later at no charge. When we got there they remembered us, gave us cookies and we're beyond nice. Since we had to be added we didn't get the room type preference we had wanted so they gave us a discount. We will definitely book our next trip with them!

We have been an avid Del Sol Inn guest and "stayed" their every trip we took to disneyland, which is often. I had booked reservations back in February for our July 17th stay for two nights. I was quoted a certain amount and wen I checked in, it was 36$ more a night! I continued to tell them this was not what I was quoted. Instead of the CUSTOMER being right the rude manager continued to deny the price I was given and  said it was my room number they had told me. Yeah right! I ended up in room 216! Not my quoted price. What I pulled this magical quote out of the air? Needless to say they didn't budge. They just lost a frequent hotel guest and I will NEVER stay here again. Rude rude rude! Just be fore warned and take your quote with you to avoid the bait and switch. Ugggh. Sham on

We were staying here for our Disney vacation, this hotel is a very short walk from the Disney entrance. There are plenty of breakfast and dinner options around the area/hotel.  The room is neat and comfortable with no frills. We were 6 of us and the suite was spacious for us! Did not try the pool, it was not very welcoming. For the price the location is everything!

I went with a friend to visit Disneyland at Easter time and stayed at the Del Sol Inn.  The hotel is clean, roomy, and I love how close it is to the park.  Right across the street!!  And with a Denny's restaurant in front of the hotel, that makes it convenient for breakfast, or a late dinner.  I will definitely stay here again!!

We stayed during Easter of 2015, and we like the location.  We enjoy our stay at the Del Sol.  We enjoy being within walking distance, so we can come back for breaks from the park.  We will be staying again in July for our next visit to Disneyland.

I absolutely adore this hotel! You cannot beat the location (right across from Disneyland, literally), the rooms were very clean, the room rate was affordable, and the hotel grounds were well kept and moderately quiet, although, our room was right in front of the pool and kids were swimming so we could hear them but, big deal. I most certainly enjoyed leaving the parks from a long day of nonstop walking only to take a few short steps across the street and voila, we were at our room! Oh and the dinning outside of the parks is so conveniently located on either side of the hotel...you just can't beat it! Beware though, if you have Sprint cell phone service, you will get NO service in your room, at least we didn't. I swear it was like we were in a black hole, no calls in or out from

Our family of 4 stayed at the Del Sol Inn recently over the course of 3 days and 2 nights (Sunday-Tuesday) for our annual Disneyland vacation. The main selling point of this spot is the location. It's right across the street from the Disney Resort main gate ( you're literally about 5 minutes from the hotel to the main gate). Since we only spend one day at the park, we always take an afternoon break( in order to rest up for the evening), and having a hotel that's right across the street has made this process very easy. Last year we also stayed at a hotel that is across the street, but we were able to pay less this year at the Del Sol Inn. The next item that deserves mention is the quality of the rooms. We had a room with 2 queen beds, on the lower level, towards the front of the

We have stayed at this hotel twice and have been very happy both times. The staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating and the location is perfect. We have stayed in adjoining rooms and also in the family room with bunk beds. The air conditioners worked great and we had very few issues with the wifi. The rooms were clean and although a bit dark, were spacious. I am heading to Disney twice this year and plan to stay here again, both times!

clean sheets and hot shower; but thought i was going to fall through the floor in the bathroom; had to carry my suitcase up probably 20 stairs - not good when case is mid to heavy; only thing going for accommodation is the convenience to Disneyland - good location

We had two Queen rooms they were able to get us connecting rooms. The rooms were very spacious. It is a small hotel (which was nice, no wait in the lobby, they knew who you were) but very convenient and very friendly front desk. It is located right across the street from Disneyland. We have stayed many places near Disneyland and this is one of the best. We added an additional night and the front desk worked with us to make sure we didn't have to move to another room. The Breakfast room was small, nothing special but just enough to get you on your way to Disneyland. Would definitely stay again.

The only good thing about this hotel was the location across the road from Disneyland. It was a terrible hotel because the staff were rude, the breakfast service was a choice of fruity loops or corn flakes and sugary crossonts. The bowl of fruit was just mouldy things. The bunk beds were super short and you could only fit a toddler in them or maybe up to 8. The beds were comfortable altogether. You had to pay to use the safe in your room. you also could  hear everything that the people were doing next door and being on the bottom floor is the worst thing ever because you can hear the people walking around up above you and the bed would squeak every time you or they would roll over

Called around the Disneyland park area to book a room for myself & my family the weekend of Memorial Day & everyone was booked or overpriced. Del Sol Inn had vacancy & they booked me for not only the room size I needed but the price was right! They're located right across the street from Disneyland 's main entrance which is a PLUS. I will continue to stay with them.

Summary Heading: Bunk beds short and only one car per room allowed.
Summary: Can not find it stated on their website or the email confirmation, but their policy is one car per room. This was an inconvenience that could have been avoided if this was explained prior to check in.   Vallet is nothing more than a parking attendant for the tiny parking lot. Suggested we try another hotel to park the extra car. Neighboring hotels parking attendant thought we were crazy for asking, we ended up parking for a large cost at Garden Walk for our stay. Breakfast was meager at best.  The only protein available was hard boiled eggs. Otherwise it is toast, waffles (you put in the toaster), donuts and cereal. Coffee is not fresh brewed, but a push button machine that spits out hot brown liquid that looked like coffee.   Rooms are dark and felt dirty and unkempt. The key

Positives - hotel is in a fabulous location as it's about 200m away from the main Disneyland walkway. - rooms are large and clean - bag storage upon check out - close to food outlets such as Denny's and Ihop.  Negatives - at check in I was asked to provide a credit card which is standard, but what's not standard is for a hold of the full accommodation cost to be placed against my card, especially when I stated that I wished to pay by cash (and had it on me). I was not impressed by this as I am likely to be charged fees for going over my credit limit for this. - I had a room in the ground (level 1) and there is zero sound proofing between the floors - every morning I was woken at 6-6.30am by what sounded like a herd of elephants above me and when they turned on their water it was

They've remolded since the last time we stayed here. The rooms are clean and the continental breakfast is pretty good. The management the great. The best part is the walk, it's right across the street.

I would stay here again because of its great location across from the park. We had a room with a bunk bed for the kids, which they really enjoyed. It was nice to just walk across the street and be back at the hotel after a long day of Disney walking. Beds not as comfy and breakfast donuts were moldy, but besides that our stay was decent. Also, parking is not free but it is valet serviced.

Summary Heading: Great price and just steps away from Disneyland
Summary: This is a nice budget friendly hotel just steps from Disneyland.  The property is older however we found the room to be very clean.  The pool looked really small on-line but we spent a nice afternoon in the pool and had it to ourselves.  The staff was very friendly.  The parking is very tight but my husband had no problems with parking when he could and we used valet when we had to.  My biggest complaints were the breakfast and the other guests.  Breakfast was very limited, the same 2 cereals every morning: instant oatmeal, donuts, pre-made waffles, toast and hard boiled eggs.  Previously we had stayed at the Ramada Maingate and had more choices.  It was also only served between 7-9 which for people headed to the parks early, this was too late for us to eat most days.  Finally,

Great hotel right across the street from Disney entrance. Friendly check in includes chocolate chip cookies. Wi fi and Breakfast included. Mayte keeps the breakfast room supplied with food and a big smile. Coffee maker, microwave, and refrigerator are great. Denny's literally feet from the hotel is super convenient. No elevator and they charge for parking (most hotels there do). We stay here often.

Clean, Comfortable, Close to Disneyland.  Had a wonderful stay a couple weeks ago.  I went with an old friend.  We wanted someplace close so that we could easily go back to the hotel in the middle of the day.  This definitely met the bill for us.

Recently stayed here on a family vacation to Disneyland. In my opinion it is the perfect distance to the park and it's nice and quiet. Being tucked away in between two larger hotels keeps the hotel a little secret. The rooms are clean and pretty comfortable.  Its directly behind a Dennys and there is also an ihop close by. Keep in mind there is valet parking and they only allow one car per room since their parking lot is so limited. I learned this the hard way since it is not posted anywhere on their website or on any other site.  That's why no 5 "star" rating. But all in all a nice little hotel.

We stayed at Del Sol Inn directly across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure. We were located next door to Denny's which was incredibly convenient. The hotel offered a continental breakfast which helped us get to the theme parks more quickly. We were able to pop back to the hotel at lunch for a break or brief nap and swim. The pool and hot tub are perfectly situated as are the vending and ice machines. Check in and check out was a breeze with the professional and courteous staff. Housekeeping was incredible. We plan to stay at the Del Sol Inn every time we visit Disneyland which is at least twice a year! We stayed in a family suite which was perfectly sized and wonderfully priced!

We wanted to stay as close to the main gate as possible and this was the cheapest place. It ended up being a diamond in the rough. We had the family suite with the bunk beds which my 3.5 year old son LOVED! From our motel room door to the front gate it was 7 minutes. Will definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Had a great time.. Wonderful stay.. 4 day trip and had great service..clean friendly , also had the best rates in town. Definitely going there again.. SOOOONNNN! The rooms had a great size came with microwave and fridge ! Great flat screen TV !

We were so surprised to find Del Sol Inn at such a discounted rate so we took advantage and booked it! It is literally across the street from the entrance of Disneyland. You can literally walk back and take a nap if you wanted to. We requested an upstairs room and we were accommodated with no hesitations. The only problem we found was that parking is literally a big mess. We were told we could park anywhere but you can seriously stand in the middle of the parking lot and count how many parking spaces there is. There were cars parked behind other cars and that's what we were initially going to do but we thought twice and waited about 30 minutes until someone checked out and left. Other than that I loved my stay :)

Summary Heading: Incredible Customer Service, Across-the-street, Will be staying here again!
Summary: I can't begin to express how much I enjoyed staying at the Del Sol inn Anaheim Resort. I spent  planning a trip for myself and 6 other friends for my 2014 high school graduation. My mom and I read reviews on different hotels in the area and chose the Del Sol because of its proximity to the park, its super low price, and the reviews. We typically go to the park right when it opens and close it down at 1am, so we just we looking for a place to sleep. We booked the hotel for 5 days in late June. Under reservations, we noticed as place for special requests (aka graduations, anniversaries, birthdays). So we let them know that I was graduating. I'm not kidding you, the woman at the front desk called us the week that we booked our trip asking about my graduation. When we arrived at our

stayed there in 2013.  my oldest niece loved staying there.  she loved the pool and fell right to sleep in the bed.  she slept great every night and I did too.   staying there with my youngest niece this year.  her older sister wants her to stay at the same hotel she stayed at that she will have a great time as she did.  just want to get in touch with the hotel to ask them something about my next time staying there.  please answer my email I sent directly to you by my personal emailbox.

Summary Heading: Family friendly steps from the gate
Summary: We spent 5 nights at the Del Sol Inn.  Our room was above the pool.  Very clean, friendly staff, pool was a great break from walking all over the park.  It's an older Inn but beds were great and room was well looked after.  We had a fridge and microwave in the room.  We will definitely stay here again.

The title says it all really. We booked this hotel purely down to its location (opposite Disneys entrance) and price. Yes the hotel is slightly outdated but it is clean and tidy and just an ideal base to stay after a long day at the park.

Great hotel. Have stayed here before. We stayed at a time when we hit some serious rain a few days of our stay and it was great to have a place as close as this. Rooms where clean, fresh, and comfortable. No issues with staff or management. Breakfast was OK to get you moving to stand in line to enter Disneyland. Smaller hotel,so make your reservations early. Will stay here again.

Great location, it was walking distance to Disneyland, the staff was really nice. Great room size, beds were hard but other then that the stay was nice. The price we paid was perfect. I don't recommend the food.

The location couldn't have been any better.  We were able to come and go throughout the day because we were so close to the main entrance.  The hotel suited our needs.  The pool is kept very clean and the staff was friendly and very helpful.  We experienced a plumbing issue, but maintenance was able to solve the problem quickly.  My family and I will stay again next time we visit Disneyland.

This is by far our favorite spot to stay when visiting Disneyland or southern California! We stay here even if we don't go to the park! We love how the rooms have two queen beds and a bunk bed. Also a microwave and a fridge! We also love that the swimming pool and parking lot is just a few steps away from our room. We have three kids and lots to carry and this is awesome! Love that my kids can just take five steps and be at the pool! We also love the staff. They are always so kind and willing to help in any way possbile. They go the extra mile to help me anytime I ask for anything. Thanks so much Del Sol I really love staying at your awesome hotel! Its our home away from home :)
Manager Response: Dear Heather,  I'm so glad to hear that your kids love the pool, we really do appreciate your business over so many years. I will defiantly pass on the message to my employees for doing such an great work. Thank you for being an excellent guest, we look forward to serve you again in near future.  Sincerely,

Summary: Location location location!!!! We stayed here approximately 15 times now over the past few years when we visit Disneyland.  It is very convient to be able to go to the park and come back and rest/recharge. It's great to come back and get jackets, nap, cold drinks, etc.   It's not the RITZ but it is affordable and real close by.  We stayed in other places where we had to drive and park and wait for the parking tram which just takes too much time.  It's appx 7minute walk to the main gate from your room.  Nice clean room and shower... Only downside is the excited kids running up and down the walk way.  But you're at Disneyland so that's expected.  Also the rooms face the parking lot so sometimes you can hear the loading and unloading of loud guest. Also, their car alarm chirps. But

Summary Heading: Perfect for getting the most out of Disneyland
Summary: Older "motel" but well suited to Disneyland guests.  Basic amenities but we just needed a basic place to sleep.  We experienced a plumbing problem late at night which would have meant no showers until it was resolved.  The hotel maintenance guy was on it less than 5 mins after we called and everything was fixed within 10 minutes in a professional and courteous manner.  Would gladly stay there again next time we're visiting the park.
Manager Response: Dear Bill,  Thank you for taking time to write us a great review, It makes team Del So lnn proud knowing you Enjoyed our service. We truly appreciate your business and look forward to serve you again in near future.  Thank you,

Summary: We planned our family vacation  and stayed at the Del Sol February 17-19, and we could have gotten any closer to the entrance of the park :) the rooms were clean  and it was close to place we could walk to for shopping or a quick bite  We arrived a bit early but were allowed to park so that we could enjoy Disneyland and not worry about checking in later in the day. Thank you for the great stay.

Summary Heading: Family on a budget for Disney - look no further
Summary: This place is all about location - it is probably the closest motel to Disney's main gate. The parking is bad - but I parked my show winning nehicle there with no issues or damage for 4 days. I skipped the breackfast because some people think they have to take all the banana's and oranges to get them through the day, I actually watched 2 people take all teh fruit that was out leaving nothing for any person behind them, if you want to get some quick breakfast - just stop at the Denny's in the front of the hotel. I have been to Disneyland probably about 20 times - I have stayed her the last 15 times and if I go again next year - this is were I would stay.

I was here from February 13th-16th we had a great time! Location doesn't get much better and the room was clean. The air conditioner was a treat since it was 90 while we visited! Also the beds were comfortable and I didn't hear others while in my room!

When traveling with kids this is a great place to stay.  Located across the street from Disneyland close enough to run back for a quick power nap.  The rooms are clean and neat.  Nothing super fancy but the location is great.

Very close well with in walking distance to Disneyland breakfast options could be a lot better fruit was old and beat up so don't count on that as your breakfast staff was friendly  also they need to move smoking area away from room access it literally was just out side my door way to a non smoking kids room

It was the perfect location for us.. right across the street from Disneyland. Yes parking lot is small Yes you can hear the people upstairs walking around their room. The continental breakfast was not all that great. But it works great for a 2 day trip to the happiest place on earth. The price was perfect for a fixed budget family.

We come to Disneyland every 12-15 months and we always stay at the Del Sol Inn! We love it!! The location is awesome and the breakfast is doable. The staff is always friendly and the pool/hot tub is clean. We love love love the beds and pillows. The bunk beds are a nice perk. We might look around at the other hotels on Harbor Blvd for our next trip only because the prices keep going up. We usually come around the same time of year and only a few years ago we paid $67 a night and this trip was $115. They also now charge $9 a day for parking when that was free a few years ago. We would always choose to stay here but they might price us out...
Manager Response: Dear AnnaMarie C.,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel, and THANK YOU for being a loyal guest we appreciate you choose us for so many years. We do offer return guest discount which is available to all our returning guest, please mention it to our reservation specialist for appropriate discount towards your next reservation, You can also call me directly at 714-234-3411. We hope to see you again in near future.  Sincerely, Best Regards

Summary: Husband and I stayed here form the 3rd of Feb. to the 6th of Feb. Wonderful place to stay. Directly across the street from the Disney Land Resort. took less then 5 mins to get to either park or downtown Disney. most of my time with in the parks or downtown but one day I took a me day and stayed around the hotel and enjoyed the pool area the spa was wonderful to soak my poor hurting feet. housekeeping always did a wonderful job on the rooms and if you are in the room just step out for a few mins took no more then 20 mins and you were back in the room. The property is a non smoking property with a small parking lot but they do offer valet parking for an additional $9 a night and it is well worth it. The Front Desk staff was very helpful and if you need anything they are at the

We have stayed at the Del Sol Inn several times now with November being our most recent.  Staff are friendly & accommodating. Complimentary breakfast is sufficient for the average family with enough of a variety.  Location is fantastic!  We will continue to stay at this location with our family of 7. Thank you:)

The room worked well for our family.  Having a bunk bed in the room with 2 queens was great as each child got their own bed.  Hot tub was nice, pool is a little deep for kids unless they can swim.  Breakfast was quite adequate, staff was friendly and the location was perfect.  It is not fancy but good value for your money.
Manager Response: Dear Joanne S.  Thank you for taking time to review our hotel, Bunk beds rooms are most popular and I'm glad your kids liked them. It makes Del Sol Inn team proud knowing the guest like yourself leave happy with our service, Thank you for giving us opportunity to serve you and we hope to see you again in near future.  Thank you,

Summary Heading: Great budget hotel 1/4 mi from Disneyland entrance
Summary: Very pleased with this somewhat vintage, budget hotel practically across the street from entrance to Disneyland.  Two doors down is a Tony Roma's (BBQ, ribs) and the hotel itself is behind a Dennys, back from the traffic and main street.  Rooms clean and comfortable; adjoining rooms (with door) are awkward as sofa beds placed in front of them! Hot water didn't arrive speedily, and housekeeping carts are noisy on the 2nd (top) floor.  However the cleanliness, relative isolation from street traffic, and bed comfort made up for that.  Did not take advantage of complimentary breakfast.  Parking in immediate area can be tight, but there is the Denny's lot immediately in front of the hotel as overflow.  Recommend this hotel as cheaper alternative to the Disney hotels; it is easily as

Summary Heading: Perfect Location, Clean and an overall nice place.
Summary: We've stayed here almost every time we've came down! Room, Location everything was perfect.. Super convenient with children! Room was always clean when we came back and smelled clean. Loved our stay and will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear NatPease,   Thank you taking time out of your busy schedule to write us a great review. i'm so glad to hear that your kids loved the Del Sol Inn, I will also pass on the message to the housekeeping for doing such a great job. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. we hope to see you again next time you are in the area.

Summary: Had a great stay at the Del Sol Inn. We stayed in one of the bunk bed rooms which gave us a lot of room to spread out. I called ahead to find out the length of the bunk bed as we had a tall teen staying with us. They were very accommodating and measured the bed for me. I honestly cannot remember what the measurements were, but fit perfect for my friends daughter who is 5'4". Would have been a tight fit otherwise, unless you sleep curled in a ball! The hotel is set back from the street so no noise from traffic, and was a VERY short walk to the parks! You're literally across the street from the bus depot entrance! I would DEFINITLY stay here again (and plan to in May 2015)!

Del Sol is an older hotel with a bit of a run down feeling.  The room was clean but fans, refrigerator, a/c unit were very noisy.  Hot water was in abundance and the room fit our needs very well.  It is right across the street from Disneyland which is super convenient.  It was quite expensive, but less than staying on Disney property.  I just wish with the cost, they would upgrade the hotel.  I would choose to stay there again.  Parking is an extra $9.  The safe is an extra $1 a day even if you don't use it.  Can't beat the location.

Del Sol Inn is so crazy close to the Disneyland front gates that we would come back from the park and take breaks. Our room was a pleasant surprise - clean, quiet (except for rolling housekeeping. carts) and fairly large refrigerator.  Parking is $9 and at checkout they allowed me to pay another $9 to park all day instead of having to drive over to the park (whose parking lots are further from the front gates than the hotel!).  They give us fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies on arrival, a nice touch. A perfect, inexpensive base with which to storm the Magic Kingdom

Summary Heading: Spectacular Choice for a Large Family
Summary: We absolutely love this hotel.  It is clean, convenient and spacious.  When it's just mom, dad and all of our kids we are often faced with hotels telling us we need to reserve 2 rooms.  The Del Sol Inn has rooms that acomodate our large family in just one room because of the 2 queen/bunkbed setup!  Breakfast is always plenty and saves us a fortune!!  Reservations are never an issue.  Walk to the park is super close which is helpful because you KNOW you always forget something in the room and need to run back!   Pool is clean.  Parking is a little tight, but has never been an issue.  We will continue to recommend to our friends traveling to Anaheim!

In researching for our latest Disneyland trip the recurring negative about the Del Sol was parking.  I agree it is tight and not enough spaces for rooms but we had no problem finding a space.  They do offer valet at no extra charge.    The Room:  Like advertised the kids suite/room had 12 queen beds and a bunk bed which was perfect for us.  The room looked nice but felt dingy.  Overall it was spacious enough for the 5 of us which was great.  The bathroom is small and the floor was sagging a bit by the tub.  I told them and hopefully it will get repaired.  The beds really weren't comfortable and the sheets were stiff.  They could use new mattresses and sheets and that'll take care of that issue.  Sound travels a ton there.  They had a quiet time rule in effect at 10pm which is

We stay here every time we go to Disneyland which is 2-3 times a year. It is right behind Denny's and the walk to Disneyland is about 5 minutes. The staff is always helpful and nice. The rooms are always clean and the maid service is really friendly and I love how they set up my kids toys when cleaning. Every time we come back to the room my kids love seeing that each touch.

You can't beat the location if you want to go to Disneyland. It is within great walking distance. The rooms aren't bad, although many of them have shared doors which can cause noise problems. And the wifi was terrible. I could never get it to work. But the location is great.

We stayed over Christmas 2013 (from the 24th-30th) I chose this hotel because I knew we would only be using it to sleep and rest from our adventures in the park. I wanted to save money on our hotel but had a specific list of things I wanted: 1. Walking distance to the park 2. a simple free breakfast 3. Free wifi  Del Sol Inn had them all... we were greeted with warm cookies. the wifi while not super fast worked. The breakfast was very simple (toast, toaster waffles, hard boiled eggs, cereals, coffee, tea, juice, muffins, fruit) the breakfast room was small but the staff encouraged us to take as much as we wanted to our rooms. We usually had a quick bite and then took some of the muffins and fruit to take into the park with us. it was less then a 5 minute walk from our hotel room

We have annual passes, so we have stayed in a lot of hotels near Disneyland. This is our favorite! The kids suite was the perfect size and the location can't be beat!! It's literally right across the street from the main entrance to disneyland. The parking was tight, but valet parking was provided and they took care of our big van. Breakfast was a bonus, simple but great way to start the day. We've already booked our next stay here! Highly recommend it.

The first time we booked there was because it is just 3 businesses and a street crossing to get to the Disneyland Resort. That was years ago. It was for the convenience of being able to come back for a few hours for a nap for grandkids, and now we stay for we grandparents who can use a rest as well. :) the place isn't flashy, but it is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. Ask for Loretta!  There's also a continental breakfast, comfortable beds and if there is a problem, it is fixed asap. Looking forward to our next trip. Tip: call early for best prices.

We booked this hotel as the reviews on Tripadvisor were quite positive and the price was great for right across the street from Disneyland. Well... the location is the only good thing about it.  After the first night we requested a change in rooms due to the overwhelming smell of urine coming from the walkway outside. There was no problem switching but they did not seem surprised at our request.  Once in the new room, we noticed that the bottoms of our feet were turning black from walking around on the carpets and the room was just generally dirty.  The breakfast that the boast is included is ridiculous. Just some stale donuts, instant oatmeal packages and unrefrigerated old hardboiled eggs. The breakfast area was tiny and not serviced so was filthy and littered with garbage and

This hotel is a winner for it's awesome location, pretty much directly across from the entrance to Disneyland! The staff we're friendly and helpful. The car park could be a little bigger though, it was always full... but in saying that, the valet boy will park your car elsewhere and bring it to you so it doesn't really matter.

We stayed at the Del Sol Anaheim in October 2014 for 8 nights. The location was ideal, a very short walk to the intersection to cross to the parks.  I booked many months in advance and got a really good rate.  The $4.34 resort fee, $1.00 safe fee and taxes per night were included on the original invoice online so there were no surprises or additional fees.  We have stayed at several other hotels along South Harbor Blvd.  This trip, we were trying to be more frugal and this hotel fit the bill.    Check in was quick and easy.  Check out was extended a couple of hours for which we were very grateful as our flight left later in the evening .  Both desk clerks were very polite and friendly.  Being the week before Halloween, the front desk had a bowl full of candies that they refilled

The parking lot is too small. There were too many cars, so they started double parking.  You pay $9 a night to park (which is not included in the fees they quote you, so you get charged when you get there), and then get stuck having people parked so close that they ding up your doors, or they park people right behind you in a spot that isn't even a parking space. The breakfast room is tiny, and the breakfast is poor quality.  We ended up buying our own breakfast for the kids because theirs was lacking. The shower in our room did not work.  The lady at the front desk was ornery

We've stayed at a few other hotels on South Harbor but this place is definitely the perfect location.  But that's not all.  Check in was great.  We even got adjoining rooms on the top floor.  Front desk staff, valet staff, housekeeping staff all very friendly.  They show that they appreciate you staying at their motel.  Comfortable beds, other than pillows.  Rooms were clean and spacious. If you're wanting just a quick light breakfast, the continental breakfast is that, nothing great. That's the only downfall with this motel.. We'd definitely stay there on our next visit.

Costs:  I'm going to address this first, since it seems to be the reason for so many negative reviews: Fees. - I booked the room through the hotel's website. The confirmation email reads like this: Total (before tax): $429.26, Room Tax: 17.00% $72.97, Sales Tax: 0.00% $0.00, "Resort Fee and Safe Warranty Fee" with no total next to it, and Total: $502.23. - In reality, the actual receipt included the following: room rate was $429.28, resort fee was $4.34/day ($17.36), room safe fee was $1/day ($4), parking fee was $8/day ($32), "Tourism Improv. District Assessment" was $2.42/day ($9.68), and sales tax was $18.10/day ($72.40). - The grand total was $564, which ends up being room rate (correct), tax (correct), parking fee (expected IF you need to park a car, which we did), safe fee

Booked in as it was so close to Disneyland and the quoted value looked good. Hidden charges were then applied at check-out! Not good value anymore compared to adjacent hotels! Parking is NOT included. There is a safe in your room - you get charged extra for this!  Wifi was sporadic and did not work on two of the 4 days I was there. I did not try the complimentary breakfast so no comment there.  Room and furnishings were worn but suitable for the price (even with the extra charges)  Staff was friendly and helpful but extra charges put me off.  Would not stay again due to hidden charges and poor wifi performance.

The location was great. Only a five minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland. The rooms were nice and clean. The continental breakfast had a few more choices than the average one. Parking was reasonable and the staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

This hotel is directly across the street from the main entrance to both parks.  Talk about close and convenient. Makes it super doable to return mid afternoon for a nap or swim and then head back into the park for a long evening.  We stay here frequently because we are annual passholders and we have never been disappointed with our accomodations and the helpful staff.

Every year I take students from japan to do a home stay in Idaho.  On our way home we always go to Disneyland for 3 days.  I've stayed at 7 different hotels, some good, some ok but all were not great!  del Sol was great.  It had a small hotel feeling, the staff were so friendly, the location was perfect!  I'll definitely stay here again next year!

Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was CLEAN and nicely furnished. Unlike a lot of places we've stayed this air conditioner didn't clank or noisily interrupt our sleep. Very convenient to Disneyland. We didn't use the pool. The breakfast was adequate.

We love this hotel and stay here every time we visit Southern California! Even if we dont go to Disneyland we stay here. We love that the rooms have 2 big queen beds AND a bunk bed!!! And that it is directly across the street from the entrance of Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure! I have three small kids and love to takes lots of breaks. Another feature we love about this hotel is that the pool is so close to the rooms and we dont have to truck all of our kids and stuff very far. I love the breakfast options and I also really like how this hotel is set back off of harbor so its quiet. The parking is great too! Another great feature is that this hotel is right next door to a Dennys so if your hungry you dont have to look far :)  I could go on and on! I highly

The hotel is close to the Disneyland entrance. The staff were pleasant and the room was clean and spacious. We will stay again next year. We didn't use the pool but it is a good size. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast which were included as we preferred to sleep in.

This was a great deal with the hotel. Is just across the street from Disney entrance.  Breakfast is not great you have other options right beside. The room was big very clean and ac was worling great. We enjoyed our stay. The only down was the parking fee.

We stayed here for a week during a Disneyland visit in June.  The staff was very helpful.  The continental breakfast was filling, but Denny's and IHOP are just a few steps away if you choose to sleep in.  The rooms are large and clean.  The best part is when you are tired from a long day at Disneyland your room is a very short walk away.  The walk is 5 minutes or less.

We have stayed at all but 2 of the hotel located across the street from Disneyland. Hands down this is our favorite place to stay.   The rooms are a bit older then some of the other hotels but they are very clean and well kept (i dont worry about the kids sitting on the floor). The hotel staff makes you feel like are your friends, and not just doing thier job.   I could go on and on but I will just sum it up. My family loves this place best value, clean, friendly, and for Disney goers the best location.

After reading some of the not so pleasant reviews, especially the many that warned of paper thin walls we were a little nervous upon our arrival for a 7-night stay.  Our fears were gone upon check in.  The rooms are quite large, we had a family room with two queen beds and bunk bed and there was plenty of room for all five of us.  The hotel is tucked back behind a Denny's but is still only a 5 minute walk to the main entrance to Disneyland.  It has a small salt water pool that is kept at the perfect temperature for a refreshing dip after a hot day at the parks.  The housekeeping and maintenance staff are top-rate, the grounds are spotless and every morning they were out there cleaning the pool.  The air conditioning worked great, there is a microwave and mini fridge in each room

Summary Heading: Large rooms, friendly staff, would stay again
Summary: I stayed at this resort for seven nights and the experience was near perfect. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable, The microwave and fridge make it easy to have in room meals if needed.  The free breakfast is a great start to the day or you can hit the Denny's just in front of the hotel or IHOP two doors down. Disneyland is steps away and makes it so easy to bounce back and forth to the parks.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. This is not the Ritz, but as a budget hotel, it is one of the best options within walking distance to Disney.

My family and I really enjoyed staying here :). No, it's not fancy but neither are we, lol. It's clean with a great continental breakfast and a really warm , clean pool. My family and I travel with my Autistic son's service dogs (3) and usually encounter some sort of resistance or another from other places we've stayed. This place was wonderful and so cool! No one questioned why we had our dogs. They simply understood :). I will tell every and anybody who's looking for a place to stay in this area about the Del Sol Inn. Loved it! Will be coming back for sure!!!

We just had our yearly vacation and it was my first time staying at Del Sol the rooms where very clean and it was very accommodating everyday they cleaned our room I love that it was just five minute walk to Disneyland price was affordable yes the walls where a little thin but not that bad I would definitely recommend to stay at this hotel

My girls and I stayed here for the first time for our Disneyland vacation.  The location was awesome.  It was great to be right across from the entrance and not have to walk too far or get a shuttle.  The rooms were big and clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was very nice.  They kept our luggage for us, as we arrived before check-in, and also kept it when we checked out, as our flight wasn't until later in the evening.  The AC worked great, which was nice after a hot day, and there were plenty of plug-ins for all our phone chargers. The breakfast and spotty wi-fi were probably our biggest complaints.  The breakfast was always stocked and we could take it back to our room, but was the same everyday.  A little variety would've make it better.  We will definitely

When we had arrived nice friendly staff, rooms cleaned when returned from disneyland. All over nice place to stay. This hotel was very close to disneyland entrance. They had a nice little breakfast but no creamer.

If you are the type of family/group that likes a fine hotel with plush rooms and over the top customer service, this is not the hotel for you.   This hotel has some thin walls, and really small parking spaces.  However, this hotel is located directly across the street from the Disneyland's main entrance. It makes for easy access in the morning and at night when the last thing you want to do is take a tram back to the hotel or parking lot. Its location also makes the afternoon nap a definite possibility.  Besides the location, it has a nice pool, comfortable beds, and it is plenty clean.   The best part of this hotel is the AC that will cool down your room in under a minute, plus it gives you that AC sound that reminds you of how sweet vacation really is.

Summary Heading: I really enjoy staying at del sol inn would recommend it to anyone.
Summary: Great service the staff is super nice and helpful. The location is perfect. Very close to Disneyland.  Clean good size rooms nice pool area and good breakfast. Definitely coming back to this place again.

Summary Heading: Great location, but the structure should be renovated
Summary: The plus of this place is doubtless the location: in front of Disney parks entrance, just on the other side of the road!! Concerning the structure itself, interaction with the staff has been surely positive, all the people we met were really nice with us, but this is where positive aspects unfortunately stops... Rooms are old (bed creak, shower difficult to run) and unless you turn ac at max also really hot. The structure is also very noisy too: you can clearly hear people in the other rooms or, worse pulling their luggage on the gallery outside..

Nice clean hotel with good size rooms which include a small frig and microwave. The price is right and just a few minutes walk from Disneyland. The staff are super nice and helpful. I stay at Del Sol inn several times a year and always have a good stay. I do however hate to pay extra to park in the hotel parking lot as I am already paying for my room but what do you do.

Our family recently went on vacation and stayed here again as we had enjoyed our previous stay last year.  This year we requested connecting rooms because we had an infant in our party.  Upon checking in we were told its not available.  I asked the front desk clerk if at anytime during our stay would one become available.  She told me NO...had a little bit of an attitude and wish I would remember her name.  The next day I asked the new front desk person and he informed me that there was a connecting room available tomorrow and he would make a note and check with the front desk tomorrow.  I do and she tells me its not available until the next day and that he must have read the check out day wrong.  I say that is fine and we eventually get connecting rooms.  The front desk clerk

Summary Heading: Great Stay! Will come back again!!!
Summary: A great hotel with excellent service. Whats better? Right across the park entrance. Affordable stay and comfortable as well. My family will certainly be staying at this hotel in the future. In fact, we're already booked again:)

Summary Heading: Super Helpful, Clean and a Whole Lot of Bang for Few Bucks
Summary: We checked in early and stayed late, for which we payed nothing extra and in fact the staff was super gracious in ensuring we could do so even at the last minute.  The rooms were more luxurious than one would expect for the reasonable price, super clean and spacious, and the mini breakfast fairly decent.  The pool even had floaties to play with and a sweet little Jacuzzi.  It's literally two driveways next to the crosswalk to the Parks, and one cannot get closer for less.  Also, they give you yummy cookies upon arrival to welcome you.  We really enjoyed it and highly recommend it.  Hope you have fun too :)

First off, I've been looking for a great hotel to stay at that was directly across the park!  This hotel was awesome!!!   When we checked in they gave us chocolate chip cookies, valet parking when the self parking is taken. Parking is limited but like I said they have valet at no extra charge.   The rooms are very nice!!!! Roomy!!! Beds are comfy!!! Pillows are comfy not hard at all!!! Flat screen tv with a lot of channels to choose from! A lot of plugs to plug in chargers for electronics. Btw they all work!!! Bathrooms are clean and look fairly new. Water is nice and warm!   No elevator is the only downside but other than that you cannot beat the price and the location!! 10 minute walk to the parks!! Loved it! My new place to stay!

We have stayed at this hotel for years as we have visited Disneyland. This time though we stayed in a floor room and all we heard was the creaking above us every time the occupants moved. This is a older hotel that has been updated but just make sure you stay on the second level. The free breakfast is lacking in quality too and it felt like they charged all these little extra fees. The good is that it is so close to Disney but that's about it.

Summary Heading: We had a really great time
Summary: Del Sol Inn is very good when you go to Anaheim to visit the Disney Parks. It's very close to them, you can go walking, there are lots of restaurantes and shops around it. The continental breakfast is simple, but it's ok if you're not taking so long. There is also a coin-op laundry where u can wash your clothes by yourself and without spending too much. The employees are very kind and attentive. The negative points are that I think that carpets on the floor are very bad and dirty, if u walk around the bedroom with no shoes your feet get very dirty, we also could find papers and old socks (probably from other guests) under the bed, when we had to lift the foam cos my son dropped his hat behind the bed. If it was not this observation, I would give them 5 stars. I really recomend!

We've stayed here many times & never had a problem. We loved how close it is to disney. This stay however was horrible! The room wasnt clean, we asked for a king and got "an upgrade" to a bigger room. The room was far from an upgrade. You could hear every noise from up stairs. The walls are very thin. We were up late because of the noise. We loved it when T.J was the manager. They now have a new manager which needs to work on customer service skills he did provide a discount but a apology for our troubles would've been just as good never once did he apologize for our bad stay.

Great little cozy hotel near perfect local right across from Disneyland. Even though small this hotel is perfect and very economical for Disneyland travelers. The employees are very helpful and always willing to accommodate all your needs. I would highly recommend this quaint little hotel to everyone.

Hotel is average.  Rooms are good-sized.  What you can't beat is the location... very close to Disney parks.  Pool is small, and it's deep for kids.    There is no self-parking, you have to use the valet.  Wi-Fi is very inconsistent.

Our family of four continued our two week road trip from Alberta (after our stay in Palm Springs) with a stay in Anaheim. We have stayed here many times when visiting Disneyland. The staff is very accommodating and Parveen, the manager is excellent.  Check in was quick and easy.  You can't beat the across the street location.  The rooms are standard.  They are a decent size with a small microwave and fridge.  Our room had two queen beds for our family of four. The breakfast was more extensive than previous visits with oranges and apples, toast, oatmeal, dry cereals, hard boiled eggs and donuts.  It is a small crowded room in the mornings so we got what we wanted and ate in our room.  We haven't stayed in this hotel for about 3 years and they charge for parking now.  This was

Thank you Del Sol Inn! We had a lovely stay. The rooms were large and clean and the staff were very helpful whenever we needed anything. A very short walk to disneyland and lots to eat nearby. It is set back from the road a little so there is very little road noise or random passers by. Brilliant - thank you!

We stayed here for 1 week from 28 May 2014. The hotel is just a short 10 minute walk from the Disneyland main entrance, making it ideal for those wanting to visit the park.   We were located on the top floor in room 242. The room is basic but comfortable - 2 queen beds, small bathroom but excellent water pressure and ample hot water, good size flat screen TV and free wifi. The complex has a good sized pool and spa but it can be busy and noisy, although the pool closes nightly at 10pm.   Whilst we didnt have a car, parking is limited and I believe is charged at US$8 per day. There is a parking attendant on site each day but if you have a large car/ute, you may find the parking challenging.   The hotel does supply a free breakfast in a room near the office on the lower level. It

This hotel was very clean, staff was very nice and the location is great for Disneyland! It is truly walking distance from main gate. My only complaint was we were on bottom floor room and we could hear the foot traffice above us.

When we arrived "someone" had cancelled one of our groups rooms. The parking was horrible. The parking attendant brought out a luggage carrier to help us, when I asked how to get it up stairs he said we couldn't. Kinda pointless. The location was perfect. We went back to the hotel and ordered pizza for lunch, it was nice too get a little break. I booked on black Friday and got a great deal.

We always stay here in the summer.  Pricing is adequate and the pool is nice.  Being right across the street from Disneyland is great.  Wi-Fi is sketchy most times..as a matter of fact, we've started using our own iphone as a hotspot for the kids and their ipads.  Just can't count on it working.  Parking there is atrocious, but once you have a spot, there's no need to move it since you can walk everywhere.  Sure, there's better hotels... but you'll pay more and you're really only there a fraction of the time anyway.

The Kids Suite has two queen beds and bunk bed. The rooms were very clean. The staff was nice especially, Larnel, who gave us a great deal on the room. Thank you!!! Breakfast was not that great, I wish they provided pastries  and bagels  instead of doughnuts. Maiyta was very friendly  and seemed like hard worker. I would go again because the price and the location was great.

Summary Heading: My daughter wants to go back
Summary: We stayed here for a week in May 2014. Here is our list of pros and cons: Pro Close to Disneyland Close to restaurants Room was large enough for our family of 6 Con Wifi did not work with some devices and REALLY slow with others (even after we asked for help) We had a room in the back corner and noise from the pool was a problem at times Parking was tight  There is 1 washer and 1 dryer and it costs $2 to do either. Overall we had a great time. My kids loved donuts for breakfast each morning. I figured we were on vacation. My daughter loved the bunk bed and has asked repeatedly when we are going back. For the price we got I would stay here again.

The Kids Suite has two queens and a bunk bed, which was great for our family.  The parking lot is small and so they double park cars, but the valet service was great and available anytime we needed them.  Front desk was very pleasant.  Breakfast is not that great, but we brought items for breakfast anyway.  Right across the pedestrian walkway into Disneyland.  Great price compared to others right next to this hotel for more beds.

Summary Heading: Second stay at Del Sol Inn
Summary: Just returned from my second stay at Del Sol Inn, the staff are still friendly and helpful in the office the rooms are always clean, and it is so close to Disneyland. This time we stayed on the top level which was much better, if I ever go back to Anaheim I would stay here again.

Staying here was a great experience!  Location...right across the street!  Room...Nice, comfy beds and clean!  Staff....very friendly!  Parking attendants are very nice and helpful as well.  We will definitely be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Del Sol  = good location for Disneyland
Summary: In trying to weight all the pros and cons, I decided on a 3, but some of what this hotel offers could be a '4'. And with a discounted rate, that helps temper the expectations. The location is great in that is it set back from the main street (behind the Denny's), and almost right across from the Disney main entrance.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I have only good things to say about them. They responded quickly to our requests, but unfortunately we had to make those requests in the first place; our friends had a broken security lock on their door (which was repaired immediately upon request). Our top blanket and top coverlet on the bed both had stains (not permanent ones) and those were replaced immediately as well.  The room was fine, however our bathroom was

We chose this hotel for two simple reasons- it's affordable and directly across the street from the park.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable enough.  Parking is very limited, but there's a valet to double park the guest vehicles. The grounds were clean. The front desk staff members were pleasant.  Noise wasn't an issue at all.  I only had two minor complaints: - The carpet near the bathroom was damp when we checked in.  - The free breakfast was pretty awful. Tiny cups of coffee and weird, generic food. You'd be better off to bring your own chow or stock up at the Target down the street.

We stay here every time we come down to Disneyland. The rooms are nice and clean and it's located right across the street from the park. It is also close to many restaurants. We have never had any problems while staying here.

Summary Heading: Great service and so close to Disneyland entrance
Summary: We chose this hotel for three reasons. Great price, awesome location across the road from Disneyland entrance, a room that could fit a family - two queen and a bunk bed.  We were surprised that the room had more space than we thought it would. We had read reviews that the rooms could be noisy and they were, we were  downstairs and could hear people moving around upstairs, AC and plumbing was also very noisy but everyone pretty much got up and went to bed around the same time as we were all generally there for the same thing - Disneyland. So it was not a big issue unless you wanted to sleep in.   The pool and spa were really warm and enjoyed by the kids.  Due to the location we could come home for an  rest mid afternoon before heading out again. Denny's and Ihop on the way home

I loved this hotel. I was worried at first but when I got there I saw it was all for nothing. Yes the parking is limited but what others have forgotten to tell you is that when there is no more self parking, they will valet your car for no additional charge. What this means it they will take your keys and double park cars until a space for yours opens up. This didn't bother me at all because we were there to go to Disneyland and I had no plans on needed my car until check out. Later that  night after coming back from the park I saw my car parked in a self parking spot and the parking attendant gave me back my keys so I could come and go in I needed. I had a family Suite Room with Bunk Beds and I have to say I love this room!!! We had 2 queen beds and the very nice sized bunk

Stayed here 4 nights with my family, booked the kids suite with bunk beds.  Found the room spacious and clean and the grounds clean as well.  The pool was well maintained and they even provided guest towels.  Did not like the bed, found it uncomfortable and my teens felt the there was a lack of outlets for electronic devices.  Loved the proximity to the Parks and restaurants. Did not care for the breakfast, feel that they should add a waffle maker or some other protein.  The walls were thin and could here both the upstairs and side neighbors, not bad if they actually sleep at a decent time.

We have stayed here many times, it is so conveniently located across the street from the park.  Its great for families with kids, we were able to leave the park just walk across the street to our room and let the kids swim or rest until we go back to the park a few hours later.  The pool area, rooms and property is alway clean.  The price is unbeatable, I have stayed at just about every hotel on Harbor located directly across the street and this is always the best value.  Each time I call they remember me and give a discount for coming back.  We booked our next trip just 2 days after returning home and we will be staying here again in 2 months.

It's a nice and great place to stay right across from the parks the breakfast was Ok ..It's really convenient area restaurant aren't to far the hotel prices aren't to bad and they also charge a $8 fee a day for parking

Summary Heading: very close to disneyland, but pool needs less chlorine.
Summary: I stayed there last year with my niece.  will stay again loved it.  didn't like walking in the drive way from denny's but other than that it was great.  my little niece had a great time.  liked the continental breakfast just enough to fill us until lunch.  didn't like to be charged ahead of time for things I didn't use, I did get my money back on the last day but I didn't account for it ahead of time.  my niece liked the idea I want to bring her little sister next year.  I promise each at 7 they would go to Disneyland with me.  but the pool needs to have less chlorine in it, it was like swimming in the ocean instead a pool and the heat needs to be turned down during the day too warm during the day.

To start I would like to say that we LOVED our trip.  I would give this hotel 3 1/2 stars and say it's good.  We booked through getawaytoday.com.  It was a REALLY good deal.  It was the cheapest hotel by $100 that had decent reviews.    The Pros: -It is right across the street from Disneyland!!  It took us about a 10 minute walk to get to the plaza with 5 kids.  I would look at the people waiting for the shuttles when the park closed and I was so grateful all we had to do was walk across the road.  By the end of the night our party had at least 3 kids sleeping in strollers.  I couldn't even begin to imagine unloading the strollers and folding them up and getting on the shuttles..seemed awful to me.  We also would come back for lunch.  The fridge and a couple coolers were enough

Summary Heading: Del Sol Inn should be renamed Awesomeness Inn because it is terrific!
Summary: Not only is the hotel mere steps away from the Disneyland resort but it is closer than 2 of the Disneyland owned and operated hotels which made it conveinant for sleeping in a little later and not having to walk as far when we were exhausted.  The staff was courteous and helpful and the little elephant towel to welcome us began our magical stay.  The sauna which was pleasantly warm was so inviting at the end of the day and the complimentary breakfast was a money lifesaver so we could spend it in the parks.  Overall without a shadow of a doubt this is our hotel of choice for Disneyland

Checked in around 1:30am, so we expected to not get great service. Not the case! The staff was very friendly and they even came out and helped us unload and park the car. Hotel was very quiet, pool was nice, and room was clean. Only thing they can maybe work on is what they offer for breakfast. Same thing very day kinda got boring. I did bring our own breakfast items so it wasn't too bad.  Overall great time! How can you complain when you are going to the happiest place on earth?!

First off, we booked this hotel cause it was super close to the park entrance and that's really about all it had going for it.  The staff at the front counter was helpful enough at check in and we quickly got our room keys. When we got to our room it was clean and what we'd expected as far as size was concerned, but the beds were really quite uncomfortable and the shower had little water pressure. The room felt like it was really quite old and gnarly and not really deserving of the premium price. I'm sure at this point that it was the proximity to Disney that allowed them to charge the rates they are charging.  Here are the gripes I had with this place though. 1) Breakfast was over a 10 sharp! if you showed up 1 or 2 minutes late they didn't let you in. even though there were

Great location to Disneyland...save money on parking at the parks....Denny's right in front of hotel n it was an option to eat there if you want to save money versus eating at the park....we had a kids room which included 2 queens n a kids bunk bed...the down fall for that room would be less space to move around especially if you have a table and 2 chairs...breakfast wasn't the best but it's free...can't complain....definitely will stay there again but will choose to be upstairs...no noise coming from up above on every step they take...

Very Nice , close to Disney and great people and managers.  Will use again walking distance to main gate . Its nice to be close so you dont walk so far .Not crowded and great sleep . Very close to restrurants and closecaption for the deaf on tv.

Summary Heading: New front desk staff unaccomodating and not very friendly
Summary: I reviewed this hotel in August 2013 with very high marks prior to Del Sol getting new management/front desk personnel when I booked for my March 2014 trip.
