I have stayed here for 12+ years and at least 3 or more times per year. They always gave us special treatment as return guests and special rates that made us come back over and over. Until March 2014 when we arrived to find that the front desk staff had changed. We has asked them to give us the rate I was going to get in December 2013 before my son was in accident and had to change our arrival. They said no, sorry, we can't do that.. Even after they can look at our history and see how many times/years we have visited. I always loved that we felt special and the desk staff recognized us when we called and when we arrived.
Manager Response: We appologize for any inconvenience that it has caused you, please contact me directly to resolve this issue immediately. I'll do anything i can to earn your business back. Thank you I look forward hearing from you.

Summary: As a family of seven with special needs children, we have a hard time finding hotels who will accommodate us.  We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room and the hospitality of the staff.  The location was perfect for our family because we had to take many breaks during the day.  We would definitely stay here again!

"Worst place on Harbor Blvd!!! Our family of 6 went to Disneyland during spring break We stayed here March 23-27. We had rented a motorized cart to take over to the park with, and was told by the hotel we could store it in there lobby area and plug it in because we was on the second floor and they had no elevator to take the cart to our room , so we booked here.  When we arrived parking was limited but found a spot to park. We found out that cart was going to be stored in the back room, we really didn't like the idea of it in the back room but had it stored there anyway, we really didn't have a choice.  On our second day at Disneyland we took the motorized cart to Disneyland we only had it out for around 2 hours and the cart almost died on us. We had to take it back to the hotel

Location is great since it is right across from  Disneyland. We stay here for that reason and because they have a room with bunk beds that is food for our family.  This is the third time I stay in this hotel (we go to Disneyland every two years) It can be noisy on the first floor, second floor is better.  Just take ear plugs!! The snack in the lounge are nice.

You can't beat the location. I was nervous upon arrival because of all the reviews I'd read online about parking situation, but parking was not a problem at. We got a clean room, decent service and the best part was its proximity to the park. It is a basic motel and you don't get any "frills" but it certainly did the job for our party of four adults and one toddler. It is true that you can hear other kids running around and jumping if you are on the first floor, but as a parent (and used to it) it was not a problem for our family. Breakfast is not anything fancy but will get the job done (orange juice, coffee, waffles, toast, hardboiled eggs, mini muffins and donuts). Breakfast room is quite small so we usually had one person from our party go and get it for the family and bring

Under 100 USD with location closed to disney maingate, it's hard to find hotel like this.  Room and facilities are so basic. Once we almost spent time on park, it's very ok.  Noise from 2nd floor ( we stayed in 1st floor) is noisy but actually we acknowledge from other reviews....no surprise.  Denny's is closed to hotel.  We recommend to have linch or dinner.  Pool under maintenance during our stay but not big concerned   Hotel closed to everything  Find bargain disney ticket or tour at tour agent booth at Gardenwalk

When we made our reservation for our family of 6 we asked if they had a place to charge an electric scooter they said yes. When we got to the hotel early they were rude and treated us poorly when we ask if we could check in early.  Our first night there they took the scooter in the back office and promised to plug it in so it would charge. The next day we had it out only a couple hrs before it stopped working due to lack of battery. They failed to plug it in as promised. So we had to go back to the hotel and complain and were told it would be plugged in twenty minutes later it still hadn't been plugged in. We had to walk back down to the office and complain again and ended up plugging it in our selves. Our room was on the second floor so we had to plug it in near the office. The

Summary Heading: Great location! Maximize your time at the parks
Summary: We'd done our homework beforehand so knew not to accept the first room offered which was over the office. We got a 2nd floor room over the carport. We brought ear plugs but didn't find the walls to be thin like other reviews. Yes, there is noise outside your room when people are going to and coming from the parks, but that's what we were there for so it didn't bother us. No one used the pool after hours and at most there were only two families at a time using it. We did use it and the hot tub a few times, nice & clean. We stayed 5 nights during spring break with no problems. Our car was parked in the carport and was blocked one day but we didn't need to move it as we were going to the parks. It did not get dinged. We used the in-room safe, refrigerator, and microwave. We knew in

Summary Heading: Close to attractions, but kind ot dirty.
Summary: My wife, in particular, did not care for this hotel. I enjoyed that it was close to the Disneyland Resort, as in, right across the street, and that we had a room near the front (this is going to be different for everyone, of course). That room, however, was jammed into the back of an ally of the building that was on the less lit side of the spectrum.   My wife thought it was like sleeping in a refrigerator box on the street. I don't think she has particular experience with that, though, so I took it with a grain of salt or something.   The continental breakfast at this location, when I stayed, consisted of donuts, bagels, and coffee. It wasn't anything to write home about, nor any choice of dining that would save me money by not buying breakfast elsewhere once I left the hotel.

My family and I only stayed here because it was our last resort. For starters the room Is basic but the bathroom is just plain ridiculous..it's tiny...the beds are horrible I woke up with bits all over my arms and legs...the pool is smack dab in the middle and you hear everything and everyone..the walls are paper thin. The ac unit always seemed to leak and it took a long time to kick on. The only good thing about this is somewhat the location which is close to the cross walk to the maingate. We will never stay here again. Live and learn!

We stayed there Summer 2010 but thought we should put a review in on the hotel.  Room is rated as average because of price.  This is a no frills hotel.  I will admit when I first arrived at the Del Sol Inn, I was not impressed and thought oh my gosh this is an old run down motel. We stayed there four nights and the place grew on us. For the price it is a true bargain. It is so close and so reasonable. The beds are nothing to brag about and the breakfast hours make it difficult if you plan on making an early morning entry. But what they lack on "upgrades" they make up on service. I asked for a few more pillows on our first night and their response was "how many would you like." We had breakfast in our room one morning (because we were up earlier than the provided breakfast time)

check in was no hassle, my reservation was on file. office personnel was very courtesy and helpful in answering my questions.  Parking attendant was professional, treated my Lexus with care, all in all, my overnight stay was a very good experience, I would recommend this motel to all. Thank you for your outstanding service.  A very satisfied customer
Manager Response: We appreciate you for giving us the opportunity to serve you, we hope to you see you again in near future again.  -Del Sol Inn Management

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the years and it is so nice to be so close to the entrance of Disneyland at such a reasonable price (reasonable at least for a hotel right at the Disneyland entrance). On our last visit Jan 31st we were pleasantly surprised to find a new GM in place and the place looking especially spiffy. Our room was spacious, the refrigerator is large (for a hotel room) and all was very comfortable. We were able to arrange to stay parked there the entire day even though we had officially checked out as we headed into the park. Overall a great value for the price and a convenient location.

The kid's room here is the best ever! The bunkbeds are well made and have night lights built in and are kid-proof. It's nice to have 2 queens AND a bunkbed! Well worth the reasonable cost. The pool and hot tub are nice after walking all day. The breakfast isn't the best, but will get you by.

This hotel is set back behind the Denny's parking lot. But is a very short walk to the main gates of Disneyland and California Adventure. Our room was surprisingly large and fairly comfortable. There was a refrigerator and microwave oven. And also a flat screen TV It two stories with no elevator. They provide a small free breakfast. It consisted of orange juice, two types of cereal: fruit loops, mini muffins, bagels, hard boiled eggs, toaster waffles, coffee, tea. The breakfast was scheduled to start at 7 am., but it usually opened 10 minutes late; this can be critical when you try to get to Disneyland when they first open the gates. The parking is a bit limited, but we could always find a space even in this busiest of seasons. They also have a pool and hot tub, I tried the hot

Stayed for a week in October 2 couples in 2 rooms the place was clean tidy and the staff always ready to help. The location is just the best just walk over the road to the Disney parks . Will stay again next visit.

Stayed for several nights in a row. Very clean and smelled clean which many motels try to achieve through the very unfortunate scent of carpet fresheners. They don't. The room was spacious for a motel and we stayed in it with two adult children (18-22).  Two queen beds. Worked for all. Great fridge, microwave, safe in the closet for valuables, and we always go over EVERYthing with Clorox Wipes and found not a sign of dirt or grime and they're clean on the Bed Bug Registry (which we ALWAYS check!). Good A/C and heater. Couldn't be easier to get to Disneyland.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Parking is tight and we found a spot and never left it because it is at a premium. Only complaint would be the noise.  Paper thin floors/windows. We stayed on the ground floor and every

We love staying here!  It is almost directly across from Disneyland/Disney California Adventure. Exceptionally nice and clean. Big apartment sized fridge for snacks and beverages.  Excellent pillows. This is the first time we tried the pool and we found it chilly but some kids were enjoying it. Housekeeping is way above the bar for a 3 star! Flying in is fine, but parking can be a big issue and the added parking fee does not show on the rates, just be aware of it. Overall, a great place to stay at a reasonable cost. I'd like to give more stars, but if you are looking for 4 star amenities, like fitness or business centers, etc. You will be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Location and staff are great! Walls are very thin!
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights in Jan 2014. Staff are very friendly and accommodating and location is wonderful-very close to pedestrian crosswalk to Disneyland. About a 3-4 minute walk to the park turnstiles. Room and property are very clean and double queen room is quite spacious. Housekeeping was very good. Wifi worked very well in the room. Good size fridge could easily fit a gallon of milk. Microwave is very short, just slightly taller than an average coffee mug. Breakfast room is tiny, but you can take things back to eat on the table and three chairs in your room.  Now for the not so great things: 1. Noise! Our room had an exterior metal stairwell on one side. We could hear every single step that was taken through our wall. On the other side, our room had an interior connecting door

Bathroom is small and parking hard to find when it's crowded.  The rest of the stay was okay.  All employees are helpful and very polite.  Close to Disneyland and plenty of restaurants outside of the park.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel. It is a clean, basic hotel and extremely close ( a few minutes walk) to Disneyland. Free wifi is great no issues at all. The continental breakfast is fine gets you going for the day. The room is big (we had 3 adults staying) , it is clean and bed comfortable. The staff are great , they went out of their way to help us as our luggage was lost/delayed. I look forward to staying here again when in America.

I stayed here with family for a few days in December. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are basic but clean and the bed was comfortable. Free wifi was available and great had no issues with the wifi. Very close to Disneyland and Dennys is in front of the motel which was handy. I would stay here again it was great for going to Disneyland.

I booked a room at Del Sol Inn a day before the 30th of December. It was peak season and I was surprised that they got me a room. Apparently, I was booked on a different date so had I not double checked in the hotel the day before we checked in, we could have ended up sleeping in the street. Del Sol Inn was efficient and kind in correcting the error and gave us a deluxe room with two queen beds. It was a pleasant surprise because the room is large and the the location is perfect if you want to go back and forth to Disney. Restaurants are also abundant within the vicinity (iHop, Denny's, Pizza Express etc). The staff are very helpful too. The in-room microwave oven, refrigerator and safe came in handy. The only downside is that wifi connection was extremely poor in our room.

Summary Heading: Location... yep, that's pretty much it.
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Del Sol Inn during our trip to Disneyland in November 2013. I had read many reviews of this property before we went, and for the most part it was as advertised. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, and the location is great (right across the street from the park entrance) but don't expect much more. There isn't much in the way of sound proofing (stay upstairs to avoid hearing suitcases running along your roof) and the property seems pretty old. I tried to open a window instead of running the loud air conditioner, and it fell into the room! The breakfast is in a pretty small room and I recommend the fruit. There are donuts, but more often than not someone would come in and take most of them all at once to their room. If the Del Sol is much

Hotel was reasonably priced for a family visit.  Room was clean as was the property.  Biggest draw back was no elevator.  Had to haul all the luggage up a flight of stairs and down a long hallway.  Great location for Disneyland entry!  Having a coffee shop right next to the hotel that was open 24 hours was also a plus.  We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here early Dec. we had connecting rooms and each rooms with two queen size beds. Rooms were clean and spacious.  It is behind Denny's so it's easy to find breakfast. It is also near to other food establishment.   It is just about 5-10 min walk to Disneyland main gate.  Receptionist is always helpful answering our questions.

This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland so it was very convenient.  It was clean and newly updated with new wood blinds.  The Kids suite was great. Stayed for under 100.00 and it had a set of bunkbeds  and two queen beds so there was plenty of room for the everyone!  Will definately stay there again!

Enjoyed staying here and having a continental breakfast. It is right across from Disney and that is perfect. Nice spacious rooms and a pool and hot tub if you want one. I was very pleased with this hotel!

Just stayed in October, we've stayed here before many years ago. The staff are all very friendly and accommodating and really take care of the guests and their needs! The price is great for the location and the accommodations were perfect for my family! - Rooms are good sized and super clean! Heater/AC fans work great and aren't very loud.  Showers have great water pressure and you get hot water! Location is super close to the Disneyland entrance! Planning to stay again on our next trip!

Close to DL and great staff. Room was clean, very satisfied, will stay again. The staff was very helpful with our questions and requests. Close to restaurants. Great place for family with kids, loved the bunkbeds

Just stayed in October, I've stayed here a couple of times now and each time has been a great experience! The staff are all very friendly and accommodating and really take care of the guests and their needs! The price is great for the location and the accommodations were perfect for our family!   -  Rooms are very good sized and clean!  -  Heater/AC fans work great and aren't very loud at all!  -  Showers have great water pressure and you get hot water! Hooray!  -  Beds are super firm and not the most comfortable. -  Walls are pretty thin, so if you're a light sleeper I would bring ear plugs! -  Location is super close to the Disneyland entrance!  Planning to stay again in January!

Summary Heading: Of all the Disney Hotels I've stayed at...this one is the best!
Summary: So my fiance and I have stayed at a lot of hotels and motels around the Disneyland property, and this one is probably the one we will be staying at the next time we visit Disneyland. Here's some items to put into consideration.   1.  Location.  Del Sol Inn is located right off Harbor Dr, behind Denny's, and a very short walk to the park.  We've stayed at other hotels where walking to the park and back is anywhere from 15-25 minutes, on top of being in the parks all day.  This place has a great location!  2.  Price.  The closer you are located to the park, the more expensive it gets.  I feel like the Del Sol Inn is the exception to this rule.  They are very close to the park but very accommodating for the the price.  If you are a AAA member, Active Military Member, or a

Summary Heading: Great staff and location but rough beds
Summary: Pros:  location,super friendly and helpful staff,well kept facility,room options  Cons:  no elevator, beds are uncomfortable.   We stayed here because it has a great location and we only needed one room here. Our room had 2 full beds plus bunks.   We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of all of the staff. They truly take care of their guests.    The property sits back off the street, has good signage and is just 2 businesses away from crosswalk to Disney.   One person in our party has a bad back and we were on the second floor with no elevator, but that's my fault as I forgot to mention when I made the reservation.   Full beds are spring mattresses and firm. Not comfortable. Was OK for our 2 nights, but could not have done much more.

We stayed here for 4 nights in October and we booked a double queen room for three of us all adults. The room was huge and clean. I had requested an upstairs room because of reading earlier comments about noise from above in the lower rooms and we were given an upstairs room at the back of the Hotel. It was quiet and we had no issues with noise from the pool area which was just below us. There is no lift in the Hotel but I was prepared for this and knew I would need to carry may cases up the stairs. The provided breakfast was basic but very adequate, waffles, cereal, toast, eggs, juices, tea and coffee. The hotel is a little older than the ones around it and that is obvious when you arrive but we had no issues with cleanliness and I was not looking for 5 star just a good restful

Arrived at hotel at 8am and luckily, room was available!!  Room was roomy and clean.  Requested 2nd floor above parking garage a few days prior and we got it!!  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  Easy 5 minute walk straight to park entrance.  We will definitely stay here for all visits to Disneyland!!

Summary Heading: Good room across from park gates
Summary: The hotel was adequate. it is right across the street from the park gates. Check in was a bit disappointing they led us to believe we could check in early but in the end we could not, the girl who checked us in did not give us any rules, check out times nothing. she was very unhelpful. The room was decent , microwave and refrigerator. Breakfast was small but did the job. The hotel was a good price for right across the street from the parks and was a good deal. we will stay here again.

Our family will be staying for the third time this year at Del Sol.  It is a nice hotel, quiet and comfortable.  The room is always made up early, so that when we come back midday for a rest and swim, it is nice.  It has a nice pool and spa. Staff and management are very nice and responsive.  We've always had a positive experience, as have the other families or friends that stay with us.

It was a great stay for the price.  The only thing I would say is that the family suite with the bunkbeds should be on the main floor not the second floor since there is no elevator after a long day at the park and two strollers having to be carried up the stairs normally with a sleeping kid in in.  The maids could be a little more curtious also by not blocking the stair ways and walk ways with their carts.  They also turned the air conditioner off everytime they serviced the room when we are there in 80+ degree weather.

Summary Heading: Great budget motel!!  Its all about the attitude.
Summary: This is our second stay.  First, I have stayed at just about every hotel directly across the street from Disneyland and although some of them are a little nicer you also pay much much more. You just can‚Äôt beat the location and accommodations for the price.  It is not a five star hotel but if that is what you are expecting to receive for what you are paying then shame on you.  Let‚Äôs start with the Con's.  The beds could be a little softer, but that is a personal preference, some people prefer a firmer bed.  This is a two story motel and they do not have an elevator.  The reservation system can be an issue.  As long as you don‚Äôt make any changes you are fine but for some reason both times we stayed we had to change our check in/out date and both times there was an issue.  The

Summary Heading: Best Bang For Your Buck Near Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I spent Labor Day week in Anaheim for the 2013 Disneyland Half Marathon, staying in 2 different hotels.  The first 2 nights were at the Disney Grand Californian, on special rates from the official race organizer.  The following 4 night, Sunday though Wednesday, we stayed here at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn.  I'll do a separate review for the Grand Californian, but will compare these two properties in this review, and likely not as you would expect.  We booked through Booking.com and got a great rate for a holiday week, 4 nights $375, taxes and fees included.  2 nights at the Grand Californian cost us $816.  We had a standard room on the ground floor (check-in clerk asked our preference).  The room was bigger than the Grand Californian room and had a bigger refrigerator

Who'd stay at a Disney hotel when this is right on the doorstep? I've stayed at many hotels in Anaheim over the years, and this was by far the best. It is literally a five minute walk to Disneyland - and that's from the door of your room to the gates at Main St. It'd couldn't be any closer. It is also close to a range of non-Disney dining options, such as Denny's (thirty seconds walk away) and IHOP etc.  The room itself was spotlessly clean, large very comfortable. The breakfast was very good for a motel - probably one of the best motel breakfast I've had. Good selection and a small seating area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and parking was no problem (Labour Day weekend).  Not only would I recommend this place to anyone going to Disneyland, I don't think I'd stay

We've stayed here several times and have always had a good experience.  The rooms are spacious, clean and affordable. Our family of six especially likes the room with bunk-beds and we all fit comfortably. It's helpful that the vanity/sink is separate from the toilet/tub & shower because if someone is showering others can still continue to get ready. They offer a basic continental breakfast, but the breakfast room is very small so we always grab a few things and eat in our room. Denny's is right in front of the property if you need it.  We've never used the pool, but it looks inviting. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  This is not a property with things like valet parking, a gift shop, a game room, in-room movies, or room service. However, Del Sol Inn is a very comfortable

Seriously can't beat the location & price. Rooms are always clean and spacious.  Everyone at the front desk is extremely professional not to mention super accommodating.  I have stayed at other hotels within the same vicinity , paid more and got much less.  I truly may be doing myself a disservice by bragging about this hidden gem, hoping to have continued availability for my stays üòÉ. I have stayed here twice in the last month and Del Sol never disappoints!

Summary Heading: Great location for families with small children making constant trips back and forth from the park.
Summary: Our stay didnt start off very well.  Our room wasnt ready when it was supposed to be.  We left for a late lunch as instructed and it still wasnt ready when we came back. We had put in a request in March when I booked the room, for a ground floor room since we had my grandmother with us and she has probelms walking up stairs because of her arthritis.  (I understood that those types of requests were depending on availability however, kinda wish the front desk wouldve told us it would be over a 3 hour wait instead of the one hour wait we were told to wait an come back. Thats kinda a big difference that wouldve made me just settle for our upstairs room earlier instead of wasting time waiting.)  They told us to come back in an hour, we actually gave them 2 hours for good measure (2

Summary Heading: A most GRATIFYING stay in every sense of the word!!
Summary: 4/1/2 Stars!!  Staff = Went out of their way to accommodate us! If I was out of something, they brought it immediately without hesitation.. Very Friendly made for a great stay!!  Pool = 10+ we enjoyed swimming..   Rooms = immaculately clean!!

The motel is situated on Harbour Blvd behind Denny's and is a great clean find.  Less than a block to the cross-walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Total walking time to the parks is about 8 minutes.  Great when you want to take a break in the afternoon or tired after a long day at the parks.  No need to rush or wait for a shuttle.  It is a small 2 storey motel with approx 60 rooms.  Our room had two queen beds, round table with two chairs, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker and hairdryer.  They do also offer rooms with bunk beds.  The motel does offer a small assortment of food for breakfast (free with your stay).  Bread for toasting, toaster waffles, corn flakes, fruit loops, hard boiled eggs, oranges, juices and milk.  They also offered pastries, for those who

Have been using Del Sol Inn for past 10 years and alway have enjoyed the stay. The room was very clean when checked. All the staff from management was very pleasant. Vey highly recommended and just across the street from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great experience!! don't believe the negative reviews
Summary: I have been staying at the Anaheim Del sol inn for the past 12 years + I have watched the transformation of this hotel from a total dump to a very nice hotel close to Disneyland. If you are expecting a 5 star hotel, you will not get that. Considering all of the hotels on Harbor Blvd. which are closest to the park are many many years old, you can't expect fancy.  Rather you will get a comfortable place, clean and friendly with super large rooms that have been updated and includes a fridge and microwave. Each time I have come, there is something new in the rooms to make your stay even better. (love the shutters and new shower heads) New A/C units this time. Beds are comfy too!!  The staff is helpful and friendly. TJ (manager)  is wonderful and will assist guest with anything they

Stayed at the Del Sol for 8 nights last week, staff was great, very helpful, large rooms, pool, clean, comfortable and across the street from Disneyland entrance. Plenty of places to eat near the hotel. Will stay there when we come back.

The best thing about this place is the location. Right in front of the main gate entrance, the last thing you want to do after Disney is walk a long way to your hotel. The place was hence very handy for those with small kids. The room was cleaned but toiletries were non existent!  However there were some negatives: the parking spaces were tiny! I was scared our rental car would get scratched. The spaces were sparse too...we were too scared to move our car in case we couldn't find another space!  My biggest gripe was the non-existent Wi-Fi! Seriously unacceptable in this day and age to have days without the router working. No compensation offered either..poor form.  And a resort fee? Seriously? Not sure I would return here, other hotels are equally close and I'll try those next

We stayed here for about a week in August,during our trip to Disneyland,and could not have asked for better for the money we paid.The rooms are clean and well maintained,and the location is perfect-it's literally opposite the street from the main entrance to the Disney resort and there are tons of breakfast and dinner options all around-Ihop,Denny's,Mcdonalds etc.For odds and ends there's a seven eleven store a few blocks down. The beds are comfortable and the staff are very helpful and friendly.  If you are looking for a no-frills attached,clean,budget accommodation close to Disneyland,then Del Sol Inn is the place for you!We would stay at Del Sol if we ever go back to Disneyland!

We stayed at the Del Sol for four nights in August and were very pleased!  The rooms are very comfortable and clean.  We did not use the pool but our rooms were right next to it and it was well maintained and always looked clean with fresh towels.  The office staff was friendly and welcoming.  We have stayed at many of the hotels along Harbor and the Del Sol is one of the best.  The location cannot be beat.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  It's really the perfect place to stay for a Disney weekend!  I've read some of the reviews about the parking fees and resort fees and yes it stinks but they are all doing it so can't really blame this hotel for that.  We are already booking our next visit!!

Summary Heading: nice & close to disneyland park and resteraunts
Summary: love the location..staff is friendly hotel is clean.love itxxxxxxxxxxxxxxoooooooooooooo xxxxxxxxxxxxxxooooooooooooooooooolove the location! this place is great because it has Dennys resteraunt right in front of it....very convieniant and its right across the street from Disneyland Parks! the walk is short and takes no time at all you could go back to your room for a break or swim and go back to the park in no time at all

i booked this hotel thru AAA. when I printed out my confirmation, I read the total and thought nothing of the amount. So that is what I budgeted for. When I went to check in the amount was $140.00 more, they charge 19% tax a 4.99 resort fee, which i was okay with, $9.50 parking fee the stalls are for compact cars, they dont have enough parking so they double park vehicles if you want to leave they have to have the other vehicles moved so you can get out. The continental breakfast was empty every morning we went down, and no staff around to refill items.  The hotel staff was rude, and it just was just not worth the money, it was convent to the park short walk, but st not worth the aggravation.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay, everything I'd hoped for!
Summary: Don't understand the neg reviews.  I spent last night at Del Sol with rave review and service!  As a side note, this was my 57th visit the Dland in the last 4 yrs. I have stayed at numerous hotels (to say the least) and have to say this was THE BEST for location AND value!  I decided to book a room here since we frequent the Denny's at the front.  GREAT cust service from TJ!!!!  Accommodating & clean spacious rooms.  No prob parking, safe & quiet area despite the closeness to the park! Couldn't ask for more.  I can't help but ask why previous commenters didn't verify their reservations or parking since I had NO prob?!?! So pleasant we are planning to stay again soon!!!!!

Arrived later than planned ,reception staff vey helpful and made every effort to assist us.Rooms are good size with fridge and coffee maker although a kettle would have been better. Location superb,a 2 min walk to the disney resort.Pool and hot tub are superb and very clean.Maid service every day with plenty of fresh clean towels daily.Buffet breakfast was very nice.Plenty of nice places to eat very near to the Hotel.

We planned our Southern California trip November 2012, this included our reservations at  Del Sol.  The day before our check in, we were contacted by Vanessa to confirm our 4 night stay and yes, we would be there the next day. TJ, the manager contacted us the day of our check in to let us know he could not accommodate our reservation and would be moving us a mile away. There went the convenience of walking to Disneyland as well as putting a huge damper on our vacation. TJ could only tell us it was a computer glitch and we should be happy he found us a place at all, sometimes families are left without accommodations. Remember, we booked this in November for a vacation in August!  Can't be trusted.

Summary Heading: We love Anaheim Del Sol! #1 in Disneyland Convenience!
Summary: Convenient, charming, and directly across the street from the Disneyland Resort. It couldn't be more convenient.  It is priced very reasonable.  Rooms are large with nice darkening, wide-slat white wood shutters. They have a pool, a spa, soda/snack vendor, free breakfast room, coffee in room, fridge, microwave, and helpful, friendly staff.  We like that Denny's is a 1 minute walk from the rooms. The benches outside of Denny's provide a perfect view of the D.L. fireworks show.   The hotel is a two story which offers parking very close to your room.  We have stayed here annually for 12 years in a row.  Never disappoints.

This was the perfect location for a family Disneyland trip.  No trams needed, just a walk across the street. Room was very clean and came with everything needed to be comfortable for our stay.  Very nice experience.  We will be back!

The location was great. The rate was one of the best I could find. Staff was nice and helpful. The breakfast was basic but was good. Housekeeping was a little slow in getting to our room to clean. Hotel was a little dated. I would stay there again. I would recommend this hotel.

You can walk 5 min and be in Disneyland.  The rooms were comfortable; we had a bunk bed room and a 2 queen room which worked well for our extended family of nine. The fridges were the larger "small" variety and held what we needed them too.  The pool isn't large, but whenever our four kids were in it, they were the only ones using the pool. The pool and hot tub were clean and well kept up. The only reason I'm not giving a 5 star is the breakfast.  The doughnuts were fresh, but the cereal and eggs weren't first rate.  There was fruit available which was enjoyed. The staff was most helpful in every way, allowing us to store our bags for several hours while we went to Downtown Disney since our flight wasn't until late afternoon.

I'd booked this property because of it's convenience to Disney, right across the street. Aside from the location perk, there is no reason to select this inn. My daughter & I had a miserable stay. Upon arrival, the woman checking us in was rude, and I felt she considered checking in us (or anyone else) an inconvenience. Thereafter, it took about a half hour to park. There are not nearly enough parking spaces. Some vehicles were totally blocked in. What spots they have offer little room to open doors, much less to squeeze out baggage. This was of great concern to me, driving a rental SUV, and being wary of dent possibilities. In our room, the temperature unit was not working. When turning it on, the unit gave off a burning smell. We notified the front desk, and headed on to

Loved the location. Second time I've been on this side do the street. They have great family rooms that fit six. The kids will enjoy the bunk bed setup. Room was cleaned up nicely by staff for as much stuff we left daily. The room I, had with a little TLC, could bring it to the next level. I hope they do, would choose Del Sol over the other hotel I stayed at previously. For the price and location......it's a thumbs up

Hotel is good location for visiting Disneyland. Free WiFi helped us to share our joyful time with friends immidiately. Your staff did a great job also. My family really enjoyed staying with you. And we will recommend your hotel to our friends.

Summary Heading: Would stay again in a heartbeat
Summary: Chose this hotel due to value and proximity to Disney front gate(you can't get much closer!). I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and overall comfort of the hotel.  Due to the budget rate, I was expecting to give up a few things, but this was not the case.  Staff was also very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is so close to front gates of the parks that you can break during the day and come back to the room for the pool, lunch, or a rest.  If you do enjoy an afternoon rest, or are an early to bed type, ask for second floor room away from the pool, for obvious reasons.  If you are traveling with rambunctious little ones, ask for a room on the bottom floor and near the pool, also for obvious reasons. So many people on other reviews complain that they wanted to nap at 2

We love the convenience of being close to Disneyland, the price, and the cleanliness.  We plan on staying here again and recommending it to friends and family!  They did not have a fitness room, who needs one when you are walking around Disneyland all day!!!

We stayed at the Del Sol Inn from 05/27/13 thru 06/04/13. The location to the park makes this Hotel great. It is nice and easy to come back to your room and take a rest after a long day at the park. The swimming pool and hot tub were nice and clean and was great after going to the park. The rooms were clean and nice and quiet. The shower had good water pressure and lots of towels. The staff was very friendly and they had free breakfast in the mornings. Coffee, muffins, eggs, waffles and cereal. I will definitely stay at the Del Sol Inn next time I visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Older hotel, great location, very clean, very nice staff.
Summary: I was skeptical about booking thus hotel after reading mixed reviews. We have visited Disneyland 1-2 times a year for the last several years, and have experienced many different quality levels.    We arrived at the hotel around check in time, 4:00 PM. The desk manager was very friendly, the check in and car registration was quick. The chocolate chip cookies we received were a nice surprise.  The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable.  The light between the beds didn't work and it was easier to hear children running down the hallways, than other hotels we've stayed in.  However, we always hear children running outside our doors when we stay in Anaheim.  The only real turn off was the very small breakfast room. I appealing and not very well stocked.   We aren't big

The location of this motel is great it is directly across the street from the happiest place on earth. The rooms were good. We had the bunk bed room and my daughter in law had to sleep on an air mattress because the bunk beds were hard. Parking was bad but if you couldn't find a space they will valet it for you. Another big plus is that they sell disneyland tickets in the lobby so you don't have to buy them at the park. Overall good stay we would stay there again.

Location: As mentioned by previous posters, location was great. If you've never been to Disneyland before, a hotel close to the maingate is a relief after an entire day of walking around. It's not on the main road so if you're staying at the back of the hotel then it's a bit of a walk but it sure beats a lot of other hotels that claim they are within walking distance. It's nice not to have to wait and board busses to get back to our room.  It was close to many restaurant options too.   Rooms: You can hear EVERYTHING through the walls!!! I've stayed in many hotels and this was by far the worst for noise through walls. Also, do not, and I repeat, DO NOT, get a room near the pool! The pool is open until 10pm and that means screaming and yelling right outside your door and there

We have been staying at Del Sol Inn for the past 6 years and always greeted by a valet parking attandant.  I can't say enough about the friendly and courteous staff that go out of their way to make our stay confortable, especially TJ and Lorreta whom are wonderful and gracious people that makes us  want to come back every year, even when we don't go to Disneyland which is just  across the street.

We chose this hotel for the super short walk to Disneyland.  Upon check in we were delighted to find out our room was ready hours before regular check in time and that they had given us an upgrade to a family suite.  Over all we were very happy with all the staff we encountered and the services they provided.  Like other's have mentioned, the breakfast was nothing to get excited about, but complimented nicely with the groceries we had delivered to the hotel from Von's.  I decided the rooms are indeed clean, but dated and really need a fresh coat of paint.  The walls look quite dirty, but I think that's because the beds are so close to the walls that your backside rubs against them when you walk along side them.  The rooms were plenty big and well taken care of, just older.  Oh,

I really enjoyed my stay here. I stood here 8 days 7 nights. I LOVED the location to the park, walking form hotel to Disneyland main gates in about 5-7minutes. I book this hotel because of the location. The price is just right! I had the room with 2 queens and bunk bed which my kids loved. The room was clean and the house keepers I was very impressed with, they really went the extra mile for you. The refrigerator in the room was a good size, not small like I am used to seeing at other hotels nearby. The pool was clean and the landscaping had a very nice topical feel.  I could hear noise from upstairs but I think my kids were louder at times. The only two negatives would be; the beds are not that comfortable and the continental breakfast is very basic. We only ate there once. I

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the money $$$
Summary: The hotel is great for the money.  The staff is very friendly there and helpful.  You can't say enough about them but customer service is great. The rooms are very spacious and linens are clean and changed everyday.  The room was vacuumed but not looked to be done quickly like a once over.   The shower is clean and not moldy.  There is an attendant when you enter to park your car as the lot is small and so are the spaces on the hotel side,  there is covered parking stalls that are a little bigger.  The pool is average although your not there for the pool it is a nice break from the park when the kids are taking their nap.  The laundry room is small for the size of the hotel.  Breakfast at the hotel is edible and well its ceral, toast, muffins, and coffee enough to get you

We always stay here when we go to Disneyland! They are right across the street from Disneyland, they have a fridge, microwave, in the rooms.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The staff is friendly.  We know what to expect.  We did not go to the continental breakfast, but it is available.  We also used the Wi-Fi. Other than the fact that the people above us walked back and forth frequently and like elephants. No complaints.

We generally stay at hotels or motels based on location vs. price.  The Del Sol more than met our expectations.  Our room was clean, the staff (everyone) was very courteous.  We didn't do much there except sleep.  After long days at DL it was great to walk out the gates and steps to our room.  The breakfast wasn't the greatest  but we weren't expecting it to be.  Major carbs with apples and oranges.   Was kinda fun to have toaster waffles for breaky....just like DL made me a kid again.  The price was fine (we booked in January for May) and the location was ideal.  The bed was firm but we like that.  We heard people but what do you expect at a motel, nothing worse than the condo we live in.  We were two "older" adults and this was just fine for our liking.

You're really staying here for the location and it can't be beat, it's ridiculously close to Disneyland probably about a 5 min walk to the gates.  Hotel itself is good nothing spectacular but it does the job, wifi worked great while we were here.  Didn't try the breakfast as Denny's is in front of the hotel and there is an IHOP close by too.

we spent Saturday night at your hotel and sunday at Disneyland.  we totally enjoyed the stay at del sol.  room was great and the staff was awesome, the place is soooo close to Disney that all we had to do was cross the street and we were there.  we will absolutely stay at del sol inn again as well as recommending it to friends and family.

The room was all we needed and super convenient to the Disney Parks. Just across the street. The room was very clean, the pool and hot tub were lovely and very relaxing. The free wifi never worked during our week long stay. We were told they were working on it and that it would be up and running in a few hours. I don't believe they were working on it at all. The clerks were telling everyone that checked in, the same story when asked about wifi hook up. Their continental breakfast was terrible. Tang was passed off as orange juice. There were only 3 tiny tables with two chairs each and it was hot in the room.  This is the place for you if all you want is a clean place to shower and rest your head at the end of a long day. It was a very quiet location too. We would go back.

My family and I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the past few years. We've tried other hotels in the area (Howard Johnson's, Holiday Inn Express), but continue to come back to the Del Sol. The location across from D-Land main entrance is perfect. It's clean, affordable and the staff has always been courteous and helpful. I have recommended it many times to everyone I know who is going to Disneyland. There is some noise from kids running on the walkway upstairs, but considering you're next door to Disneyland, excited kids are par for the course. All-in-all, we've never had a bad experience.

Location is great...right across the street from the Maingate. Great if you have small children!Rooms are large, everything in our room was clean and well maintained. Just note that the beds we had were very firm. And the walls are very thin! You can hear your neighbors in the next room. I wear earplugs at any hotel/motel I stay at so this didn't bother me as much.   Gentleman at the front desk was very nice.  Biggest complaint is for the parents who let their kids run up and down the hallways upstairs! This gets very loud! It would be great it if front desk would put up signs and ask that parents not have their children running around up there!

Summary Heading: Great location, bring noise cancelling headphones
Summary: The best part of this hotel is the location. It cannot be beat & for that reason only I'd stay here again. Was greeted by a younger guy of Asian appearance in reception room wasn't ready but he guaranteed it would be bottom floor as needed, and there was a muck up with check out dates (del sol error) and he said it would be fixed up. I come back and not only did he not get a bottom floor room he didn't bother fixing the error either. Thankfully the new guy that served me did but don't bother tipping the other guy he won't do his job.  Room itself was fine only problem was the noise. A toddler upstairs walking felt like Tyrannosaurus rex up there.   Yes breakfast is average but I'm happy with cereal so I felt it was fine. I didn't like the fact the cleaners left your doors open

Absolutely wonderful location right at Maingate, could not have been better. Rooms are large and clean, everything works and is well maintained. Not luxury but very comfortable and a great place to stay at a very reasonable price.

Summary Heading: Great location at a good price
Summary: We stayed at Del Sol Inn for two nights in early May. We chose this place as it was close to Disneyland Park (just across the road) and well priced. It was excellent value for money. The room was tucked away in the corner on the upper level so was relatively quiet although did not get a lot of natural light. Complimentary breakfast of toast, cornflakes, muffins and donuts, tea & coffee and orange juice was available for those who required it.This was included in the price. We found this an ideal short stop over place that was reasonably priced.The only comment we would make is the bunks in the room were quite short so for a teenager who is 6ft or more they will find it quite small

This is a nice, clean, quite place. the staff was very helpful and friendly. the location is great! both parks are such a short distance. for the price and the location we will be going back to stay again. the rooms were spacious and clean.

Summary Heading: Even for the price, I would never stay here again
Summary: I chose this hotel because it is directly across the street from Disneyland, one of the five or so closest hotels there is to the entry gates, and it was one of the cheapest rooms available.  But it was a hard lesson of you get what you pay for.  I could literally hear my neighbors conversations, and when they came up to their room at around 1am their footsteps echoed under the door.  I was fully awake until I could get tired enough to tune them out again, thank goodness my daughter didn't wake up!  I could hear everything!  The TV, the shower, their laughter, it was AWFUL.  Also, the free continental breakfast was at least a few minutes late every day, the latest being almost 15min.  Not helpful when you're trying to get into Disneyland when it opens.  And finally, when I

Summary Heading: Great Stay Great location Good value and Its CLEAN !!!
Summary: We stayed in Mid March.  3 nights The location couldn‚Äôt be beat as it really is across street from Disney. We had room 211 and 210 for 5 adults and 4 kids ( 4 to 11yrs) Our reception was gracious. The room was very pleasant. Clean fresh. two firm queens extra pillows. Ample towels .  Just a few steps from pool  which kids loved.  Breakfast was fine for a bit of coffee and toast. Cereal for the kids. Denny‚Äôs is in front of Del Sol and IHOP is two driveways down. Staff was best we have encountered staying around Disney.  And the towel elephant was the best.   We really did enjoy our stay and believe we have found our hotel of choice for its value, location and cleanliness.

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Del Sol Inn. I gave this hotel a 5 due to the incredible value for money and location to disneyland (very quick and easy walk). We were able to fit 6 people in one room and have a basic breakfast for $139 per night. With so little spent on accommodation we had money in our pockets for disneyland.  The hotel is basic but it is clean, the beds and shower great. We have children aged 15-5 yrs and we stayed in the park until closing each night. There is a small pool that other guests enjoyed.

This hotel is located perfectly for fast quick access to Disneyland. It really is right across the road. The room was adequate with bunk beds and two queens. The bathroom was tiny but really this place for us was a place to lie down at night and it was great for that. If you spend a lot of time in your room then this might not be the place for you. We didn't eat breakfast here as it was all about getting into the parks for us.   Previously we stayed at a DL hotel but we were never there so decided to go with cheap and cheerful for this trip.

Summary Heading: Basic, basic motel style. Across street from Disney is the only good thing.
Summary: Parking is awful (super tight space & they charge you $8/day to park). The rooms are old & beds are hard, but it was clean. Front desk..basic no-nonsense. Super small eating area in the morning offered cheap donuts/muffins. Cereal/milk for kids & apples/oranges is the only good thing. Coffee is ok, tho styrofoam cups are super small :(   Please, paint the rooms, change the carpets and update the linens! all the (old) window a/c's leaked water on the walkways :(  Only reason we stayed is, they were the only one with vacancy when we called. Next time we'll walk a little further if it means better accomodations.

Summary Heading: Best value--decent rooms right across from main Disney entrance.
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel twice and enjoyed it both times.  We have a 14 year old (who can go from sun up to sun down) and a 7 year old who needs a little rest / pool time in between.  I feel perfectly safe leaving my husband and daughter at the park and walking back for a rest.  It's literally a 5 minute walk.  Another perk is that there is a Denny's in front of the Del Sol, which offers an affordable alternative to eating all your meals at the park.  For variety, there is an IHOP and a buffet (we've never tried that) nearby as well.  Last time we had the "kids room"...2 queen beds and a set if kid bunk beds (our 14 year old would be too tall for the bunk beds at 5'5").  It's really a good value.  We will stay there again for sure.

This motel is perfectly located for a family trip, being right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  The area is busy and lots of services available, but the rooms are set back from the street and so are isolated from all the activity.  The bunk-bed rooms are great for a family, with lots of accommodation plus a small fridge and microwave. Having said that, this is an aging facility, so don't expect modern features like an elevator or efficient plumbing.  It's just a place to sleep. On a recent visit the swimming pool was closed (you're paying a daily fee to use it just the same) and the wifi was very weak, but administration indicates both of these have been corrected. And yes, they do give chocolate chip cookies at check-in!

We are a family of two adults and four children and, if you are a family like mine and don't like your kids sleeping on sofa beds or trundles, then the Del sol is a clear choice for a Disney vacation as they offer a family room with two queen beds and bunks.we just left after 7 days in room 116. The sleeping arrangements worked fine but the room is pretty small, a little tired and the carpets not very clean. The good to start, the location is fantastic. It is literally across the street from Disneyland main gate. There are probably only five hotels which could claim to be closer. When you have a seven year old asleep on your shoulders after watching the world of colour and you just want to get her to bed that closeness is priceless. The pool and spa, although small, are great.

As someone who travels to Disneyland approximately once a month, I have stayed at alot of hotels in the vicinity of the park.  There are some that I will never go back to and while this hotel is not on that list, it is not one that I would jump to return to easily either.  We arrived at around 11am and were fully prepared to not have a room ready but to be able to check in but check in time is 3pm.  The lady that "helped" me made me feel like I had totally disrupted her morning by asking to check in and when I was told that check in time was 3pm and I asked if we could at least park our car there it was another disruption because she had to call the guy to come and give me a sticker.  I wanted to park because there were spots open and I had read that parking was an issue in the

Summary Heading: The Del Sol values their customers.
Summary: Fantastic location, clean rooms, clean pools, great service, continental breakfast. I've been staying here for years and they give me unbeatable deals because they value their customers and want us happy. Last time we checked in they gave us two chocolate chip cookies :)

We stayed here for three nights recently. I will start with the good:  Amazing Disneyland location- it is literally right across the street. Clean- the rooms and property were clean although dated looking Service- The employees were all helpful and very friendly. The Pool- we did not swim but the pool area looked nice and was very clean. We would have swam if the weather was right.  The not so good: Parking- holy anxiety attack!! That parking lot is so tiny that I had anxiety just watching my husband try to park the car. They offer valet parking, but it is more like a valet guy who has to park the cars when the lot is too full.At one point cars were parked in front of other cars, blocking them in (that's the valet service). I feel like if your lot is like that then maybe don't

Although I did not stay at this hotel, the hotel charged me for 2 nights on my credit card for 2 different reservations. If you reserve at this hotel, then cancel, make sure you get the person's name you cancelled with. I HAVE NEVER IN MY LIFE BEEN CHARGED FOR A CANCELLED HOTEL! TWICE!!!That is AWFUL customer service, and I will NEVER stay or recommend this hotel to anyone. Again, reserve at your own risk.

Summary Heading: Great Location + Good Experience = Very Good Rating
Summary: The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland's main entrance, so during peak seasons, the price is pretty high.  We went in September and were able to find a deal online, but the price still wasn't the best.  There are some other hotels/motels nearby that I believe are a better value, but my wife wanted to stay closer to the park, so that's what we did. The room was clean, the AC worked fine, the service was good.  The continental breakfast was corn flakes and pastries--not super, but it was included in the price.  There are quite a few restaurants within walking distance, including a Denny's right in front of the motel.  The room had a mini-fridge and a flat screen TV.  There is a daily fee for parking, which is common for hotels close to Disneyland.  The only real

-This hotel is LITERALLY across the street from disneyland.  -It will save you $15 a day worth of parking fees.  -They give you breakfast (small choice). -Denny's right next to the place. -Room was a pretty good size.  -Beds were comfortable. -Small parking lot. -Awesome heated pool and hot tub. The awkward part was that one of the maids gave her friend access to all of the rooms and multiple things were stolen, including things in our room. The only way we found out was because we asked the cops. We were able to get our item back but only because we talked to the cops. Never heard from the hotel, and we were never even given a discount.  The maid also organized all of our things in the room to hide the fact that things were missing. It was eerie.  Lesson: Lock all your things

Pros: + This hotel literally situated in front of Disneyland. You could go back to hotel for nap if you are too tired. + This hotel is clean. + Denny's Restaurant is just in front of the Hotel, if you are hungry, you can get it fixed in any hour.  Cons: - No tea making facility. If you need hot water, you have to use the coffee machine to boil water. - The room we stay has water drainage problem. It seems like water is taking forever to drain in the wash basin and the bathtub.   If you have a young family, this may the hotel for you as it is just a stone's throw away from disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great value in a perfect location.
Summary: We stayed here for a trade show down the street. It was only a 20 minute walk to the show, which we did not mind, since it was a safe area, and also had many restaurants along the way. Not to mention, Disneyland I'd right across the street.  The rooms were fairly updated and also had fridge, & coffee maker - perfect for the traveller like myself. The room was clean and the staff friendly.  Don't judge this book by the cover (it is tucked away from the street and the outside is not fancy like the other "themed" hotels around Disneyland. But it was quite decent for all of my needs.

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay. Love the new bunked rooms.
Summary: We have been staying here the last 5 years when we go to DL. The rooms are bigger than the Best Western next door and now they have family bunked rooms which sleep 6. Rooms have always been clean. I think most have been remodeled and this time we saw they actually shampoo the carpets every so often. We also love how close it is to Denny's.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February.  You can't beat the location, it was so nice to be able to walk back and forth.  We had 5 people in our room and having the bunkbed room gave us plenty of space and it was great not having to use a roll away bed.  The breakfast gave us a nice snack to last us for a couple of hours so that we didn't have to eat as soon as we got to the park.  I was concerned about the small parking lot but if the parking lot is full then the valet takes care of it for you so that was nice that I didn't have to worry about where to park.  The staff was all really nice and helpful.  The pillows were very nice and fluffy too unlike some hotels that I have stayed in previously.

Summary Heading: Great rooms at a great price
Summary: This has been our third stay at the Del Sol and have been extremely pleased every time.  It's close to the park, the rooms fit my entire family of 5 without feeling cramped, and are very clean.  The staff is pleasant and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable.  We travel to Anaheim at least once a month and the Del Sol will be our hotel of preference from now on.

Summary Heading: Compares awfully well to nearby hotels
Summary: The big thing here is location. It's just perfect. D-land literally across the street, and the hotel is actually set back off Harbor a bit so there aren't any noise issues at all.   The hotel itself is nice. Not luxurious, but definitely not dirty and definitely not a place you'd feel uncomfortable staying at. Most hotels along this stretch of Harbor Blvd. are middle-of-the-road anyway, and I think the Del Sol stacks up very nicely against most of them. The carpets/walls/etc. seem recently redone. All the needed amenities were there. Bathroom is a little spartan, but who really cares? Continental breakfast was included and was...well, it did the job, I guess. Pretty meager - donuts, a few cereals, bread, juice/milk. Not much, but, hey, that's what the Jolly Holiday Bakery is for

Summary Heading: Great place for a good price!
Summary: This is our 4th time staying at Del Sol.  We travel as a very large group and get multiple rooms.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and the kids rooms with the bunk beds are great for a larger family group.  The kids love the pool lights and we are just across the street from Disneyland!  Thanks for making it so great to stay with you Del Sol!  We will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: 4 times and now back for the HoneyMoon!
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel once a year (5-8 day long stays) for the past 4 years. This year my husband and I are going to DisneyLand for our honeymoon. And we have choosen none other then the Del Sol Inn! We have always loved staying here. We dont need anything fancy, having our own space, a hot tub, breakfast(or snack ;D )included, and being so close to D.L is just perfect. I have never had any problems at this hotel, things are always kept clean, the employees have always been helpful. And I look forward to returning in 2 months!!

It's a decent room within walking distance to the park entrance and that's why we rented it.  It served its purpose for this reason.  Nothing special otherwise. It was decently clean. Maintenance wise, it did have some mold on the ceiling in the bathroom, but it wasn't a deal breaker, it wasn't gnarly or anything, just like spots that were beginning. The laundry was only one washer and one dryer, so it wasn't really easy to get a wash going, so set aside time for that and be vigilant.  Breakfast was ok, standard pastries and cereal and juice and milk. Remember to tip your breakfast room lady, she works hard, is forgotten, and appreciates it! ;) besides, what's one or two bucks at this point, right?? **Tip** Stop by Costco, or just the super market, depending on the size of your

This is the second year in a row we've gone to Disneyland and I chose this hotel rather than my last one because according to google maps it was literally right across the street from Disney, and that was correct.  The parking was cheap and it really takes just a couple of minutes to be at the Disneyland front gate. There's also an IHOP, McDonalds, Cold Stone Creamery, and another buffet place all right there on the corner.    The room was huge! We had a full couch, table, two beds, and my daughter still had room to do a cartwheel.  For the price, the cleanliness of the room, the size of the room, and the location, you can't beat Del Sol Inn.  The staff was very helpful and kind too.

Booked a room for the parents here, as we have stayed here before on family trips and is right across from Disneyland.  Loretta was able to grab me a room at the last minute (made reservation on Saturday afternoon, checked in Sunday).  She was friendly, polite, and very helpful, received a great price and was able to retrieve my info from a previous stay.  Per my parents, the room was very clean, and they had an extremely comfortable stay on the 2nd floor, slept all night.  Kiersten checked us out in the morning incredibly fast and was also very friendly.  Still loving the proximity to multiple restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.  Keep up the great customer service guys!

The hotel room was larger than expected, the beds were comfortable, and the location was exceptional!  The staff was very pleasant and efficient.  I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel on our next trip to Disneyland.

Yes, this place is definitely a bargain but you get EXACTLY what you pay for.   Our room wasn't ready upon arrival, which was fine. We ended up waiting a half an hour or so & then we finally went up. They must have REALLY getting our room prepared. Upon entering, there was a musty kind of smell so we propped the door open a little until it got a little better. Our bed sheets were DIRTY!!! All they did was make the bed without replacing anything. We notified front desk & they came to change it a few hours later when we left to explore a little.   We asked for a crib which was also in our room when we got back. Didn't even bother to put my kid in it because it was so damn dirty. I know this because to test it out, I grabbed one of his baby wipes and wiped the top a little. The

Summary Heading: A 5 minute walk to the Disney park gates! Seriously!!
Summary: Wow was I impressed! Many hotels claim to be 'across the street' from Disneyland, but this one really is! From our hotel room we could walk to the Disney gates in 5 minutes!  The room was a little dated, but it was BIG and CLEAN...to me, those things are more important than fancy paint colors on the walls.  My kids loved the towels folded as elephants and sea shells :)  There were only two things I wasn't overly impressed with... the first being that the fan in the bathroom turned on automatically with the bathroom light. I know, not serious, but just kind of annoying.    The second was the free breakfast. The room was tiny, and it felt like a carb overload. For some people this is okay, but I would have loved some eggs!! They offered bread for toast, croissants, muffins,

The Del Sol is a small, quaint motel ‚Äì which is our preference.  We stayed in a room with two queen beds and a bunk bed.  Plenty of room for everyone.  The d√©cor is very nice.  It is located right across the street to the entrance of Disneyland, which makes it very convenient!  It has a small pool and hot tub.  And they do offer a typical breakfast.  The rooms were quiet and the beds comfortable.  They do charge extra for parking and the use of the safe.  But if you add up the costs, it is comparable to the other motels in the area.  Overall, this was a very pleasant place to stay.  We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Disneyland.

We stayed in Dec. 2012 for 3 days.  The price was higher when we checked in than what we reserved for.  We were in the back and it poorly lit.  Walls were extremely thin and we had to listen to a door slamming contest the first night.  The breakfast was not deluxe by any means.  Cheap small rolls, some fresh fruit (a couple of pieces at a time), so so coffee and orange juice.  When they brought out container of rolls it was already picked through by staff.  Tried to dipute the bill but only the manager could deal with it and the manager was never in every time I stopped at the office.  Location was great but there are other hotels and we will stay elsewhere next time.

Summary Heading: The Del Sol Inn is wonderful.
Summary: We had looked around the area for an affordable yet clean hotel during our trips to Disneyland. We tend to stay overnight at least once a month in the area. We had stayed in several of the neighboring hotels and found them to be acceptable. In December of 2102 I booked several rooms at the Del Sol Inn for our family. I was very pleased with the staff during our check in process, who made us feel welcome. They were also very accommodating with our large group. The rooms are large and clean. The parking is good and the pool is very nice. Over all I have returned to the Del Sol Inn twice more and plan to us this as our favorite area hotel. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Summary Heading: Great Price for Service, Comfort, and Convenience
Summary: My friend and I met here this past weekend for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend. When it says it is right across the street, it means it. We had to walk less than a block to the cross walk to the Parks. The Denny's is right there, Coldstone Creamery is next door, and IHOP and a King's Buffett are right at the stoplight to cross the street. If you wanted to walk a bit further, you could get to McDonald's and other eateries. For racers, it is about a 15 min walk from the hotel to the start area of the race, or the Expo. To me, by not staying at a Disney hotel, I saved 100s of dollars a night.   From the day we got there, the service was excellent,  and Loretta was by far the sweetest employee I met, answering questions and helping us whenever we needed it. My friend picked me

Everything was perfect with my room and the services that I received from the staff. I do not remember the name of the receptionist; it was a girl, she was so helpful with my request to pay in cash.  For shore I will stay there in my next trip to Anaheim and I will recommend this Resort.

Summary Heading: It's not a four star resort, so don't expect it. It's close, clean, cheap, and quiet. So it's more than worth it.
Summary: We stayed four nights. We did not use room service during that time. We found that we had plenty of clean towels and we don't like wasting linen services and water. We loved how close the location was to Disneyland and yet is was tucked back far enough off of harbor rd that there were no noise issues. We liked the optional parking, and I did not mind the parking cost because of the exceptionally low rates we got for the room. The free breakfast was great, but a few more healthy options would always be nice. We oddly enough never received a parking pass when we arrived around midnight the first night. luckily i checked with the front desk the next morning and they apologized and had the morning parking attendant take care of it. Overall we had a fantastic trip.

The Del Sol Inn is a basic non frills hotel. I stayed with a friend for a long weekend and it was exactly what we needed. The breakfast was kind of lame, but I expected it to be. It was donuts, dry crossaints, toast and cereal. There was also milk, Coffee and juice available. It was a small room and very crowded. A lot of people appreciate free toast I guess.  We stayed in a two queen room and it was clean. The bathroom was really small, but the sink is outside, so it was fine.   Parking is a bit tight, but still decent conidering we were staying at a busy time (MLK weekend). We arrived late friday afternoon and there was still spots to choose from.  For under $100/night this is a good choice. You are so close to Disneyland and you don't have to deal with waiting for a shuttle!

A group of 5 of us were there the weekend of Jan. 19, 2013 for Marathon weekend.  We had a room with 2 Queen beds and bunk beds, which are all in the same room. (Not a suite).  We were on the lower level, behind the pool area.  The room accommodated the 5 of us pretty well, we even brought an air bed for the space between Queen bed and bunks and fit just fine.  This hotel is the perfect location being across from the Resort entrance!  It was also fine for a place to sleep since we weren't in the room much at all.   The downside was that the walls are quite thin and there was a lot of noise from the neighboring rooms.  We heard talking and yelling and every time an adjoining room shower would turn on.  We also heard the constant walking sounds of the room above us.  These noises

We stayed at the Del Sol for our Christmas Disney vacation and am not sorry we chose this hotel. this was our third time staying at this hotel and this was our best stay yet.  They have redone the rooms and they were very spacious, clean and nice tv's.  The rooms have fridges, microwaves and coffee makers.  The location can't be beat.  There are several places to eat close by and you can't get much closer to the entrance of the park.  Very short walk to get to Disneyland in the mornings.  The thing I was impressed with the most was our maid service.  Those ladies worked so hard every day and our room looked great and was always ready when we came back for an afternoon break from the park.  This year when we stayed here the hotel also offered delicious cookies upon check in and

Summary Heading: Great hotel for price & location!! Across the street from Disneyland :)
Summary: The whole family loved the hotel & the bunkbeds were a huge hit with the kids.. Its right across the street from Disneyland & California Adventure.. We have annual passes & will stay here everytime when spend more than 1 day at the park.. There's a Dennys, IHOP & MCDONALDS close by all open 24 hrs..

Location, Location, Location.   Del Sol has a winning location and a friendly staff.  This is our first choice hotel.   We stay here often and we love it.   The first time we stayed here was in 2001 and we have returned every year since then.  We love how Denny's is right in front of the hotel-eat there or walk it back to the room.  Last time I forgot my creamer, quick evening walk to Denny's for some chocolate milk and we had instant mochas for the morning to go with the hotel breakfast.  We appreciate the breakfast room opens at 7:00am rather than 7:30am to help us get going to Disneyland-which is just steps away...

I would definately stay here again. Breakfast was nothing to get excited about but for the price, location and cleanliness of the room who cares! This is my 7th trip and I have stayed on harbor blvd each time. Can't beat the location and I would pick this hotel over some of its near neighbors next time. If your in it to go to the parks this is the place. If your in it for the amenities pay $300 a night and stay at one of the Disney hotels.

We stayed the week of new year's and had a great time.  The location can't be beat you are next door to IHOP and across the street from the park entrance, extremely close.  For the price, which averaged for us around $120 a night you can't go wrong.  The kids loved the pool it was heated and changed lights at night...very cool according to them.  The room was spacious we got two queens/bunkbed and it was very spacious. My only issue with Del Sol is the breakfast and the space to eat...there really is none if you are travelling during peak season.  So we opted to eat at IHOP.  The beds are very firm, so if you want pillow-top comfort forget it this isn't the place for you.  If you want clean rooms, friendly staff, close to Disney and great rates stay here!

This was our 4th stay at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn in 9 months.  Great staff and location.  Each time we come back, there is an improvement.  This time, our standard 2 queen bed room included a sofa bed.  The room also includes amenities such as a microwave and refrigerator which definitely helps when you are traveling with kids.  The continental breakfast makes it easy to grab a quick breakfast before heading to the Disneyland Resort parks.

I booked this hotel via expedia for a 4 night stay to Disneyland.  I had firstly booked to stay the Park vue Inn but after reading about bed bugs changed to this hotel as just as close to Disney and price similiar.  We had two beds for the three of us and were up stairs. I had read the reviews so knew there was no elevator which is not a major as having travelled around Europe are used to lugging a suitcase up stairs when no elevators in building.  The room looked  like the pictures so wasn't too surprised there. There was a lot of space to move around in for the three of us.  Likde the basin outside the bathroom as it freed up the bathroom for others to shower before setting out for the day.  Was rudely a woken at some un godly hour by some beeping which I thought may have been

Our second stay at this hotel. We had the room with bunk beds which was great for the kids. Pool was too cold for my liking, but we didnt come for the pool. Didn't try the breakfast at all, just ate our food in our room. Location is great, which is why we chose to stay there. Walls are a little thin and noises carry. Didnt like having to pay for parking, and didnt like that they wouldnt allow us to park after noon on our last day, even for an extra fee. Had to drive to disneyland lot and shuttle back. Room was a little pricey for what it was but would consider staying there again.

Stayed 7 nights. Very disappointed with the cleaning service. I am not a" high end" traveler but I do expect my room to be cleaned more than twice for a seven night stay. When we enquired at the desk all we got was an apology. When I asked for more towels I was told the housecleaning staff was on break. When I asked for towels once they returned I was told, "we will see what we can do."
