After the second day of no housekeeping, I called the front desk to ask if our garbage could be changed as it was overflowing, they told me all housekeeping was gone for the day (this was at 4:30pm).  This hotel is also very noisy. We stayed on the second floor and could hear the kids in the pool like they were swimming in our bath tub. As others have stated, every suitcase and housekeeping cart

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We got a good deal through a third party. Room rate was $109 for New Year's Day. Hotel was 2 minute walk from Disney Land and near many food establishments. Rooms were old and relatively clean. Lighting was a bit dim for my taste. Small bathroom, but sink right outside. Had refrigerator and old rusting microwave. Bad news?  If you are on second floor, you are hauling your suitcases up the stairs. No elevator. Also the shades are plantation shutters that let the sun in at the "crack of dawn". Don't forget the occasional roll of a suitcase right by your room, or housekeeping loudly rolling their cart by your room early in the morning. Oh, and for some reason housekeeping knocked on our door at 930AM just to say "sorry"!!? All in all this is a convenience, inexpensive motel

A very clean and comfortable room with every thing we needed to make our stay a great experience. Disneyland is a short walk across the street so the room was convenient for taking rest breaks and eating meals through out the day as needed. As always the staff was very accommodating and ready to help with any special needs. We recommend this hotel to all our friends & family.

It is a place that besides an excellent location facing the Disney parks, is an excellent choice for clean, comfortable and a very nice staff. It does not take more than that to make this place a place to come back in my next vacation.

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money on this place!
Summary: The staff is rude! The beds are uncomfortable and the shower was dirty when we arrived. Parking is ridiculous and the breakfast is a joke. We paid over $140 a night for 4 nights. We will NEVER stay here again. Please consider another place before you book here!

We had a great time at this hotel. The proximity to Disneyland is hard to beat...right across the street! Our room was clean, well organized and spacious. The pool was heated and big enough to play in, but not too big to worry parents with small children. There was also a hot tub/jacuzzi which was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. We will go here again and again!

Summary Heading: Convenient with no expensive extras that we didn't need
Summary: The Del Sol Inn took care of our basic needs and saved us money.  I took myself and my two daughters to Disney as a xmas surprise/vacation for 6 nights.  It was great!  If ur on a budget and are not expecting a big lobby, hot breakfast, elevator, and all the fancies ull like this hotel. It was clean, a lil dingy in bathrooms from wear but clean.  Towels are thin but soak up well.  Beds are comfortable, one was a lil more comfortable than the other.  Liked the shutters.  U can open window slightly on each side.  We purchased breakfast and lunch items from food for less by taking a cab.  The fridge and micro helped me be able to bring extra money home for christmas.  Saved lots of money! One morning as a treat I took my daughters to Mimis Cafe.  Had so much food left over.  The

This place is literally just across the road from the Disneyland entry! Perfect location! The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable (not the best of colours - but who cares?). The breakfast was so so, but fine for a quick bowl of cereal! We'd stay here again :)

We paid around $88 per night, which was less than any other hotel this close to the entrance. You really are less that 5 minutes from the park entrance - perfect for our family with young kids. Pros - free breakfast (donuts, muffins, cereal), nice tv, located near restaurants, microwave, (noisy) fridge, friendly front desk staff. Cons - noisy!!!!! I don't know if it was just the people above us or what, but it was so noisy all night until past 11pm. Stuffy rooms, weird stains on walls, long dark hairs on nearly every towel and sheet, very thin towels and blankets, stains in bathtub, no towel bars near sink or shower. This was our first visit to Disneyland, so maybe all hotels in the area are like this, but I think we'll choose another hotel next time. I'm willing to pay a bit

This was our first time to the US and Anaheim, I did a great deal of research on trip advisor. We were only going to be here for 2 days and most of that time was going to be in the parks. I got a good deal for a kids room for $90. On the Anaheim forum some regulars doubted the positive reviews and made me concerned. To those concerned DON'T be. If you are looking for a place to sleep this is the hotel for you. Its incredibly close to the gates. We walked back and forth for rests and to grab coats. Actually we went into the park with no bags which was great. If you are wanting a full resort this may not be the place for you. This was our experience, ample parking, quick early check in at 8.30am, larger than expected corner room on second floor, super clean, hot strong shower,

This was our 8th trip to Anaheim, and we've stayed at almost every hotel on S. Harbor Blvd.  The Del Sol is as good as any other and an amazing price.  This was the 2nd time staying here, we love the location, being right across from the entrance to DL.  Pool and free breakfast are great as well.

We had a great experience at Del Sol.  TJ , the manager was exceptionally helpful with our reservations. The location was perfect, right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland  We took our grandkids 5 & 7 and it was so nice to be able to just walk back and take a nap in the afternoon.  Our room had the bunk beds for the kids and 2 queen beds. They were very clean and comfortable. Only drawback was the limited parking but  it was a real bargain for our money.

Checked in here last week for two nights.  Booked in advance a two queen bed room for myself, husband, and five year old daughter.  Our normal hotel we stay at in Anaheim was sold out already (close to Thanksgiving) so we went with the Del Sol Inn since it's also equally close to the park.  And that's the best part.  You can walk to the parks in about five minutes even if you just miss the light to cross Harbor Blvd.!  When checking in I was greeted the following way:   "Hi, can I help you?" "Yes, I have a reservation, <<insert name here>>" "Oh, I've been dreading you all night." "Um, ok..." "Yeah, we don't have any more two bed rooms, so I have to give you a king with a roll-away, but don't worry, we won't charge you for the roll-away." "Really? It's only 8pm and I made this

We stayed at this hotel becuase of the price and location next to Disneyland.  If you don't care about your back, by all means, stay here.  They have the absolute worst matresses in the rooms.  After walking all day in the parks for 12+ hours the last thing we needed was rocks for a bed. The room was pretty clean with beds to sleep 6.  But all the matresses, including the bunk beds, were terrible.  Spen the extra money and stay at another hotel on Harbor Blvd.

Summary Heading: Great staff and so close to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed a week for a little less than $90 a night. The room(s) were clean and comfortable. The decor was easy on the eyes and new. The beds were a little firm but comfortable. Slept great! Bathroom was very clean, a little tiny, but functional. There was a hairdryer and large countertops. Microwave small, but clean and worked great. Individual wrapped plastic cups for drinks provided. Large tv with clean remote. A/C was quiet. Shutter window shades, not drapes. Room smelled clean and carpet was clean. The staff was kind and concerned about making our stay relaxing and enjoyable. They answered any questions politely and completely. They were very prompt to address any concerns we had. The evenings were quiet, no startling noises. The complimentary breakfast was great to start our

I've stayed here twice. My first experience here was good. My second experience, this past weekend - makes me not really want to stay here again. Parking is horrific here. There is not enough parking for even one car per room. They valet your car at night and park them in front of other cars. It's just sort of a mess. The staff was not very friendly. She got the job done, but I can't say she was friendly. Our room felt like a shoe box because it was so small (it was a queen room - only 1 bed). The bed was hard as a rock. The bathroom was very tiny and hard to get ready in. We paid $177 to stay here. We went to another hotel (Marriott Anaheim Suites) the next night and got a room for $100 which was a million times better! I didn't mind this hotel the first time I stayed but I

We just had 3 nights at the Del Sol and were all very happy.  The room was clean and large enough for 2 Mum's and 2 tweens.  I'd specifically requested the room with 2 queen beds and a set of bunkbeds so everyone would get their own bed, but the girls couldn't sleep in the bunk beds as they were so small, I've never seen such small single beds actually.  Oh and no corksrews available.  This isn't a huge deal of course, I just walked to the Best Western and they were good enough to help out.  I just think it would be a good idea to have a few in the office for loaning out.  The breakfast was just ok, but not for anyone looking to eat healthy, all carbs and nothing fresh, we didn't even bother,  Having said all that, I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Disneyland - FABULOUS STAY for Gramma & Papa +++++
Summary: RIGHT across the street from Disneyland's main entrance and RIGHT next door to both DENNY'S and IHOP --- are you kidding me??  Absolutely NOT!  We requested 2 adjoining rooms and got them, too - WOW!.  LOTS of space in the room - even with a roll-away!   Very comfy beds and at a reasonable price!  Our proximity to Disneyland and "kid" food, just MADE the trip for us.  The refreshing pool was a wonderful sight at the end of long hot days and can't even TELL you what the spa did for the aging and aching feet!  We will definitely pass the word along to friends and don't hesitate to highly recommend to YOU, either!!

We checked in on Saturday October 27 and checked out Monday October 29. The key things were the bed and bathroom were clean. The continental breakfast existed of cereal, bread, pastries, apples, coffee and juice.  You can not beat that it is across the street. From my motel door to the gate of Disneyland was 10 minutes.   They put us in room 125 which was a corner room, but what they did not tell us was that it was a handicap room. It was fine for two nights; we had a huge bathroom and a moveable shower head maybe because of it.  The reason I am giving it three stars are the following  - cobwebs in the corner of the ceiling  - blue stuff (silly string?) on the ceiling.  - There was no place to hang towels in the vanity area.  - There was no magnifying mirror in the vanity area

Summary Heading: I would stay here again (Location-Amazing), (Rooms - Clean), (Value-Good)
Summary: Stayed here from 11/3-11/7 and I would definitely stay here again. They offered some of the key things in staying at a Disneyland Area Hotel.   1. Location (Directly across the street from Disneyland 2. Clean Rooms 3. Value (Was average price, but good price for the location)  The only kind of negative was paying for parking (which for some reason always bothers me).  What else do you need from a Disneyland Area Hotel?

Summary Heading: Literally across the street from Disneyland! Great value!
Summary: We stayed here for a week in July. There were 5 families and we booked 4 rooms. We all had the rooms with the bunk beds and they were definitely worth it. There's 6 in our family so we actually all got to sleep in one room with everyone in a bed. The hotel was actually better than I thought it would be. The rooms were fine (we only really used them to sleep in), pool was small but adequate for a quick afternoon dip, staff was polite, parking is tight (they valet park your car if the spots are all taken). This is a small 2-story hotel so we didn't hear a lot of noise (we also asked for an upstairs room so we wouldn't hear early risers trampling above our heads). The breakfast area is extremely tiny; all 20 of us more than filled up the room and took all four tables. Hubby said

It's the best place to stay for the location and price.  It is right accross Disneyland and it makes for a quick return for the kids nap time before returning for more fun.  I have stayed here 5 family trips to the Happiest place on earth and I will continue to come back.  I have a 3 kids and they love it here.   You get a quick breakfast and off to have fun.  Then you come back for mid day nap and a dip in the pool.  The staff is very helpful and quick to respond to any problems we may have had.  The parking is the only problem with little space, but they have a great valet that makes parking a minor problem.  Try it you will like it.

We have stayed at Del Sol 3 times. This is a very small motel with a small swimmingpool (fun color lights at night) and a small hot tub in a gated part of the tiny parking lot. The location is what keeps us coming back. We have stayed in 3 different rooms and they all seem to have a little different layout. The rooms in the South side of the building seems to be bigger. Also, there are no elevators so we found it difficult having 3 young kids to be on the upper floor without being able to drive our stroller right into the room. The parking is horrible! If you are lucky enough to get a parking stall under the covered parking, keep your car there! You will get door dings from other cars because there is only about 12 inches between cars... it is really tight! The rooms are clean

Summary Heading: Excellent price, excellent location, excellent customer service
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights in October 2012.  I have to admit, I was a little nervous about booking this hotel because it was so cheap and so close.  The pictures looked great online but we all know that can be deceiving at times. When we walked in the hotel I was quite impressed.  It looked just like the online picture and was very clean and spacious.  The bathrooms looked almost new.  A/C, shower, toilet, tv all worked great.  One thing is that the beds were a little on the firm side.  But hey, we were so tired it didn't really bother us.  The staff was beyond helpful and extremely friendly.  I dealt with 3 different front desk people and they all treated me like I owned the place.  I must add most of the hotels nearby say they are right across the street from Disneyland and they

We stayed for 4 nights and loved our stay there.  The rooms were huge and they kept our 6 rooms together. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  Our grandkids loved swimming in the pool which was close to our rooms.  We loved how small the facility was...I believe they said there are only 59 rooms...which means not a ton of people. Parking was $8 a day, but worth the money being so close to the park.  It was awesome to be able to walk back to the room for a couple of hours and take a nap. Speaking of beds...they were very comfortable for hotel beds!  I would definately recommend the del sol and we will be booking rooms again there soon!!

We stayed at the Del Sol Inn for four nights and were quite pleased with the accommodations.  This motel, booked through Expedia, was good value for the money spent.  The room was spacious and clean, and because it was an upstairs room (with no running children or heavy footsteps above), it was very quiet.  We had requested a ground floor room months earlier, but if you have someone in your party who is prepared to carry bags upstairs, you are probably better off with a first floor room.  We were given a choice of two rooms, and chose (with some good luck) a very quiet room in the small upstairs passage-way that faces the next property, hence we had no neighbours on that side, and a wall and passageway protected us from noise from the nearby units.  (Didn't take note of the room

Stayed for three nights this past week.  Check in was a breeze and the clerk was welcoming.  She gave us a choice of which room we wanted and recommended a corner room on second floor cause it was bigger.  Valet met us and said to park wherever we wanted - very accomodating.  Room was incredibly clean and quite spacious!  We never felt closed in and the shutters kept the room really dark for mid afternoon naps.  We got an annual pass holder rate at $89 a night - cant beat that!  The location is behind Denny's and directly across the street from Disneyland entrance - 5 minute walk.  We didn't try the breakfast as we slept through it but did bring our own so the fridge and micro worked out great. We would definitely stay here again and again!

The location to the Disneyland park cannot be beat and the rooms were roomy and very comfortable.  Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Adjoing rooms allowed grandkids to run between rooms.  Breakfast was OK and reasonable for being complimentary.  The laundry has only one washer and dryer which is not adequate for facility.  However, I found (through the front desk staff) a laundromat near by that worked out great for me.  Had to pay $8.00 per day for parking, however, felt it was reasonable for the area.  The Denny's in the front of the hotel was very convenient also.  We had a great stay with my family and will try to stay there again the next time we visit Disneyland!

This was our third stay at Anaheim Del Sol and each time it is a nice stay.  You are so close to the Disneyland Resort entrance, you can go back to your hotel room for a nice break and not have to worry about a shuttle. The breakfast consists of toast, waffles, danish, cereal, muffins, lemonade, milk, coffee, & fruit (oranges, apples).  Breakfast is served from 7 am-9 am. We were a party of 5 and slept very comfortable in the family suite.  The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful.   Thanks, Armendariz Family From Arizona

Summary Heading: Not good for people who are disbaled
Summary: This is a two story hotel with NO elevator.  So if you are disabled or elderly-request a room on the first floor.  We stayed on the second floor and it was a nightmare getting the kids out of the double stroller at night (all ready asleep) walking up the stairs to the room and then having to come back down to get the stroller.  You are better off bringing your own food and skipping the free continental breakfast.  It had a very limited selection.  No fruit, just mini muffins, bread and cereal.  Plan ahead and use the refrigerator that comes in the room.   This hotel is a little bit miss leading.  Although it is directly across from Disneyland, it sits behind IHOP.  So it‚Äôs not as close as it seems.  But on a good note, the room was very clean and the price was great.  We would

The Del Sol Inn is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance, which is a must for us as we were traveling with small children. Taking the baby back to nap was easy. The rooms were clean, quiet, and newly renovated and the free breakfast was decent. The front desk was quick to assist us with storing our bags after check out so we could return to Disney for a good portion of the day, and they graciously called our cabs for us. Bottom line - great price for clean rooms, great service and the perfect Disneyland location.

Summary Heading: Not the Ritz, but great proximity to the park, and clean.
Summary: This was our second stay at the Del Sol. We got a first floor, handicap-equipped room to accommodate my mother-in-law. We were right by the pool  but it was nice and quiet, and surprisingly we never had any upstairs noise. The beds were comfortable, and the breakfast saved us some money- they even had waffles for my super picky little boy (plus coffee, cereal, fruit, juice, and pastries). If you want an affordable, clean hotel right across the street from the park I would recommend the Del Sol.

Summary Heading: Average motel, great location, decent for the money
Summary: Its hard to knock this place too hard considering it is quite a bit cheaper than Disney and other non-Disney properties. Located behind the Denny's Restaurant, I found the location to be great and a short walk to Disneyland.   I did find the property to be a tad dirty, which included my room and pool. Nothing unbearable, but definitely worth noting. The free breakfast was also terrible, but at around $100 a night, its hard to complain with free.  Also, the doors and walls seem paper thin. We could hear every conversation, TV, door closing, someone walk by, etc. whenever we were in our room. Thankfully we are heavy sleepers and were usually ready to knock out after a full day at the parks.   If you keep in mind that this is not a luxury resort, you'll enjoy your stay.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland with Good Quality
Summary: We have stayed at Del Sol many times. Love the convince to Disneyland. This time we got the Kids room with 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds. Room is clean and spacious. Although it is an older hotel, they have upgraded their rooms. they have flat screen tv's, with microwaves and refrigerators in rooms. Great water pressure in shower/ bath but could upgrade to bigger towels. Breakfast area small, but they have improved menu and $8.00 charge per night for parking is steep. Always referring friends and will continue to stay there when we can.

The location is excellent! Almost right at the crosswalk to Disneyland. We booked early and had a really good rate and weren't expecting too much. The breakfast was included but very minimal. Poor fruit selection. It was adequate for us. Staff was friendly and very helpful.  Nice pool. One washer and dryer. Room was large and clean. I could see how parking could be a problem but we didn't have a car. We stayed six nights and the noise level was quite reasonable through most of it. Lots of excited kids running up and down the exterior hallway, screaming, the last two days. When you're right next to Disneyland you kind of expect lots of excited kids! Overall a good bargain for the money. We would definitely stay here again.

We would definitely stay with you again! The staff was very pleasant and accommodating, the room was surprisingly large, the bunk beds were a nice surprise, it was very clean, the pool was nice and the continental breakfast was very convenient. If I were to say anything on the down side, it would be the Wifi was slow and sometimes unable to connect. Oh and our upstairs neighbours, which was out of your control anyway! They had sextuplets that woke up at 430am and were jumping around like little hellions! But when we advised the front desk, the next morning was way quieter so thank you very much for that too!

We have stayed here several times. Our last visit (9/2012) we had a room with 2 queens and a set of bunkbeds. Our granddaughter loved the bunks. Very kid friendly, as it has stairs to the top instead of a ladder. We reserved 2 rooms but when we arrived they weren't ready yet and the gentleman working the front desk stored our luggage for us. We grabbed a quick bite to eat at Denny's (conviently located right in front of the hotel) and when we returned our rooms were ready. Since we knew the rooms have a microwave and fridge we brought some food from home so we didn't have to eat out the entire 4 days we were there. It as also nice to have a pool to relax in, in the middle of the day. We have stayed in several other area hotels over the years but Del Sol is our favorite and

Excellent location recommend it to families as it is right across the road from Disneyland.  Staff were great.  Also heaps of food joints as well.  This is the place to stay in Anaheim........ :). The only negative was the size of the breaks area very cramped but you can always take food back to your room.

We stayed here for 5 days while going to disneyland. When we checked in the staff was excellent and understanding. There was a really nice gentleman there, I can't recall his name, but when we checked in, he really helped us out so thank you. The room was very clean and had a microwave and refrigerator which was very important to us. The beds were clean and bathrooms clean despite being an older hotel. The bathroom was quite small but it worked. The pool was nice. It is a great location walked across the street to Disneyland and the price was excellent. The breakfast was okay. I had Danish almost every morning. I recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, great customer service, reasonably priced and walk to Disneyland!
Summary: I have stayed at the Del Sol three times in the last year and will be staying again in November. Each time it has been a wonderful stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We always stay in a two queen with bunk bed room. The rooms are always clean and pretty large. We can fit a double stroller, a single stroller, a play pen and our luggage and still have plenty of room to walk around!   The beds are very comfortable. I love the fact the bunk beds have stairs rather then ladders and a built in nightlight for the little ones. The bathrooms are a little small, but the sink is outside the bathroom which makes getting ready easy.   This hotel is set off the street behind Denny's so there is no traffic noise to worry about. We've never had an issue with noise. The walk to the

we were impressed with service, cleanliness and location Thanks to Mayte, Loretta, Bruce, Alfredo and Alfonso, outstanding customer service! Breakfast was good, cereal, fresh fruit, good coffee, juice and milk. Valet parking was very effective

This is a standard motel with the typical budget-type amenities, i.e., fridge, microwave, hair dryer, crappy little bottles of shampoo-plus-conditioner in one, free continental breakfast, and so forth, but it really stands out because the mattress was SO GOOD. The mattress here was as good as the mattresses I've had at four star hotels that cost four times as much money. The room was very clean. I could safely walk around in my socks and the bottom of my socks didn't get brown and dirty. The service was very friendly. When we arrived, the hotel staff had folded the bathroom towels into an adorable elephant sculpture that the kids adored. The kids also loved the pool. We also made use of the on-site coin laundry. I would definitely stay here again. Minor drawbacks: parking lot

Love staying at Anaheim Del Sol.  Staff very friendly and accommodating.  Nice clean and spacious rooms.  Great to take a dip in the pool to cool off after a long day at Disneyland.  Yes, the parking lot gets full but they have personal valet parking attendant.  We stay at this Inn about 4 times a year. Best location!

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious room close to Disney
Summary: We just got back from a 7 night stay here and we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and spacious and the location was great. The shower head was low and the parking lot did get full, but you can use valet when there are no spots to be found. The continental breakfast was basic, only wished it opened before 7am as early entry also began at 7am at disneyland the week we went. We loved having a pool that was deeper than 5 ft and we loved the HOT tub. Some hot tubs feel like a warm bath but this hot tub was nice and very hot.  I did not like that you can't leave your car past noon on the day you check out. Our return flight was not til 5pm and we had to move it to downtown disney. i wished they would have let us pay for another day's parking rather than returning to the hotel to

We recently went to Disneyland CA and stayed at this hotel which is right across from Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very spacious.  We have stayed in many hotels near Disneyland and we would rate this one as the best!!  The beds were very comfortable and we were all able to get a good nights sleep.  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  Would stay here again!

We stay at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn about 3 weeks/year for the last 5 years.  You cannot beat the location and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The Operations Manager, TJ, is the BEST!!  The rooms are large and with kids, the fridge and microwave are a huge plus.  The continental breakfast makes it easy to grab breakfast before heading to the Disneyland parks.  We recommend this place to family and friends.

Recently returned from a 5 day stay.  The room was clean, nice and big & beds were comfortable. Loved having a fridge and microwave handy. The staff were very helpful and efficient. Our bathroom light burned out and maintenance came in a timely manner.  Staff recommended a superb pizza delivery restaurant and it was delicious.  The kids loved the pool too.  Our favourite was being SO close to the Main Entrance, literally a 5 minute walk...no fuss waiting for shuttles, etc.  Thanks so much!!  We'll be back as we didn't get everthing done at Disney.  Had a fabulous time!!!

Right across the street from the crosswalk to Disneyland behind Denny's on S Harbor Blvd. Fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, continental breakfast and a pool make it just right. I stayed in the kid's suite with 2 queens and a bunkbed. That was GREAT for getting a good, needed night's sleep. I took a shuttle from the airport and didn't have to deal with the limited parking. The staff was VERY nice and the rooms clean and comfy.

The breakfast they offer is very basic and comes prepackaged from a club store. Very small variety and can become boring if you're depending on it. Parking is tight, but if you come in late, they'll valet so they can move your car to get others in & out. Great location across from Disney.

I normally stay at the Fairfield Inn on S. Harbor but decided to try something new.   I was a little leary do to some of the reviews but figured all you do is sleep there so I gave it a shot.   Glad I did.  I booked through Get Away Today and received a great rate for the Del Sol.  Loved the location.   The staff was very nice, I also did not have a problem with the parking as many others have.  My only complaint would be the bathroom size.   I thought the shower head should be on the same side as the toilet, not opposite.  So, you need to turn on the shower while you are in it.   So, If that is all I can complain about than this is a great little motel.

Summary Heading: Great location and value for Disneyland
Summary: Just finished our second stay at Del Sol Inn, and it was just as great as our first visit.  The staff is wonderful and accommodating.  The location is PERFECT for Disneyland.  Never have to drive anywhere.  We just brought all of our food and drinks; they have a fridge, microwave, decent room space, comfy beds, very clean.  Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: the best hotel to stay in Disney Land.
Summary: The hotel is just right across the parks, perfect for people to spend more time in the park, the room is very clean & comfortable, the staffs are helpful. There is a 24-hour Denny's restaurant right beside the hotel, which can feed your hungry tummy anytime.

I have to say it was an excellent location, however the overall cleanliness was questionable.  I would not walk on the carpets or the bathroom floor barefoot.  The breakfast area was tiny and did not offer a lot of choices and the parking was horrible.  If you don't plan on leaving until the end of your stay...you are fine.  Other than that...the convenience of the location and the price was great.

Our family of 5 stayed very comfortably (3 adults and 2 children) in a double queen + bunk bed room.  Since Disneyland was our main reason for staying @ Del Sol Inn, it was a block away from one of the Disneyland entrances.  Room features mini-fridge which helped since we packed lunches for ourselves to Disneyland.  Also plenty of restaurants within walking distance for other eating options.  The parking lot couldn't accomodate all the vehicles, but the staff/valet made it work for us.  We didn't have any issues with parking for our stay but saw some guests who needed help with parking in tight spaces.  I would recommend Anaheim Del Sol Inn.

Summary Heading: Great budget friendly place close to Disneyland Resort!
Summary: Our family of five (two adults and three teenagers) stayed at the Del Sol Inn from July 15th through 22nd and had a great experience overall. We stayed in a standard double queen room, which was a little cramped for the five of us, but very manageable. We spent almost all of our time at Disneyland so we basically needed little more than a place to lay our heads and a shower. The Del Sol met our needs for these essentials and also had a few bonuses. Back to the room size: we  did bring along a twin sized air mattress for one of the kids to sleep on and had little room to walk around while it was in use but this was not really a big deal. The worst aspect of the room was the bathroom (the word water closet comes to mind) as the room was hardly bigger than a small closet. We almost

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay during Disneyland Vacations!!
Summary: I love the Del Sol Inn!!  have stayed here 7 or 8 times in the last 3 years & have no complaints!! The best thing I like about it is the location. It is closer to the Disneyland Resort than the Disneyland Hotel. And the rates are 1000 X's better than the Disneyland Hotel.  I feel safe & comfortable staying here. The rooms are clean & not stinky smelling like so many hotels. The staff is very friendly & the room prices can not be beat!!!

Summary Heading: AWESOME place to stay while visiting Disney Resort
Summary: The location is in the perfect place! What I like the most besides the friendly staff, clean rooms/facility is the hotel is tucked away from the busy street. Your car is parked practically right outside your room or within eye's view from your room, which gives any car owner piece of mind while you're at Disney all day. The pool and hot tub are maintained with fresh clean towels set aside in the pool area. Not only are you incredibly close to the main gate to Disney park, you are very close to a lot of great places to dine-in, all within in a very short walking distance. With very reasonable room prices you get a fridge, microwave, coffee maker & free breakfast! We were very pleased to have one room for our family of five. The room was very spacious which included 2 queen beds &

We stay here several times a year when visiting Disneyland Park. Its one of the best hotels to stay at being right across the street from the parks entrance. This makes it easy to go back and forth as you need to for resting ect......... The rooms are always clean and have all the conveniences you need for a comfortable stay.  The beds are great. They have a wonderful and helpful staff. I highly recommend this hotel to all

I absolutely love this hotel for all the reasons why you should love a hotel. I love the location because it is literally right across the street from Disneyland. Beds are great, it's always clean, the showers work wonderfully, there's a microwave, fridge, a coffee maker, free breakfast, and they're reasonably priced!!!! I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!!
The hotel was clean and the rooms were nice. The location was perfect right at the maingate to Disneyland. We recommend this for anyone going to Disneyland as an affordable option for your vacation.

Summary Heading: Excellent proximity to Disney parks, thin walls
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 7 days in July 2012.  The rooms were well updated and very clean.  The hotel staff was courteous, although sometimes it was a chore to find the valet for your car.  You should be aware that there is an $8.00 per day charge to park your car whether you valet or not.  My chief complaint was the noise from the room above.  Do your best to get an upstairs room and enjoy your 30 second walk to the parks.  I would definitely stay here again.  I booked at about 125 a night 45 days in advance.

This was our second stay at the Del Sol Inn. Just as the first time, check in was fast and easy, our room was clean and exactly what we expected, and it was overall a great experience. We stayed in the "Kid's Room", which has 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds, and our kids LOVED it. It's right across the street from the Disneyland main gate, which is really nice after a long day. We didn't partake of the complimentary breakfast, so I can't comment on that, but the only SMALL complaint I would have is that the parking is a little tight and there isn't an elevator. But it's not anything that would deter us from staying here again, as we would definitely stay here again!

I have stayed at this hotel for more than 2 years and I absolute love it. It's located right across the street from Disneyland. No fuss getting to the park and coming back from a long day. The rooms are huge and the beds are comfortable. The staff is so friendly and will go out of there way to help you! The pool and spa are a must after a long day in the park, they offer pool towels as well. I love this hotel. I would recommend the Anaheim Del Sol Inn to anyone who asks!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Nice staff, & Good Price
Summary: I went to Disneyland with my friend and her daughter (my GodDaughter) for their very first visit to Disneyland & stayed 4 nights in June 2012 at the Del Sol Inn. Upon arrival, we ended up getting there about an hour early but there was no problem with an early check in. The guy at the desk attended to us immediately and was very friendly. When I checked in to my surprise we were given a kids room which was really nice. It had 2 queen beds and a bunk bed that had actual stairs built into the bed & not a ladder which my GodDaughter loved running up and down. The room was very spacious. It had a fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer, and it was nice to have a sink that was outside the bathroom. It reminded me of a mini suite. Much better than I expected. It was very clean. We always had

This hotel is located off of Harbor Blvd. directly behind Denny's. At first, we thought it was an odd location...but it turns out that it is a hidden oasis!  When we arrived, we were treated extremely well, and check-in was a breeze. We stayed on the second floor, no elevator, however, there is a landing in between to break up the carrying luggage up the stairs part. Our room was very nice, and we were greeted with an adorable towel elephant on the countertop! Room was very clean, and I really liked the 'skylight' in the bathroom. :) The beds were so very comfortable, and really liked the shutters on the windows...much nicer than curtains in most hotels. The room had a small round table, and a microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot, and a safe you could use (add'l. charge).  In the

My family and I stayed at this hotel in June and we will definitely be going back. The location was great. They are directly across from the walk in entrance to Disneyland. The staff was extremely helpful and nice, the person who helped us the most was Bryan. The room was clean. We always had enough towels. We did not try the breakfast they offered so I cannot comment on that part. Everything else was wonderful.

Summary Heading: Average older property with great customer service and an excellent location!
Summary: Average older property with great customer service and an excellent location with that being said it was just ok! It's an older property that needs lot's of updating. The beds are hard but clean and the rooms are clean but could be cleaner. Totally appreciated the crib for my baby and the promptness of the staff. Paper thin walls! It can get quite loud with the traffic of guests trying to get to Disney in the mornings. However the location is fantastic, the pool is great and they have upgraded TV's. It will do the job since your only sleeping and showering and heading out to Disneyland for the day. We would stay there again for the location and the pool. It was EASY walking distance for our little ones!

We stayed at this hotel for three nights and overall, we were really pleased.  The room was really spacious, the beds were really comfortable, and the pool and hot tub were nice.  The continental breakfast was fine--danishes, toast, apples/oranges, cereal, juice, etc.  Parking was pretty tight, but we did get a spot and never drove while we were there, so it was fine.  The location was the best part of the hotel though.  With two small kids (3 and 6) we were skeptical about what "within walking distance" truly meant, but it literally is right near the crosswalk to get into the park.  Probably a 10 minute walk into the gates.  We were really impressed and it made the trip amazingly simple to navigate.  We were able to go back to the hotel to get dinner and rest up before going

Only pro is that it's close to parks but then again so are half dozen other motels. Parking spaces are really tight (if you're lucky to get one). Had to park the red zone when we went out and came back one night. Shower heads were build by Oompa Lumpas. I'm not that tall (5'10) and my chin was above the sprout. Also, tub drain was really really slow and got to 4'' above my feet. Don't like that feeling at all. Overall, wouldn't stay here again.

We just finished 4 nights at the Del Sol with 3 of us in one room.  Overall, we were very pleased and pleasantly surprised with this little gem.  We got 2 queen beds in the room, which is unusual (normally most rooms have two doubles) and there was plenty of space for 3 suitcases and bags.  The room had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker, which were all nice touches and really handy.  The location cannot be beat - across the street from Disneyland and actually a much shorter walk than we had staying at one of the resort hotels last year.  That alone was worth it, not to mention that we saved over $100 per night compared to what the resort hotels quoted me for the same nights!  Book directly at their web site - they had a special where if you stayed more than 3 nights

The location of this hotel is one of the best for not being a Disney hotel with a reasonable price. Front desk was friendly and helpful with the exception of the night clerk. Rooms were a decent size, while beds were comfortable. Fridge and microwave were handy. Noise was not really an issue here but parking was a little challenging. Free wi-fi worked only some of the time.

Summary Heading: Great location, easy on the budget
Summary: When we are traveling to Disney with friends and family, we alway stay at the Anaheim Del Sol.  It is an older hotel that is clean, has a great pool and jacuzzi for those nights when your back and feet can't go any further and a basic continental breakfast.  If you are not looking for pizazz and want to save some money to spend in the park, this is definetly the place for you.  It is located directly across the street from Disneyland's main entrance. The staff is very attentive to your needs and does their best to accomodate whatever you need.  They have family rooms that sleep up to 6 with 2 queen beds and a bunk bed.

Summary Heading: Price Below Average, Service Above Average!
Summary: We were very pleased with our stay and look forward to returning for the following reasons: 1.	Location, location, location! 2.	You were the only hotel across the street from Disneyland that would accommodate our entire family of 7 in the same room. 3.	Your prices were very reasonable. 4.	Breakfast provided by the hotel was a must for us in our selection.     5.	We really liked the improvements that we noticed during our stay.  The d√©cor and seating in the dining area made a dramatic difference.   6.	Staff were all very friendly 7.	Room was well kept each day 8.	Pool and Spa area were very clean and comfortable We have already recommended you to everyone that we have talked to about our vacation.  We are not one of those families that has a lot of money to spend on vacations, so

I stayed here for four nights while we were visiting disneyland.  First i will start with the positives  This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland. You couldn't ask for a better location if you are visiting mickey mouse and the gang. Beds were comfortable. Front desk people were friendly and fixed problems quickly. Rooms are reasonably priced. Now for the negatives. We saw a cockroach in our room which is never good because if you see one there must be lots more that you aren't seeing (we reported this to the front desk and the next day they sent an exterminator). The breakfast is terrible!!!! They have cherrios, corn flakes (NOT EVEN FROSTED), toast, tiny muffins (the lady who oversees breakfast tells you not to take more than one so there is enough for

Stayed for 5 nights in a room with a bunk. Heres my take: Positives: close to DL, room size was comfortable for 2 queens and bunk with our family of 5, nice TV, grounds appeared clean except for the laundry area. Room always cleaned well. Microwave and large enough fridge to stock up on food for the week, not just a tiny fridge one of the bigger compact ones. Negatives: breakfast was the worst I have had in the area (didn't expect much but was still disappointed).Parking was horrible. "Valet" is not what it should be called, felt like I had to tip when calling it valet was really just a space problem with the hotel. Tips+parking fees is why I won't return to this hotel, didn't like to go to front to get my keys every time I wanted to go somewhere. Laundy room only had one washer
The staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms were great and very clean!

Good location, but that's about it. The hotel had an extremely small parking lot, and Valet was pretty much the only option for parking. I paid $8 per day plus tip each time I had to take my car, or have it parked. Valet ended up LOSING the only key we had to our car. We waited 45 min while they 'looked' for the key. I ended up finding the key at the front desk with another employee, all the while I was late for a meeting. After, I hardly recieved an apology from the staff for the whole situation. Room was tiny and very cramped- I would hardly call that a six person room. Breakfast was an apple or corn flakes, no other options, we Ended up going to Denny's everyday. You would be better off paying a little more for a room that included parking, and an actual breakfast.
great rooms and location to disneyland loved our stay

Our family stayed at this hotel for 7 days and thought this will become one of our favorite place to book for Disneyland trips.  The room we had was very spacious for our family of 4, and we took advantage of the nice swimming pool and jacuzzi during our down time.  Walking to and from Disney was a breeze, and the daily complimentary breakfast helped to get our day started.  Another added convenience was having Denny's right in front of our hotel to dine at, instead of the pricey food at D-land.  Everything was very convenient, even had McDonald's further down on the same block.  Lastly, TJ, the operations manager, was so kind & helpful as we checked out.  Glad I got to meet him.  He allowed us an extra hour to check out, as packing our luggages with 2 young ones took time.  TJ

This hotel i perfectly locactedfor Disneyland addicted people.  After the spending numerous hours in parks, a  hotel guest saves money due to staying ( mainly sleeping) in this hotel. It is wonderful hotel for budget  tourist.  In previous years I had a chance to stay in Grand Californian Hotel/  It is great hotel too. However I prefer to stay In DEl Sol Inn, because I need  hotel just to stay overnight and spnd all day tiome in parks. Why should I pay more? I vote for Del Sol Inn and will come to this hotel again and recommend my friends to stay at this place.

Summary Heading: not my favorite place along Harbor Blvd
Summary: The parking is super tight, you can't park early, there's was numerous charges added to our bill from the price I was quoted. We had to park our Yukon against a wall and everyone exit through one side...not so bad for the kids, not so great for me! The rooms are outdated. There was a highschool band/team in the building at the same time as us so the pool and any common areas were overran. It is right across the street, but so are a few others. I would stay again if it were a last resort, but it wouldn't be my top pick on Harbor.

Excellent hotel for Disneyland visit. Great price,very comfortable,very secure,and excellent cleaning service.We stay here when we visit Disneyland because you only cross street and walk straight to ticket booths.Plus great food places surround hotel. Also very helpful staff makes this our choice hotel for Disneyland visit.

Haven't stayed here in a few years, even then it was good, and this experience was great!  Last minute booking about a week before Memorial Day weekend, decent pricing.  Jesus at the front desk was very pleasant and accommodating, provided me with all the info necessary.  At the time they only had 1 night available, but upon checking in, he was able to provide me with a second night (due to a cancellation).  I had to move rooms, but it definitely beat having to worry about changing hotels!  Clean , fairly quiet, comfortable accommodations.  Awesome walking distance to the Disney parks and several restaurants nearby.  Parking can be a pain, but they will park your car for you (there's a fee for parking).  Moving your car is not suggested after you arrived, and if you do, don't

I chose this hotel because they were very close to Disneyland Park. I have stayed many times at other hotels in the area, this one is my favorite now. The rooms were very nice(Flat screen television, comfortable bed, nice pillows, clean rooms, Nice pool and Hot Tub, Good Breakfast). If there was a downside it would be the parking fees. All in all a great hotel close to Disneyland. I stayed here in May 2012.

Summary Heading: A perfect room for our peculiar combination of family members; a dad, a mom, an uncle and a child of nine.
Summary: Stayed here in mid may 2012.  We had the room with the bunk bed, which was perfect for me, my brother and his wife and their nine year old daughter.  We stayed four nights, and the price was very reasonable.  We didnt have a car so we didn't have to worry about parking.  The DL Park is right across the street, no more that a ten minute walk depending on foot and motor traffic.  All you need to do is stroll across one crosswalk and you're nearly there.  I arrived early and was able to check in when the room was available, which was 12:30pm.  I only had to kill an hour or so, which was easy to do with downtown Disney so close. Check in was a breeze and I was even surprised with a bag of cookies and a coupon for the rain forest cafe, which paid for a free child's meal. Thanks TJ.

I chose this hotel only so we can accommodate 2 more adults.  The door locks were broken.  Each time we left the room, we had to arrange for a employee to open the door for us.  Room was smelly (mould like smell).  The room was small.  The jacuzzi was terrible foamy like someone would put a bottle of shampoo there.   The location was very good.  Just minutes to the Disney park.  Breakfast poor and locked up right at 9 am so no sleeping in.  Next time I'll go for 2 rooms in other hotel.

We stayed here for a week and didn't have one complaint.  Our room was always clean and the pool area was great too. Our room also had bunk beds and that was just perfect. It was quiet and VERY close to Disneyland. The Del Sol will be the only hotel we will stay at for now on!!!

Very close to Disneyland. This is my go to place now. Rooms are clean and affordable. Parking can be a bit of a pain, but the staff is there to help. They are very friendly and helpful and the complementary chocolate chip cookies are delicious!

My mom booked the room and the guy said we could park 2 cars since we were coming up at different times I show up and have a spot then 4 hours later my mom shows up and he says sorry only one car per room after a lot of going back and forth I finally tell him fine I will follow her to find a spot in an open parking area then he tells me I may not have a spot when I get back I argued that I was suppose to have 1 spot for my room I'm renting he says sorry I can't hold any spots.. besides the horrible parking the rooms are small and dirty and have a strange smell to them you pretty much have to step in the bathtub just to be able to shut the bathroom door..I would never stay at this place again even if it was free..

Summary Heading: great value and so close to disney
Summary: we've stayed here twice already...first time was 2006 and the latest was last july of 2011...we really enjoyed our stay here.   it has a great location, its practically just across disneyland!  of course we also love the room rates, it's so perfect for our budget. [so we can afford our 3 day hopper tickets.. ;) ]  it comes with free continental breakfast...if you're not satisfied w/ it, you can always go to Denny's which is just in front of del sol... btw, they also have nice clean rooms...we'll always consider del sol for sure...

My family and I have been staying at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn 2-3 times a year for many years.  The location is great and the staff is friendly and helpful.  It is always a pleasure to interact with the operations manager, TJ.  He is helpful, courteous, and has a great sense of humor.

Very close proxmity to Disneyland, literally like a 5 minute walk. The option of having a kids suite was great.  My kids loved the bunkbeds!  We liked the refrigerator and microwave in the rooms as well.  We ate at the continental breakfast only once (spent so much time in the parks) but it was nicely stocked.  The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.  The only minor downside was the parking spots are tight.  We will stay here again!

We have stayed at several of the local motels and found the Del Sol to be of best comfort and value. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and staff was very helpful. We took the Disney express bus from LAX. If you have your own car, parking can be hard to come by. Del Sol is very close to main entrance and made for a great trip. We will continue to use Del Sol from here on out as their location and price were great. Rooms were clean and we enjoyed our stay there.
I have been staying at the  Del Sol 2 or 3 times a year for the last 15 years.  The ONLY thing I have a problem with is the parking fee.  But I will stay again and again and again.  Thanks

I would like to say that I have chosen to stay at Anaheim Del Sol Inn repeatedly due to their excellent location, price, and most of all, customer service.  They are unfailingly helpful and cheerful.  I never feel dismissed, or a bother.  I always recommend them to others, and will continue to do so, as long as it doesn't interfere with my ability to book with them!! :)
Our four night stay at the Del Sol met or surpassed all of our expectations--comfortable beds, nice pool, good breakfast, and great location.  Will stay here again.

The hotel room was big enough, and the beds were comfortable. There were zero issues with noise except hearing the pipes from someone taking a shower. The shutters were awesome as it allowed my family to sleep without being disturbed by the light. I had to ask for pool towels, but the workers were excellent at customer service.  The pool was cold the first day, but after that it was warm enough to swim in. The jacuzzi was perfect after being in Disneyland all day. The continental breakfast was awesome, but eggs would be appreciated for the protein.

So we have been to Anaheim seven times and always stay across the street from Disneyland. My mom always tries to get us into Del Sol and its always been booked. We planned a trip for Christmas and were able to get into the del sol. Finally.  Everything was good, decent continental breakfast, ( except breakfast room was a bit small and crowded) good room, 2 beds and a bunk bed, nothing fabcy but met our expecations. Apparently hot tub was cold, i never went in and pool area looked a little older but nothing to complain about. There isnt much parking but we got a spot.   GREAT location though! Right across street from The Land.  So everything was fine until last day.  We got back to our hotel after our fifth day of the  parks and la and were beat. We were leaving the next day so

Well lets start off with the good. We arrived late after midnight, I called the hotel in advance to make sure it was not a problem and they it was fine. We get to the hotel and they checked us in and we were on the first floor and actually got a parking spot ( which is a premium at this property!) The room was nice clean and spacious. The room had a connecting door where the luggage rack was placed. The room also had a refrigerator and a microwave.   Now the not so good... The noise!! You could hear every little noise outside, in the room next to you and above you. As we were on the first floor I knew we would have some noise above( footsteps and the occasional children running) but we heard every word that was spoken in the room next to us through the connecting door and every

The best thing to say about the Del Sol Inn is that the location is amazing. When we park at the Mickey and Friends lot we often walk to and from the park instead of taking the tram. This way we avoid taking kids out of strollers. The Del Sol is actually a shorter walk to the park than the Mickey and Friends parking lot. We loved that at the end of a long day in the park we only had a quick walk to get back to our hotel.  Other good things to say about the hotel, the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, and they do have a pool and hot tub if you fancy a soak after walking all over the Disneyland Resort.  Keep in mind, we booked this hotel knowing what to expect. It is a two star hotel, so the hotel isn't going to be fancy. The parking situation is likely the biggest

I don't know about other Disneyland lovers but the hotel I stay in I am not exactly concerned with 4 star quality. The best part about this hotel is that you could not be closer to the entrance of the park! When i visit the happiest place on earth i spend every moment I can there and just use the hotel for sleeping. Which is perfect with this place. I suggest staying on the first floor since there aren't any elevators, and there are also plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and of course there is Downtown Disney, plenty of places there. This hotel was spacious and affordable.

Summary Heading: Average hotel in a great location
Summary: I was looking for a hotel within walking distance of Disneyland and found this to be the cheapest in the area.  After doing further research, I was aware of the extra fees tacked on (daily parking fee so I elected to use a shuttle service instead, resort fee, and in room safe fee) so I was not taken aback like some of the other reviewers.  I actually was able to check in to a room with a king size bed by noon, well before the regular check-in time.  Unfortunately it was on the 2nd floor and the hotel has no elevators, so I had to lug my stroller up and down the stairs every day but it was not a big deal.  The room was clean and the refrigerator and microwave was very useful.  The walls are a bit thin, I could hear people outside a lot.  It was about what I expected given the 2

Hotel staff very friendly, clean, great having a microwave and fridge as we found a supermarket so we were getting a dozen cans for $2.50. Breakfast was okay always plenty there. Handy to everything especially disneyland. Next time if I stay there I will request a room on the top level as there was a family above our room and every morning at 5.30 you would hear the kids jumping, either off the beds or the furniture.

This is a small hotel tucked back from the main street (S. Harbour Blvd).  No traffic noise and it is behind Denny's, which is convenient.  The #1 best thing about this hotel is location.  It is a very short walk to Disneyland's main gates (like 5 mins).  Literally across the street.  There are several other dining options close by like McDonald's, IHOP, Tony Roma's and Mimi's within walking distance.  Garden Walk is also very close with shopping, restaurants, bowling and movie theater.  We stayed in a room with 2 queens and a bunk bed and it was very spacious and clean.  Plenty of room for 5 of us and luggage and stroller, etc.  I was not a fan of the bed linens.  It got cold at night and the thin blanket and spread didn't provide much warmth.  However, the room fit our needs

I have stayed here a number of times, and cannot say enough about this property. The front desk staff was terrific and SO friendly! The rooms are nicely sized, and very clean. Great to have a fridge and microwave! Beds were super comfy too. You cannot beat the price, and the very short walk to Disneyland to make this a perfect choice for your next Disney visit!

The room was good sized and very clean.  The television, microwave, refrigerator, heater all worked fine.  Good reading lights over the beds, too.  Less than a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.   Can't ask for more!  $69 +tax, hotel fee, and parking (AAA card).  Very satisfied.  Didn't use the pool or breakfast.  Very friendly front desk people.

Summary Heading: Great place we would stay again!
Summary: We checked in new years eve and checked out the day after new years day. Checking in was a breeze about 5 mins... Rooms are big and bright .There is a microwave ,coffee maker and a fridge .The carpets were clean . Sheets were clean . Bathroom was clean . Water pressure and hot water were good too.Our family felt safe and comfortable . We were in the park most of the time . We pretty much used this place to crash and shower. It's very quiet at night but if u are trying to sleep in you will hear everyone and everything above you and next door to you be prepared!!! Ear plugs !! LoL I think next visit we"ll stay upstairs im sure the people below us will be annoyed... The walls are definitely thin. The rooms are pretty big though which is a big plus .... Other hotels have little or
This hotel was excellent for spending the day in Disneyland, easy to walk to the park and back whenever we wanted and the kids enjoyed the pool too.  Friendly service.

Summary Heading: Great rate & service across the street from Disneyland
Summary: My family of 5 stayed at the Del Sol Inn the weekend before Christmas.  We have stayed many nearby hotels on Harbor Blvd. because of their location across the street from the entrance of Disneyland.  Every hotel hiked up their prices for December.  I looked online for the best rate, and called to see if there were any rooms left.  I was told that there would be specials closer to the day we wanted to check-in & there were.  Two nights prior to our arrival at the Del Sol, I called and the rate was $98 for a 2 queen/bunk bed room. Since this was a surprise trip for Xmas for the kids, I was thrilled! We arrived late, just before midnight and I called to make sure the room was not going to be given away. Oscar at the front desk was very kind and helpful during checkout.  There is

Summary Heading: Misleading ad and pictures on their web site
Summary: The bright yellow rooms on their web site are now dark and the rooms smell bad.  The "Family Suite" they advertise is just two adjoining rooms with a connecting door, no actual "Family Suite" exists.  We booked a Family Suite six months in advance (for two parents, two kids and grandma), however, we were given two NON-adjoining rooms next to each other.  When we complained we were told that adjoining rooms (aka the "Family Suites") was "a request, not a guarantee."  We got little sympathy from each of the 3 desk clerks we spoke to.  The old refrigerator in one room was so loud we had to unplug it.  The heater/air conditioners were also very loud and not very efficient.  The TV remote control needed to be replaced (batteries were fine, it just did not work).  The outdoor pool was

Summary Heading: Not what I saw on previous reviews!
Summary: My husband and I along with our teen daughter spent four nights at the Del Sol Inn over the Thanksgiving weekend, Nov.24 thru 28 2011.  I did my research as I always do before our annual trip to Disney... wanting to stay a little closer to the parks, I chose the Del Sol Inn.  We usually stay close to Disney, and generally we have been very happy with our accommodations, other reviews along with the website gave us hopeful impressions of this Hotel.  What we found was a room that was much smaller than anticipated, not so bad... but the beds were terrible!  The mattresses were lopsided, they were uncomfortable and to make matters worse.. the bed spreads were fifthly!  We discovered what appeared to be semen on the coverlet of one of the beds, we removed it from the bed and told

Pros and cons but a good value. Cons- tiny parking lot but valet takes care of that. Not very well cleaned. Pros - good price, huge rooms with bunk beds, perfect for large families. Staff is super nice and attentive. Nice clean pool and spa.
Very clean and convinient. Staff was very nice. Will stay again!!

This hotel is a gem.  It's not a chain, which is a big PLUS in this case because it seems the employees and management are free to use their judgement to give excellent service and accomodation to their guests.  I was traveling alone with my 5 year old son (Daddy and sister didn't come on this trip) and I was a little nervous because of that.  The staff at the Del Sol took wonderful care of us and helped me totally relax. They looked up things on the internet for me, called me a cab when our shuttle service was running late and treated us kindly like family.  Because this is a small hotel, they really remember each guest and give each one personalized service.  We arrived super early and since they did have a room available, they went ahead and checked us in at 11 am, which was

I have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor Blvd and this is one of the better ones. The rooms are clean, the beds a bit on the hard side, but comfortable enough. The breakfast was a plus, but pretty basic. Nothing fancy, but It's convenient to Disneyland. All of the hotels in this area of Harbor are within walking distance which is a huge plus, however many of them are now charging for parking.

Summary Heading: Del Sol made me the happiest guest on earth
Summary: I am reviewing this as a budget hotel (i.e. I did not expect it to have the ambience or amenities of a 4-star property, and neither should you, dear Reader). This is an outstanding budget hotel in terms of spacious rooms, cleanliness and, above all, LOCATION.  We stayed here Oct 12-15, 2011. Four adults - me (41-year-old female), my sister and our parents. We had two adjoining rooms on the top level. My sister & I were in 224 and my parents were in 223.  I liked being tucked away in the far back corner of the property (still right next to a staircase), and it was great having the option of opening the two rooms to each other. Each room on its own was very spacious: two queen beds, a table with two chairs, a desk, a coffee table-like piece of furniture to put a suitcase on, a

We loved staying at the del Sol inn.  The location was perfect, right across the street from Disney.  We had small children so a short walk made going back and forth easy for any reason.  (naps, forgetting things, etc.)  The room was small but very clean and nicely decorated.  We were surprised it had a microwave and fridge.  Nice bedding and blinds.  The outside was small but quiet, back off the main road.  The staff members were very pleasant.  They were very helpful in getting us rooms next to our children and arranging transportation and baggage storage.  Thanks del Sol.  You are on the top of our list for our next Disneyland trip.

The Del Sol Inn is really close to Disneyland maingate. It is behind the Denny's resturant. After a long day at Disneyland when you turn the corner at Denny's the hotel looks like 20 miles away. But on the serious note it is close. I booked this hotel last minute because it was originally full. Price ended up being after taxes and everything a little over $125 a night and that is with taxes. Rooms are very large and spacious. I was going on a budget and knew we wouldnt be in the hotel only to sleep. It includes a microwave and refrigerator. The bathroom in my opinion kind of old looking. Noticed that the floors weren't cleaned very well. Towels are so thin and practically see through. Our first day there we came back to the room about 3 to change and our room wasnt cleaned. Not

Literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance, very convenient for returning to the room in the afternoons for a short break and to drop off souvenirs. Rooms are small but nice enough. Not too much noise. Parking lot's very small, but I typically fly down & take a cab from the airport, so it's perfect for me since you don't need a car once you arrive.

The Del Sol Inn is a nice clean place to stay. Rooms are clean. Most rooms are on the second level, so if you have special needs or have difficulty with stairs i would make a request for a 1st floor room as soon as you make a reservation. Also be aware of extra fees on top of your room rate, like parking and in-room safe which will up the price a good $10+

This hotel is really close to the entrance and at a fairly decent price.  The breakfast is not the greatest but includes donuts, muffins, toast and cereal.  The pool is open till 10pm so if your room is close to it you will hear the kids playing.  The staff was very attentive to our needs.(more towels and blankets) But like the title says it's great when you pay and great when walking back after a long day at the parks.

The place is in great walking distance from Disneyland BUT, the rooms are pretty small and the parking is worse. The hotel staff could be friendlier, seemed to be put off that we were there checking in. It's pretty noisey and could hear everything outside. I'd rather walk a few blocks than stay here again.

We recently stayed here for 7nites.It is 1 of the closest hotels to the disney entrance.It is a basic and clean hotel and we found it great for us.We used the laundry which was very handy.free breakfast was basic but fine.We dont have anything negative to say about this hotel,if i had too,id only say perhaps other guest need to be considerate with loud talking early in the morning and very late at nite!!!!

Summary Heading: Great service, and called me when I forgot my iPad
Summary: Hotel was nice, great distance from Disneyland.    Best part though was that a day after we got home and are trying to unpack and get things organized, we received a phone call from the desk clerk.  T.J. called and told us that we forgot our iPad in the room.  He is shipping it to our home immediately.  What great service!!  I would definitely return to the Del Sol.
The rooms were clean and the location is real close to the entrance of disneyland. i will be coming back to stay for other disney trips in the future.

the wifi was hard to get into.  the room was much nicer than the other hotels ive stayed in at disney.  its real close to the front gate.  but they add parking onto the bill when you leave.  i dont like paying to park at a hotel, so i probably wont go back even for the convenience.  being on the second floor i expected all the outside noise to be better, but it still had a bad seal on the door so you could hear rhe kids running around.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Value, Great Service.  We will be back!
Summary: Loved the Del Sol.  Stayed here for 5 nights on our Disneyland vacation.  The absolute BEST thing about the Del Sol is location, location, location!  It is so unbelievably close to Disneyland it's almost laughable -- we laughed when we walked past Denny's, turned right and there was the crosswalk to Disneyland's main gate only a few yards away!  The employees at Del Sol couldn't be friendlier -- especially the parking attendants.  They are so, so nice.  Yes, parking is tight there but they are so helpful with that.  Once we turned our car over to them to park it ($8 a day parking fee but free valet), we never drove again.  But if you need to get in and out for whatever reason, they will get it in and out for you with no problem.  The rooms are bright and cheery and very clean.

I took my grandson to Disneyland for a long weekend and chose the Del Sol on a referral from my daughter.  The hotel sits back away from Harbor Blvd.(so that's good for the traffic noise factor) The crosswalk to Disneyland is very close to this hotel.  The Denny's restaurant is on the way out of the parking lot and very inexpensive for a hearty breakfast before hitting the parks.  While we were there a lot of the rooms seems to be going through a total remodel.  The hot tub and pool area were clean and very close to our room.  We would definately stay here again as the value and close proximity were great!

Summary Heading: Overbooked and forced to a hotel on the other side of town
Summary: This was one of the worse travel experiences I have had.  I reserved a room at the Del Sol directly through their website four months in advance.  I arrived at 3pm and was informed that they had over booked the hotel and would be bumping us to another hotel.  We were handed a mapquest map and sent on our way.  There was no apologies or offer of compensation.  No nothing.  When I looked at the map I found out that the new hotel was a mile away from the Disneyland Park.  The only reason I booked the Del Sol was because it was directly across the street from the parks.  I pointed this out to the desk clerk and she still didn't care.  She said the new hotel was brand new (which it wasn't) and that it wasn't that far (I consider a mile walk every morning far).  It ended up costing us

We were just staying here over night after a day at Disneyland and before we had to fly home the next day on the end of a big trip. Our room was very big and very clean. The breakfast in the morning was okay as well. I think you have to pay for parking there but they did not make us as we did not get to the hotel until about midnight. That was very nice of them. Also, the location is perfect if you want to walk to Disneyland.

Most of the Harbor Boulevard hotels have come to a certain accommodation level somewhere between an Econolodge and a Holiday Inn Express, so there's not a lot to say about the style of the property except what distinguishes it from its sister hotels up and down the street.  Google maps is a great way to see exactly how convenient a hotel is to the Disneyland Resort.  You basically have two ways to get in - one from the west and one from the east.  On the west side is the Disneyland family of hotels and Downtown Disney, so staying on that side you have to go through all that to get to the parks.    On the east side, the pedestrian entrance is directly across from the IHOP at 1560 S Harbor Blvd, and when I say directly, you cross the street and you are walking into the front door

Summary Heading: Suits our needs, but don't want to pay for parking....
Summary: I spent two and a half weeks on the road, from home in Edmonton, Alberta, with my husband and two daughters ages 19 and 16 from the middle of June to the beginning of July. We travelled straight through to our first stop in Las Vegas where we stayed at the Signature at MGM. We then headed to the Anaheim Del Sol (via a few outlet malls). We have stayed here numerous times in the past and love the location. We can walk across to Disneyland in minutes. The check in was quick and easy and we were offered a room next to the breakfast room. At first we were reluctant as we thought it would be noisy, but realized we would be up before it opened so elected to take it. It was a room that was larger than our previous stay down the same side. The last stay was 2 years ago and they have

Great location, Awesome service, Very friendly staff.  5 min walk to Disneyland, very clean rooms fresh linen everyday.  Friendly staff members always up for a chat even at 2am.  If you needed anything printed off it was no problem.  Complementry breakfast every morning, pool and a hot tub.

The hotel was perfect for us, we were there for 10 days...it's close to the Park so we could come back when we wanted to (great as we were travelling with a small child), the beds were large and comfy, room clean and larger than most...loved the fact that it had a fridge, microwave and a safe & the Manager was very helpful...the breakfast was basic but we were gone early anyways so we'd just grab some toast or Danish and be off...didn't find the noise a problem at all & we didn't have a car so parking wasn't an issue for us...we also had lots of options for restaurants nearby...all and all we were on a budget so this was great for us...we just wanted a room to come back to as we were out and about all the time, so we were very happy with our stay...bottom line if you're on a

The Del Sol Inn far exceeded our expectations. We have stayed at a number of the hotels directly across from the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland and found the Del Sol to be comparable if not better for less money. The double queen rooms are larger than most, giving us plenty of space for luggage and the 12 pairs of shoes/flip flops my wife and two girls brought. Beds were comfortable enough, showers had plenty of hot water, service in the room and at the front desk was excellent. Special thanks to Iqbal who gave us first rate service....great job Iqbal! We will stay at the Del Sol again.

Summary Heading: Highly suprised how nice this was
Summary: I read the reviews and had low expectations. We chose The Del Sol because I wanted across the street and affordable. At the last minute I almost switched to a better known hotel brand name. They were far more expensive so we entered The Dol Sol Inn planning to not spend time in our room anyway.  The front desk staff were super fast and friendly! Although I arrived early they had my room ready for me. The room was bright and cheery. It smelled fresh and clean but not like deodorizers, more like fresh clean air.   The showers were not a problem. It was very quiet with the door closed. Plenty of towels and everything that we needed was there. We easily parked just right outside our door.   The pool was PERFECT for unwinding after a long drive. It also broke up our days at the park.

This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland which is great when you have large groups of varying ages and health.   They have on site laundry which came in handy having 4 kids and 4 adults for a week stay.  There is a  pool, which my kids loved.   Rooms were big enough, but smelled musty and for some reason the cleaning ladies didn't come in unless we asked them to. (Front desk told us that with people staying several days this was common as part of their environmental program to save energy, etc... That is okay with me for certain things - i can see not changing the sheets daily, but i do expect clean towels and clean cups and i do expect the garbages to be dumped when full!)  Continental breakfast is very basic and there is never enough for the amount of guests they
