I have stayed at the Anaheim Del Sol Inn many times. It is super close to Disneyland so it is easy to return for a dip in the pool or an evening sweatshirt. The beds are awesome. The staff make this place home. I like that it is a smaller boutique-like setting. The free breakfast is just enough to get the day started. Free internet keeps the kids happy on their devices. The staff is super accommodating. The fridge and microwave are perfect for in-room snacking. We were there for 4 days. The room was always super cleaned and well supplied.   Del Sol can not be beat for location. They do not charge for "resort fee" parking, internet, breakfast. There are no hidden fees. I appreciate the upfront pricing.

This was the most horrible hotel I have ever been to!! We stayed 1 night, and 1 night too many!! The room was pretty musty when we walked in (which by the way the room was not even ready when we arrived 2 hours AFTER check in time) We thought it would do since we werent planning on spending much time in the room. So after sleeping on very uncomfortable beds and waking up to our food being room temp from the fridge NOT working, we decided to get ready for a fun day at Disney, well that would have been great if the shower head were more than 5 feet tall, and if there were any water pressure and the drain wasnt clogged. That was my husbands opinion. So I go to get in the shower, and all of the sudden i see THE BIGGEST most disgusting cockroach I have EVER seen! It was running so

I called this hotel directly and made a reservation. I received a confirmation number. I received a confirmation e-mail. I showed up 5 hours before check in time to park my car and take my family to Disneyland. We were told on arrival that they had overbooked the hotel and we were chosen not to get a room because we were only staying one night. The lady in the office was rude and she didn't understand why I was upset that they overbooked. I have a tip. Stay at the Ramada.

Summary Heading: A quality stay for a group of 12
Summary: We have stayed at other hotels in the area in the past and del Sol won us over.  We will definitely book with them again.  We would recommend them to friends and family.  Our family vacations always include 5 adults and 7 kids from 12 yrs - 4yrs.  There was not a complaint among the lot of us!  We had a great stay.  We had great service and always saw people around to take care of the facilities and provide great service.  The pool is nicely kept.  The only draw backs are the parking and one washer and dryer unit, however, those are not enough to deter us from making future reservations.

Summary Heading: Ultra clean, unbeatable location, super value.
Summary: Older place but clean.  The location is great as it is across the street from Disney, probably a 5 minute walk, 10 with kids.  Staff is friendly and we would stay here again.  To be picky, parking is a pretty tight and it can be pretty noisy especially down by the pool area.  No free internet when we stayed.  I paid $10 bucks for 1 day access and it was impossibly slow.  But for $80-90 bucks per night I still give it an excellent rating.  We were just looking for an inexpensive and convenient location for small kids and we were pleasantly surprised.
I stay at Del Sol 3 times a year.  I find the accomodations comfortable and clean.  It is located right across from Disneyland which is our destination.  The staff are helpful and friendly.

We have stayed at Del Sol countless times and will keep coming back. My daughter puts it best." It's like coming home, Mom."  Loretta and T J are always so nice and seem to understand our needs. They always give us a great deal and we love it. Sure there are more crowded, upity, hotels but this one offers clean rooms with a refrigerator and microwave with premium cable channels that can entertain if your not at the park. plus, the park is closer to walk to than the Disney Resort hotels. We have sent many friends here.

Summary Heading: Great value, Great place, Great location (Next to The Mouse)
Summary: Upon arrival at at this hotel we were pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff. We requested a room on the lower level and our room was so clean and comfortable. It was so convenient to Disneyland resort (just across the street). We could walk to the parks within 5 to 10 minutes. There are many restaurants close by for meal options. On our last day I call the front desk to see if we could have a late checkout. T.J. checked and said that it was no problem. When we were checking out I commented to T.J. that the room was so clean and comfortable he told me that that one wasn't even renovated yet so I can't wait to see the new improvements. Looking forward to staying there on our next trip.

Summary Heading: Service as if you were still at Disney
Summary: I stayed at the Del Sol Inn in September of 2010. Check-in went great, TJ was fantastic and soooo helpful. When we got up to our room, our key wouldn't work, so we walked back to the lobby where TJ reset our keys and asked us to try again. He watched us try the key again and even called the room when we got in to make sure we got in okay and asked if there was anything else we needed.    Our second to last night we were staying there, house keeping showed up to clean the room and informed us we were checking out that night. After talking to TJ again, we realized that we had booked one less night than we meant to. Luckily, TJ was nice enough to give us another night at the original price we paid, instead of the new price. Thank goodness!   We absolutely love the service here. The

Summary Heading: Location is great, but that's about it!
Summary: I read a bunch of other reviews before I came here, so I knew the parking would be bad.  Therefore, we never moved our car and it wasn't really an issue.  Plus, why would anyone need to drive?  This hotel is literally across the street from the Disneyland gates and between the parking lot (which has a Denny's) and a three block walk (to a mall) there are at least 100 shops and restaurants.  No car required!  We're not Denny's people, so we had some excellent meals at the restaurants in GardenWalk.    The location is amazing for the price we paid, but don't expect anything more than that.  We got a major attitude from the front desk when we checked in.  In response to "have a nice day" the front desk agent responded with "I'll try".  Not exactly the response you expect from

The Del Sol is never going to win any awards for chicness, or style. But what it lacks in that, it makes up for in proximity and functionality. We stayed there for 4 nights during the worst rain CA has seen in centuries. The hotel did the best job they could at clearing the water that pooled in front of our room. I was a little worried that water might come into our room, but thankfully that never happened.  The room was clean and neat, and service was good. We received fresh linens daily. The room had a good sized fridge and microwave which was really handy since we were travelling with a small child. The hotel couldn't be in a better location in relation to Disneyland. It's a short walk to the light which is right at the main entrance. For  the price you can't beat it. It was

Rooms were big and had a lot of room. Close to Disneyland park intrance and Dennys. The front desk were very nice and helpful. When parking was full they were able to get us a secured spot to park close to the hotel.

Summary Heading: For the last 7 years my family and I have stayed at the Del Sol Inn.
Summary: The Del Sol Inn is clean, well priced and is one of the closest hotels to Disney's main entrance.  That is a very important feature if your visiting Disneyland and have to carry your sleeping kids back to the room at night.  I also appreciate the front end manager TJ and his staff.  I can honestly say, they take care of me year after year.  Give this place a shot, you won't be dissappointed.  Paul D...

The Del Sol Inn offers a variety of benefits to their guest.  First and foremost, the service is excellent; from the management on down to the cleaning staff.  Secondly, their prices are very reasonable.  What makes it an even more attractive offer is that they offer a free continental breakfast.  And last but not least, their proximity to Disneyland makes it convenient to get to and from the park.

OK, so some people didn't like this or that but lets face it, have you checked the prices of the other Hotels?  Pay $ 100 more and you will get a better breakfast,  or just have a coffee and a muffin and go to a restaurant for a better meal.  You are here because it is inexpensive and the location is great. It's just that simple, you get what yo pay for. Interesting that if you pay $200 more, you probably wouldn't have to many complaints.  Why are you here then?  I will come back because we just want a simple place to sleep.  British_eh

Very disappointing.  Stayed here to be close to the park, but with litlle sleep and a lousy breakfast, it wasn't worth it.  The beds felt like concrete.  The breakfast was bland cereal, bread, a few small danishes and some juice or milk.  The pool was nice, and they let us swim even after it was supposed to close for the night. Internet was also $10 per day!

The staff was wonderful. Our room was comfortable & stocked with extra pillows. The shower  head was high with good water pressure. After a full day of Disney, it was nice to come "home" to the Del Sol . We had a very comfortable 5 days & will definitely stay with them again.

Summary Heading: Do not drive to this hotel
Summary: The location is great and the hotel its self was not bad,  But they only have 35 parking stalls for 60 rooms,  we rented a car and only left the hotel a few times  but when we returned  from a long day at Knotts Berry Farm  there was not place to park, and the employees already gave up there spots,  I was not very happy when they said I could park in the Dennys lot  until 10:00PM but I needed to get out of bed and go move the car every two hours,   so they said we could park at the Plaza hotel 3 hotels down, my rental car stayed there for 2 days because there was still no parking at the DelSol,  this is a ok place to stay if you do not have a car,

Summary Heading: Good for frugal Disneyland experience.  Expect nothing more.
Summary: Beds are extra firm. Rooms are good sized.  Breakfast is a danish, juice, toast, and generic cold cereal, but nothing hot. Location is perfect for Disneyland.  No elevator for 2nd floor rooms.  Rain leak ruined some of our belongings, and management did not even offer to replace as much as a toothbrush.

Summary Heading: Would Stay again in a heart beat!
Summary: My boyfriend and I decided to do a trip to Disneyland over Memorial Day weekend. We left Thursday at 11pm and arrived at Del Sol Inn at 6am. We were worried we would not be able to check in and since we drove through the night, we were dead tired. We parked in a spot directly in front of the office(for free!) and went in and were able to check in at 6am! Our entire experience here was awesome. Our room was a single with a king. Great TV channels, fridge and microwave included for free too. They also provided a list a local places that delivered food, which most hotel do I guess but it was ice to have the menus right there. The free breakfast was just basic cereal, pastries and toast with juice and coffee. Nothing special but it was nice to eat a few pastries, drink some juice

If you want to stay somewhere cheap and close to Disneyland, this hotel is definitely that.  We had no noise problems, but the AC/Fan was pretty loud, so it would have covered up any noise outside. We were located near the pool, and the pool seemed to close much earlier than we were going to bed each night, but still didn't hear much from there.  Room was clean and big enough for 4 adults to share.  Don't expect much from the included breaksfast, it is just danishes, toast, coffee, and cold cereal. Beds were not super comfortable, but it doesn't matter too much after a day at Disneyland.  Parking lot has pretty small spaces, but nothing too different  My biggest complaint at this place was the service. We had trouble explaining to the lady checking us in that we were checking

I've stayed at several of the nearby hotels and the Del Sol Inn was the most economical. The location is worth staying here. The place is an old motel, but it's OK. Bring earplugs. I did not bring a car. The breakfast will get you by until you can get something better. The tiny pool is just fine. Bigger isn't always better. The front desk person was VERY nice and VERY helpful. I WILL BE BACK!

One thing the Del Sol has going for it is the walking distance to Disneyland but that is about it. The parking lot has small stalls and is difficult to manuever. I wish that was the worst of it. The two bed queen room was not  large enough and one bed butted up against the air conditioner which meant you had to crawl over the bed to get into bed from that side. Things started off with a non working TV remote, a loud air condiioner that I could not adjust the temperature on, that the nob pulled off of. I requested a repair that never happened after a 5 night stay. The sink was clogged which they did repair. The beds were hard, noisy and uncomfortable. We were very dissapointed in how noisy it was from the outside and from the room above us. However, the noisy air conditioner did

Summary Heading: Excellent service and 5 minutes from Disneyland's main entrance
Summary: My daughter ( 5 years old) and I had a really good time at the Del Sol Inn. I was looking for a hotel with a reasonable price, clean and really close to Disneyland's main entrance. I'm a single mom and I was also concerned about safety but I found everything that I was looking for at the Del Sol Inn.  Everybody was really friendly and very helpful. T.J. Jones was the best! I was really impressed with his customer service at the reception.  After a full day at the Park, all you need is a very close hotel with a nice and clean bed. We choose the top floor and it was awesome, no noises. We are coming back for sure! Vancouver, BC - Canada

Summary Heading: Nice and sooo close to Disneyland!
Summary: Rooms were clean, new carpet; Pool & hot tub were great. Staff very accomodating by letting us check in early morning & then we were off to Disneyland.  Great because Disneyland is so close & when your tired that counts!  No waiting for shuttles!

We recently took our kids to Disneyland.  This was the third time that we have taken our 3 kids and the first time staying at Del Sol.  I was VERY impressed with the level of service from the housekeeping staff at this hotel.  It was so nice to come back to a completely straightened room every day and on the days that the 'do not disturb' sign was up it was easy to get just the few items that we needed.  There was also a day when we took the 'do not disturb' sign off of the door handle shortly after the housekeepers had already worked past our room.....when we returned later that evening, our room had been cleaned!  Needless to say, as a mother of 3 it was so nice to have such great housekeeping service while on vacation.

We booked because the location was great.  That is where great ended though.  First, no parking.  They have more rooms than parking spaces.   Second, the furniture in our room was covered in furniture polish that came off on our clothes and hands.  Ruined one shirt.  Third, the pool was a postage stamp.  The amenities in the room were no better than a Motel 6.  Air conditioner was noisy.  Then we received a phone call at 10:30PM saying we had to come back to the lobby and check in again because the afternoon clerk (at 2:30PM) checked us into the wrong hotel room.  They swiped our credit card again so we are just waiting for the double billing.   It just has not been a good experience at this dump.

Summary Heading: DEL SOL INN - GREAT PRICE, GREAT SERVICE, GREAT LOCATION!
Summary: My wife and daughter and I checked in early Friday morning (for the 1st of our 3 nights) and "TJ the Incredible" managed to find a room for us! We were grateful as we had business later that morning in L.A. so this made it possible to freshen up prior to our meeting. For the remainder of the stay we enjoyed the convenience of being so close to The Happiest Place on Earth!  The building itself is just behind the Denny's Restaurant which means you don't get all the traffic noise from the street. The continental breakfast was usual fare - fill you up with pastries, toast, cereal, coffee and orange juice from 7am-9am. Parking is free and about half of it is covered which is great. We also loved the swimming pool which was just ourside our door... amazing how warm it kept throughout

Summary Heading: Great Stay - will be staying again!
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with the del Sol Inn.  The rooms were large, beds were decent, hotel was quite clean.  We had a room by the pool, so it was a bit loud when we were trying to sleep, but we managed.  We did happen to be there during some remodeling (new carpets) so I imagine it got a bit loud during the day, but by evening, everything was put away and it was quiet again.  Parking is limited, but they never claim otherwise.  We managed to snag a spot right by our room and just never moved our car!  It's the perfect location, with great staff (TJ was awesome), and amazing prices!  We're staying there again on our next DLR trip this fall.
The Indian man at the counter was a total jerk.    Would I recommend to a friend ?  HELL NO!!!!!!!!!!!!

we picked this hotel because it is close to disneyland but little did I know we were asked to move our car a 1pm.  Why would I want to stay at a hotel because it's close and then have to move my car and pay an extra 14 dollars for parking at the disney parking structure, on the other side of the park?  I will never stay there again.  The manager was a idiot.

Summary Heading: The del Sol is convenient, and is good value for the money.
Summary: We like the del Sol inn because it is so close to the Disneyland Park entrance, and the people who work there are so nice and helpful.

I stayed in the kids suite with my brother/sister in law and my family total count of 7 for 6 days. Upon arrival the gentleman at the front desk was very nice and super helpful, checked us in immediately. The room was clean, good size, and comfortable. Rug did have a few stains but in a kids suite thats to be expected. The hotel is very close to the main street, however it was not noisey at all. The location was so convenient for having our little ones, it literally takes 4 minutes to get to disneylands main gate. Parking is tight but we didn't mind because we parked the car and didn't get back in until it we had to check out. The free breakfast was perfect for us, who doesn't like toast and jelly, fruit or danishes. The kids enjoyed it and so did we. We would definently stay

Our room smelled.  Walls are very thin so we heard people talking, shutting doors, etc..  My parents room was the same.  Breakfast consisted of coffee and danish muffins. Parking, at first we did not have anywhere to park, my husband complained and said when one pays for a room, you expect to be able to park. An employee gave us her space.  My parents had to park around the hotel.  I would not recommed this hotel to anyone.

After many weeks of checking Trip Advisor and other raiting web sites we booked our room at the Del Sol inn for our Disneyland vacation. My husband was very concerned with the reviews that this hotel had but we decided to give it a try anyways. The price and the location can not be beat! The other hotels that are directly across from the maingate entrance charge more than double what we paid at Del Sol. The room was very clean and the staff was great. The rooms are also very large compared to other hotels in the area. Our friend stayed next door at the Desert Suites and our room was much larger thans hers. The breakfast was so so, but very nice to have available, and we did notice that the water would change from hot to warm, but this only happened a couple times. Overall the
TJ, at the front desk, was a gem to work with. He was very easy to talk with an accomplish what we needed for our stay.

Summary Heading: A happy motel with upscale rooms
Summary: The atmosphere at this motel is happy because it's directly across the street from the main and only entrance to Disneyland.  The entranceway leads to behind the row of businesses on Harbor Blvd., so it's quieter in that respect, but the rooms are arranged in a horseshoe shape around the pool, so in that respect, it's noisey.  Our room (#120) was off on the side so it was very quiet.   I'm officially hereby complaining about the meager breakfast hours (7 to 9 a.m.). The overall appearance of the motel might be slightly run down or outdated, but our room was fresh and almost elegant.   Everyone we interacted with on the staff was friendly and helpful. Wi-fi costs $10/24-hours and there's no business center, but the front desk staff will print something for you, like a boarding

TJ and his staff at the Del Sol were so incredible to work with.  Very knowledgeable and VERY friendly.  Would commend them on their customer service ability and am sure they would be hard to match.  The hotel itself was extremely close to Disneyland and for the value was well worth it.  The only drawback would be that the rooms seemed to have very thin walls as you could hear others nearby, and the showers would fluctuate from warm, to hot, to cold, to warm.  Overall, mostly because of TJ and his staff, we would definately stay again.

After reading all the previous reviews we had concerns about the water temp changing, as well as the parking, and the overall noise factor.  The location of this hotel is great, just right across the street from Disneyland making it handy to head back during the day if need be, as well as at night when you're very tired and don't have far to go.  The staff was friendly and helpful, if we needed anything they saw to it right away.  The rooms were quite clean.  We did have a couple of times when the water temp while taking a shower would fluctuate, but this was more noticeable on the weekend when it was busy.  For the rest of the week, it was no problem.  Parking can be tight as there are not a lot of parking spaces, but overall it wasn't a problem for us.  If the pool is being

During our stay my son forgot his coins for penny pushers in the night slot in the lobby . When we returned from DL that night there was an envelope on our bed with the forgotten coins! The wonderful Asst. Manager, TJ, was so kind to return it to my son. TJ was the only one in the office that day & went out of his way w/customer service! I highly recommend the Del Sol & highly recommend that TJ get recognized for going above & beyond w/customer service!

Summary Heading: Clean! and almost the closest to pedestrian walkway to Disneyland!
Summary: I Booked the hotel thru AAA, got a discount! Hotel serves a basic Continental Breakfast and advertised a refrigerator in Room! both major selling points.  Room with 2 double beds was beds and pillows were great. Room had both microwave and fridge (very clean no odors in fridge).   Our only complaint was the size of the bathroom,(it was the length of tub and width of tub, toilet plus 6 inches!)  Employees were very personable, and helpful. Half the parking spaces available are covered. and the Denny's restaurant  sits right in front of the Hotel. We definately will stay here again.

You can not say enough about the location of this place.  If you stayed at any of Disney's resort hotels, you would be further away from the entrance than you are from this one.  It is located just behind Denny's which saves you from the noise of Harbor.  The hotel is an older one but we did not find it run down.  The rooms were recently redone and the plumbing, heat (didn't use the AC), refrigerator and TV worked great.  The place looked like it was recently painted and the carpeting looked new.  The walls are a bit thin but with only 65 rooms it didn't matter.  The plus side of being an older place is that the rooms were large in comparison to some of the newer places.    The breakfast is nothing to write home about but it is better than others I have had in the area.  I would

We stayed at the Del Sol the end of January for 3 nights for a family reunion. We had a group of 20 staying there with a lot of young children. The walk to Disneyland could not have been better, it only took 5 mins to be at Disneyland. I do have to say the hotel is very old and could use some updating, but with that being said it was clean. The front desk was extremely helpful with our big group, and were very nice. The breakfast was VERY basic, but it was enough to start our day. We were told the pool was heated, but once we got there it was freezing cold, but we really didn't have time to swim, so it didn't effect us much. All in all for someone on a tight budget that wants to stay close to Disneyland entrance it is the perfect place. Plus the parking is free!
We stayed 2 nights‚Äô great price and real close to Disneyland.

My family and I are annual pass holders to Disneyland and we stay in Anaheim a couple times a year.  We wanted to find a hotel that was in our budget and was closer to the park than we have stayed in the past.  We were pleasantly surprised with the location of this hotel.  It is directly across from the entrance to Disneyland and sits back further from busy Harbor Blvd than the other hotels around us.  As for the room, it was large and comfortable.  The goose down blanket on the bed was great and the furniture was new.  Had everything we needed.  We found our new hotel when we come again in a few months.

Summary Heading: Not the best, but it will do.....
Summary: Thinking back about what others said about this hotel, I agree that the walls are thin, there are few parking spaces, no coffee to go along with the coffee maker and our toilet clogged too.  Since the walls are so thin, it might be hard getting to sleep at night or sleeping in (if that's what you want to do).  Also, the pool is only 3.5 feet deep, so if you have teenagers that like to jump around in the pool, this place might not be for you.  But there was a fridge, microwave, comfortable bed and it is so conveniently located near the entrance to Disneyland.  As long as the price is right, I have no problem staying here again.

Just returned from a week long trip to Disneyland.   The Del Sol is a short walk from the main entrance to the parks.  The rooms was basic, but had new carpets and was very clean.  The bathroom is small, but has a large counter with a sink  in the main room.  There was plenty of room to move about, so we did not feel cramped.  The only issue we had was that it wasn't as soundproof as a newer hotel.  Children running in the rooms above could be heard, so we woke up a little earlier than we might have wanted.  They provided a breakfast of cereal, toast, juice and coffee each morning.  The pool was refreshing in the afternoon when we took a break from the parks   For the price I paid this hotel was a super value.

I was concerned after reading all of the Negative coments on what we were really paying for... Usually, we priceline and get a hotel-have to park at the parks and walk in. So we decided to get a hotel across from Disneyland! The coments were not good but we took a chance. We loved staying here. The walk is so worth it. We timed from our room to the gate was a 4 min. walk. Meaning, if the kids and us got tired we went back for a nap. We felt it didnt waste time walking or having to go to the car and park.  Comes down to location, location, location. We got a great rate for what it was worth.  The room was clean and big, for our strollers, ice chests we brought, and our luggage. Its a small hotel so the word, intimate. I would stay here again when we go back. If you arent picky,

I stayed here with my family as we went to Disneyland for a family vacation. First of all, The hotel did not look like it was cleaned. The tub was dirty, and while sitting on the toilet, water dripped onto my head from the ceiling. We were on the bottom floor.  There was no toilet paper, and when calling to ask for toilet paper they asked me if I could send someone to get it at the front desk, and not to mention the toilet overflew with just my son going potty in it.  This is what gets me the most..... When checking into the hotel they made an imprint of my credit card. My whole trip I used cash for my purchases. Days later I find purchases on my card from LA, for Tile companys, oh and did I mention that the hotel was remodleing. A little strange if you ask me.  So do yourself a
I have stayed at 16 places in Anaheim and this was not low end of all of them. Room walls are paper thin. Only good thing is it was next to disneyland.

Summary Heading: Never again, will I stay here.
Summary: Sure it is close to Disneyland, but they only let you park at the hotel the first day. Once you check out, you must move your car to the Disneyland parking structure, so what is the point of staying so close if you cant park there til you are ready to leave that day. Oh, and the hotel room floors were dirty, the light outside the room shined through the window all night, there were not enough towels or pillows in the room, there was a coffee maker with no coffee, the pool was gross, they charged a $ resort fee that I am still confused why, there was not enough parking and the free breakfast was juice and a bagal. Nasty place!

Summary Heading: OK but old-awesome location to Dland
Summary: Best thing abt this place is the location--park and walk across the street into downtown disney and the parks.  Bad things---you can hear everything--we stayed just one night and a party showed up at 1 AM that woke us up and then kept us and our two small children up all night--as a result our room was comped but can't say I would stay there again.  The room we had was spacious and good sized fridge and microwave.  But it seemed really old and not as clean as newer hotel rooms.  We could hear everyone take a shower from the pipes--2nd floor is prob better--we were on the first and could hear everything.  Good for location and one night!

Summary Heading: Would Definitely Stay Here Again-No Frills-Clean and Simple!
Summary: My family and I just returned from a 2 week long road trip vacation to California from Alberta.  Our first stop was the Rodeway Inn in Pocatello and our next stay was New York New York in Las Vegas.  We then stayed at the Del Sol in Anaheim.  This is our third stay at this motel.  It is non-descript, but you can‚Äôt beat the location.  It is literally across the street from Disneyland!  The rooms are plain, but clean and No bed bugs.  Parking was free-apparently this isn‚Äôt the case with all the accommodations across the street from the parks.  It also includes a free continental breakfast.  It includes toast, cereal, juice, oranges and pastries.  It is enough to get you going in the morning.  Our room was a decent size, which was important as we‚Äôd accumulated quite a few purchases

I usually stay at this hotel when I go to Disneyland.  I get an annual pass for Disney every year.  I only spend one nite per visit, but I don't recall ever having a bad stay.  The front desk was efficient and I was always treated very well.  It is an old hotel, but it's not as bad as a Motel 6.  The morning breakfast is nothing special, so don't get your hopes up.  It's Ok if you have kids that just want to eat cereal.  The location is great and so is the price (especially for AAA).  Easy walk back and forth to the entrance.  The hotel is right behind a Dennys Restaurant.

This motel far exceeded my expectations. It is located directly across the street from the main gate at disney, but is set in behind a Denny's, off the main street, so when your at the motel, you literally cant tell that disneyland is across the street. The rooms were spacious, had comfortable beds but most importantly, had in room fridge, microwave, coffee maker, blowdryer and bathtub, which are all essential for me when travelling with the kids. There was continental breakfast consisting of cereal, toast, juice, coffee and fruit, which is totally cool for me. The pool was very clean and the grounds were kept really nice, with palm trees and flowerbeds. The motel itself is painted bright colors which made it extra charming. We walked around Anaheim, and I looked at all the

Summary Heading: Do NOT stay at this hotel
Summary: I was looking for a hotel that was within walking distance of the park so we decided to stay here.  We came as a large group (occupied 5 rooms) for a full week.  The pool was ok and the spa was warm however the rooms were not clean.  The carpets were dirty and come to find out one of our rooms was infested with bed bugs!  Now we are all taking precautions as we unpack to ensure none of these gross little bugs came with us home! Luckily it was not my room that had the bugs however I did find a huge dying cockroach on my bathroom floor the morning we checked out.  When I went down to the front desk to advise them of this they just brushed it off. Last but not least our group had children included and one of the kids got coffee spilled on his leg (in the breakfast area) that caused

Beds are very hard, walls are so thin you can hear everyone all night and being on the first floor was like having someone walk on your head all night. Showers are for very short people ( I am 5'4") and runs scalding or freezing no matter how early you get up to try to get some hot water. Parking is for smaller vehicles and not enough. Free breakfast is not healthy at all except for oranges. Great location for Disney but don't plan on sleeping well or getting a good shower!

Summary Heading: The POSITIVE reviews have to be from the rude guy behind the counter
Summary: I should have paid more attention to the reviews on the hotel. It was a joke. First, I couldn't figure out where the Super Shuttle guy was going when we arrived. The hotel sit's IN BETWEEN and BEHIND two other nicer hotels about a block from the street. I had two large, 50 lb suitcases for my daughter and myself, so I asked where the elevator was...NO ELEVATOR! And NO help carrying your luggage up the stairs. The guy had a smirk on his face when I asked. The towels were dirty, bathroom was dirty, it was just gross. I tried to get another hotel but everything was booked up with convention people. The sink was clogged too. There were also these little black "knit" type bugs in the bathroom every morning. This hotel should be bull dozed. The pool was "out of service" too. It was a

Stayed at the Del Sol on January 4th for just one night.  I had an overnight layover at LAX and decided to have an afternoon at Disneyland.  I arrived at noon to find my room wouldn't be ready for me until 2:00.  I didn't want to lose a whole lot of time at the park waiting to check into my room.  I pleaded with the manager but he insisted there was nothing he could do.  When I asked him if he had an employee restroom where I could at least brush my teeth and change my clothes after a long international flight he broke and gave me a key to an uncleaned room.  Don't get me wrong, the room was gross (I don't get how people can live like that) but he didn't have to help me and I appreciate that he did.  When I arrived back from the park that evening the room was very clean.  On the

Summary Heading: Cheap and right across the street from Disney!
Summary: We stayed at the Del Sol (for the 3rd time) from 12/22-12/25.  As long as you stay on the second floor, the room is silent for a peaceful nights sleep.  They offer a small continental breakfast of cereal, bread for toasting, and danishes.  Though it isn't a huge selection, if you fill up on it, it can save a family of 4 $45 on breakfast at the park.  The hotel has a Denny's in the parking lot for those late night munchies.  The staff is always pleasant and helpful.  The only down side to this hotel is the showers.  They can go from burning hot to icy cold on you at any given moment.   I have stayed at the Disney Hotel and I can assure you, the only thing better at the Disney Hotel were the showers, at a price of 3x's what you'll pay at the Del Sol.  If you are a family on a

What a terrible hotel- I booked very late in the month, so this part was my fault, I didn't think I would be going to Disneyland, but it worked out that I could go. So, I jumped on line and started to book my usual hotels, but found they were booked.  I found Del Sol, and while the reviews were not that great, I was really hoping that it wouldn't be "that bad. "   Upon arrival I checked into my room; it looked clean and was tidy, although the bathroom had a very distinctive odor of unsanitary conditions. I asked for a maid to come and clean the bathroom again, and no one bothered to come to the room. I did however, see the maid's cart a few doors down, but found no one around. I ended up using a spray cleaner I found on the cart and sprayed the bathroom down and wiped it down

Summary Heading: Loved the location, hated the hotel
Summary: Location is wonderfully across the street from Disneyland so there's very little extra walking involved in staying at this hotel.    Here's the bad:  We requested an extra pillow and blanket that we never received in our 3 night stay there.  The bathroom is smaller than a closet.  You couldn't sit on the toilet and shut the door....there's no room!  The shower head is about 4 feet off the shower floor so you had to bend over to wash your hair.  The water temperature fluctuated so much that it was just pretty much cold all the time.  The flow down the drain was slow so you were standing in about 2 inches of water the whole time while showering.  Our phone didn't work during our entire stay.  The continental breakfast is a laugh.  There are 2 cereal choices both of them generic,

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet Place with the Lowest Rates on the Harbor Blvd Strip
Summary: I visit Disneyland a few times a year and I more often than not, I  stay at the del Sol Inn. For the past few years, they've consistently had the lowest rates compared to the other clean, attractive hotels that are within a very short walking distance to Disneyland.  Yes, the del Sol Inn is 30+ years old, (it was the Marco Polo Motel years ago) and it has some signs of aging, but it's well-maintained.  They just did a huge renovation a couple years ago when they upgraded the rooms and replaced all the beds.  The best thing about it that it's almost Directly across the street from Disneyland! It'll take you less than 5 minutes to walk from your room to the entrance turnstiles. There's a Denny's right next door, a Tony Roma's and an IHOP two doors down and several other

Summary Heading: dont believe everything you read here! its not that bad!
Summary: Its not that bad of a place to stay. The location cant be beat. The room was clean...and the service was good. I didnt like having to ask for coffee. The TV reception was poor on some channels. The breakfast was passed up for Denny's.  But we found the room quiet clean...the bed was great. LOVE IT!...no parking problem, we parked it and walked for the three days we were here. I found the staff very nice.  Yes, the other hotels seemed a tad nicer....but for those on a fixed budget...this place worked out fine.

This hotel was expensive considering the maintenance and the poor service. The pool was dirty and the poll that led into the pool was rusty. The hot tub was cloudy looking and warm NOT HOT! Yuck! Also, parking was awful. We drive a compac tcar and the spaces were so small. You could hardly get out of you car. Their were barely any spaces to park in. Foget about driving somewhere at night because you might not find parking when you get back. The rooms itself were okay. They are small, but failry well kept. The shower head was really low. I had to bend to rinse my hair. When we checked in, the front desk guy took forever! After 6.5 hours of drving, I just wanted quick and friendly service. Overall, the location was suberb but the hotel was not good. Stay in the neighboring hotels,

Summary Heading: Bottom Line: This is just a place to lay your head
Summary: This motel is located about 300 feet from the crosswalk that leads to the parks.  It was a very quick walk to and from the park.  We took advantage of the close location every day during our stay of coming back for naps in the late afternoon and eating our dinner after our rest in our room.  I had heard that the continental breakfast wasn't all that great, so we opted to bring our own breakfast food and that worked out very well.  I'm guessing we got fresh towels everyday, because the towels were always neatly folded everyday when we returned to our room.  Many people on here wrote about how paper thin the walls were.  I didn't notice this at all.  All I could hear was the fan or the A/C going while in the room.  If anything, this blocked out noise.  The A/C worked really great.

Stayed at the Del Sol Inn 3 years ago...not a very good experience, but thought we would try it again as there were not many available hotels with a decent price this July.   I would recomend this hotel if you only wanted to sleep between 2:00 am and 5:00 am. If you want to check in, check out, shower, eat, need towels or need more than 3 hours of sleep, stay anywhere else!  Showers turn hot to cold and cold to hot for no apparent reason, maintanence people never showed up to fix it, housekeeping didn't bring handtowels or washcloths, it took an act of God, walking all over the hotel and a bad attitute from the people in laundry to get them. Paper thin walls! We were on the second floor (there are only 2 floors) and the noise was so bad when people walked by the door it sounded

After many mixed reviews I was very hesitant to stay at this location with no back up plan but we did stay and I'm pleased to say it was not as bad as I thought. Though I don't suggest week long stays. The rooms were spacious, well stocked and clean (except for the sock my nephew found under the bed, that made me nervose as to what else they forgot to clean). We never had a problem with the shower water as other ppl mentioned and that was great.   The staff was decent and did'nt make a stink when we asked for more pillows. The cont. breakfast offered was fresh and what we expected for the room price ($180 for 2 nights).   We were VERY dissatisfied with the horrible parking. There was no room to unload the luggage or even open our doors half way to get out and my brother who

We were just in Disneyland for the Spring Break.  Unfortunately this was a last minute trip so we were limited to where we could stay.  The Del Sol is an excellent for location. It is really only across the street, which means you don't have to wait for a bus for pick up and drop off.  Our room was 107, it was very spacious compared to other motels we have stayed in.  It fit our family of 4 nicely.  However the shower has hot and cold spurts.  They really need to get new towels...the ones they supply have been bleached over and over.  Being on the lower level was no good if you chose to sleep in as the floor above was very squeaky.  The parking lot is a joke, we parked the entire time in the Denny's parking lot and never had a problem.  Breakfast was very "continental" with the

After reading the mixed reviews I wanted to give this one a try. I stayed 2 nights before moving to Park Vue.   The room was a king, very small, and fixed up, but it looked fixed up. Some parts you could tell was old. It was clean and ok for the  location. I paid $74.98 each night. If I had a car I would have stayed at Motel 6 instead for about $50.00 a night and it is nicer and larger than Del Sol.   When I arrived I wasn't  to impress with front desk. He had run my credit card already before I arrived for one night. Most run it when you arrive. I did want to use a different card, and he started to run it - then told me he had run the other. I got the slip and made sure I tore it up, so I wouldn't get double charge.   The room is definitely blah, but I didn't expect lots for

We had room 231.  I booked this hotel months in advance because of it's location and price.  It was 70/90/90 for an average of 83.00 per night.   Now...that was what we thought it would cost but in the end it ended up costing us 50.00 more due to having to park at Disneyland the last day (no parking in their lot after 11 am the day of checkout ) and having to pay half of my sister's room so she could park when we were told AFTER we got there, it was 1 car per room.  We had to get her a room.  The Bad: 1. No handtowels/washclothes were replaced. 2.  plastic fork was found under the sheets (husband was getting poked by something and we found a plastic fork under the bedding which makes you wonder...do they change the sheets between customers?? 3. Hot and cold bursts of water in

If you have 2 parties coming in separate cars but sharing a room - you must know that this hotel only allows ONE PARKING SPACE PER ROOM!   The hotel advised we can park the other vehicle behind the hotel in the Denny's parking lot, but there are signs posted all over their lot stating that parking is for 2 hrs and only for Denny's customers.  This was unacceptable.  We were forced to book ANOTHER room so we could have a parking space for the other vehicle.   There was no way to know before we got there they only allowed one parking space per room.  Neither I nor the other party has a large vehicle, but if you plan to park your SUV or large truck at this hotel, be aware that the one parking space they do allow you is not very accommodating.  Many large vehicles in this small

We just spent 5 nights at the Del Sol.  No, it's not your Hilton, but it is suitable for the price and location.  It is set back off from Harbor so you don't have noise from the street.  Didn't notice noise from other rooms, either.  Most people are at the park and not hanging out in the hotel.  It's about as close as you can get to Disneyland.  There is one washer and one dryer, but the neighboring hotel has three of each.   The breakfast left some of us hungry and you may want to pack some snacks, unless you are a fan of "deluxe pastries."  They do have coffee, juice, 2 cereals, danish pastries, and oranges.  As mentioned in previous reviews, the staff didn't always leave adequate supplies (towels, toilet paper, coffee) but they were always willing to provide them at the desk.

For our Aug 7-10 2007 Disneyland Vacation, I booked the Del Sol Inn for  1 Night and the Disneyland Hotel for the other 2 nights. I visit Disneyland 1-2 times per year and I have stayed at several of the local hotels.   The Del Sol was $100 online ($118 final). It was clean and had comfortable beds, decent shower and towels, spacious bathroom countertop, refrigerator, and air conditioner (no musty smell like at other cheap hotels).  Check-in time is 3:00, so we checked our bags at the desk so we could go to the park.  Basic, but decent breakfast with fresh oranges, sweet rolls, decent coffee, cereal.    We didn't check out the pool, we spent all our waking hours at the park.  Overall, a great value and good place to crash after a long day at the park.    By the way, I got a

I came to Del Sol nearly two months ago and I had to say it wasn't as bad as some of the reviewers say it is. It's an average motel but with a nice continental breakfast to boot. It was a short walk to the park from the hotel and that was the best part. Our only problem was that the housekeepers sometimes forgot to leave us extra towels when we came back one day from the park. I believe the employee who helped us was named Carolina, she was very friendly. Also, on another night we needed to have our clothes ready for the next day so we called the front desk and an employee who i believed was named Ricardo came down immediately and brought us the iron and ironing board that we needed. The hotel was average but very accommodating. Noise was not a problem, and everything looked

Summary Heading: I would never go back there, Dirty and old
Summary: I booked this hotel for our trip to Anaheim because I wanted a hotel that was located directly across from Disneyland.  I knew from the internet pictures that it was not a fancy hotel but it was rated 3 stars.  and the price was affordable for us.  When we open the door to our hotel room I was very, very disappointment.  The room had a musty smell to it.  The walls and carpets did not look clean.  It was very unusual in that there was a second door that leads to the next room.   Some of the paint on the wall were peeling.  Washroom and sink did not look very clean.  The worst part  was I can clearly hear our next door hotel guest (because of that second door in our room).  The next door hotel guest made so much noise they woke me up in the middle of the night.  I hated our hotel

Summary Heading: Nice location, Okay room, Hotel has some issues
Summary: My family booked a "suite" at the Del Sol (actually just 2 rooms connected by a door) for 2 nights over the weekend and after all was said and done we ended up spending $140 a night per room- a bit hefty considering this is basically a Motel 6!. We were put in rooms 214 and 212, which are right next to the stairs. I immediately noticed the noise from upstairs and outside caused by luggage rolling past and other guests. The walls are thin and the ceiling creaks whenever someone walks above you. The rooms were spacious and clean and had nice amenities like a refrigerator and microwave, but the shower water did change frequently from hot to cold- not great if you have young children or a sunburn! The location was prime, but there were several other places within walking disance to

I was told about Del Sol Inn by a friend of mine after she had stayed for the weekend at the resort. I was intrigued by the affordable prices and the being so close to Disneyland. It sounded too good to be true. My husband and I live in Las Vegas and we were commuting late at night after we both got off of work for the evening, and I was afraid of either no one there to greet us or the staff would be rude, which we have encountered before. On the contrary we were met by Ricardo, whom we were really impressed by. We arrived at 2 am and he swiftly checked us in. Unfortunetly when we arrived in our room it was not what we expected. The room seemed a little messy and unkept. Ricardo then switched us to a better room immediatly, located near the breakfast room and he even helped with

Can't beat the location. Staff were very professional and friendly.  The room was much larger than we expected and very clean. Beds were comfortable but we couldn't get a lot of sleep. We were in room 212. This room is located right next to the stairs. These stairs are mounted on the same wall as your headboard and you will wake when someone uses them. In the morning it is worse. Not only do you have the stairs, you can hear the loud rumble of rolling luggage outside your window.  The shower temperature does change. Not from warm to cool, but from warm to ice cold to scalding hot. I do believe this is a real danger to children. Parking is tight, but we had no problem with it. The free breakfast was just fine. I have stayed in much nicer places that offered less. The mini fridge

Summary Heading: I dont know about all these other people...
Summary: ...but we had 2 bad experiences with this hotel.  The first time we stayed there (for 3 days), things were mostly fine and as advertised. We mainly chose it because it was walking distance to Disneyland. The room was acceptable for the price. But there were holes in the walls (dywall), covered up with tape. I am talking boot-sized holes. Other smallers holes were not even covered. I GUESS its a small thing when you think about it. But...when you walk into the room and there are HOLES IN THE WALLS......dont know.  The next time we went to Disneyland...we decided to stay there again. ..because AGAIN...the price and the location couldnt be beat. We knew what to expect...and we were prepared. Well...we arrived after a 6 hour drive from Phoenix to find that there was a broken water

What a disapontment! Both nights when I pulled back the sheets there was hair in the bed.  I prayed it was the maids and not  unchanged sheets, but either way, so gross. The beds were like sleeping on concrete and the walls so thin you could hear every word the room next door said.  Then they turned on the shower and like someone else said it was like Niagra Falls right behind my headboard.  There was no coffee for the coffee maker and no trash can liners, saving money on the frills I guess.  The way it is layed out the sound really carries and it is so noisy and hard to sleep. The horrible showers have already been mentioned so I was prepared for that and it is true, one second scald the next cold, invigorating! Everyone keeps saying how cheap the rooms are but I paid $90 a

Summary Heading: Not a good experience. Cheap hotel, cheap service.
Summary: We booked our room through a travel agency. We reviewed the hotel website pictures and amenities and thought it looked like a decent hotel. If you're looking for a cheap place to sleep until 7A.M. that is very close to Disneyland, then this is your place. If you want to stay in a decent hotel where you can rest and have a nice quiet vacation, then this isn't your place.   For some reason unbeknownst to us, the hotel management had masonery workers laying bricks in the pool area starting at 7A.M. in the morning. For 2 out of the 3 nights we stayed there, we woke up to the hammering, sawing, and stacking of bricks right outside of our room. It didn't help that the walls are paper thin and that you can hear everything including people speaking. Needless to say we weren't able to

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: The website for this hotel was easy to use and clearly stated the rates per night on a calendar, which was helpful since our dates were flexible.  We booked a VERY inexpensive room - about $44 /night - for a Monday and Tuesday night.  The first night was pretty bad - our room (#212) was right next to a stairwell and it was like a herd of elephants up and down the stairs for what seemed all night - and the room smelled of cigarettes.  The next night the manager almost-cheerfully moved us to room #207 - much quieter and didn't smell.    Pros:  Cheap, and VERY close to Disneyland  (located behind Denny's, literally across the street from park entrance).  Rooms were clean enough and had a fridge and microwave.  The free continental breakfast was minimal, but still convenient with 2

We had a terrible problem with the water in the shower when staying at the Del Sol.  We asked to have it fixed a couple of times but nothing ever came of it.  The water would go from freezing cold to SCALDING hot without warning.  I was glad my 4 year old took baths because she would have been burned taking a shower...I was!  Other than that major problem our stay was okay.  The rooms are old but spacious.  The room was made up and cleaned every day which was nice.  I would not stay at this hotel again and would try something else along "hotel row".  This hotel is rated a Good Neighbor Hotel...not sure why...the standards must be low.

This is an ok motel.  They let us check in a couple hours early, which we were grateful for.  Covered parking spaces were roomy, but the uncovered were very narrow.  We had no problems with parking.  Pool is being renovated, so pool and spa are not available.  The room was clean, actually was very large - we had two queens.  Would be great for families needing to put up a porta-crib.  Our experience with the shower was fine - it didn't go hot or cold like previous guests experienced.  The greatest attribute is how close it is to the crosswalk to the park.  There is a frig and microwave.  Breakfast was minimal, but Denny's is next door.  My only complaint, which is a very small one, is the towels.  I would stay again, and just bring my own bath towel - if I could get it for a

We just got back from a week's stay at the Del Sol Inn Anaheim.  It was great!  We couldn't have asked for a better location in proximity to Disneyland (entrance is across the street).! We had a morning flight into John Wayne Airport (highly recommend using this airport, it's so close, and less crowded!).  We arrived at Del Sol Inn 2 hours before normal check-in time, so they let us store our bags in their office, and came back after an hour lunch and they proceeded to check us in. The room we were given was very nice, clean, and had ample space for 2 adults and 2 children ages 6 & 10.  When we tried the cold water in the faucet, it was HOT!  The water in the tub was only hot water as well.  We called down to the office to tell them, and they immediately had a repairman come and

Pros: Right across the street from Disneyland and California Adventures; Family Suite offered; Some covered lot parking; Had fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, coin-op laundry (soap can be bought for an extra charge); Had an in room safe (for an extra charge); Had free breakfast (cereal, coffee, danish and toast)  Cons: Water in showers were inconsistent (hot one minute, cold the next); Not all that clean (child whose allergic to peanuts found some on the floor); One room had 60 channels while the other room only had 13

We had a wonderful stay at the Del Sol for 3 nights at $84/night, including all fees and taxes!  The resort fee is not bogus, it applies to all inns along Harbor Blvd to pay for the beautiful landscaping and lighting.  The motel is small (60 or so units), tucked behind the Dennys restaurant, which was also very good.  I stayed on the left side, above the covered parking, so I only had neighbors to the left and right.  I never heard any noise.  The pool is mid-sized, underutilized, and very clean.  Disneyland's entrance is a couple hundred feet up the road and across the street.  We walked to the entry gates in less than 10 minutes at an easy pace.  We used the hotel as a midday retreat to escape the heat, rest, and have a quick picnic lunch.  With the car under the covered

Was looking for a hotel within walking distance from Disneyland.  This place was great.  It is directly behind Denny's.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  We had read the reviews about the water warning however we did not experience it. The room was very quite, the floor was a bit dingy with some stains and the bed squeeked but that can all be over looked due to the location and amenities.  We had a mini frig and microwave.  The continential breakfast was OJ, milk cereal and breakfast croissants.  We would return again very nice location and worth the price.  If you don't want noise just request to be away from the pool.

Summary Heading: Great Value - Right across from Disneyland!
Summary: I was very surprised to see that the hotel was so close to parks.  My family had a clean, comfortable, spacious room, a good continental breakfast to start the day and great rate.  Who could ask for anything more!

We spent three days and four nights, and it was a package day from Getawaytoday. My husband and I went with our 1 and 3 yr. old and my parents. We reserved two adjoining rooms: one for the grandparents, and one for us with the kids. The rooms were ready when we arrived. The check in staff was friendly, and there were no problems.   The rooms were spacious enough and included a mini fridge and a microwave, which was perfect for us. Disneyland was right across the street. My three year old had no problem walking to the park.   The hair dryer didn't work in one of the rooms, but they promptly fixed it after our call. Yes, the water temp in the shower is as wierd as they say :-) It goes from hot to cold and the other way without a warning.  Breakfast was just a snack with less than

Anaheim Del Sol's major problem is the water in the showers. It changes from hot to cold and cold to hot without any warning. That is not only in the am hours but even late evening when you know that hardly anyone else is showering like 12:00 pm. I had read a few other reviews so I even called the motel to check if this problem had been fixed before we booked.  They assured me the water problem had been taken care of "wrong".  On the up side if you can handle the water situation, the room was large and clean and the maids did a good job each day. The ADS was close to Disneyland and thats a plus.  Because of the water problem I will not stay at ADS again.

Summary Heading: A very short walk to Disneyland
Summary: We got a great deal through a pre-paid package and we had picked Del Sol because it said it was close to the entrance.  We were surprised as to how close, we were expecting to walk at least for 20 minutes or so, instead we found we could get inside Disneyland in under 5 minutes.  The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very professional and friendly.  A terrific place for a wonderful price, I would recommend this place to family and friends.

We paid $158 for 2 nights inclusive of taxes and thought this was a great deal for being right across the street from disneyland. The room was rather large and had 2 queen beds. There was plenty of space for our 2 kids to play. The continental breakfast was basic (toasts, danishes, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, juices). We didn't use the pool as my husband saw 2 ducks swimming in it our first morning. We actually checked in at 8 am not expecting our room to be ready but it actually was. Iron and ironing board must be borrowed from front desk and there's only one set of washer and dryers for those interested. Parking was not an issue for us. We have a minivan and we had planty of room surrounded by other minivans and SUVs. Staff was friendly. Our only gripe about this hotel was

We were able to get a great deal at $99/night for three nights.  We weren't sure how close we would be to the Disneyland entrance, but the price was right, the reviews were favorable and the other highly-rated hotels were booked.  We were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is only ten yards from the crosswalk to the main pedestrian gate at Disneyland.  The rooms were large and clean.  The staff was very friendly.  For all those who complain about the rooms being just okay, plain or you wanted more for your money, next time you want a Four Seasons room, expect to pay a Four Seasons rate.  This is Southern California, everything's overpriced, deal.
This hotel was good for the money. The only complaint I have is the water temp changes from cold to scolding as you are trying to shower.  Otherwise this place was fine.

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 2006. This was the most overpriced 2-star motel I've ever stayed at. The room was over $250 per night all because of its location -- across street from Disney.   The walls were as thin as paper, we heard everything -everything and every word in the parking lot, every move of the people who stayed above us on the second floor; you don't need an alarm clock in the morning, people walking on the balcony hall way on the second floor will definitely wake you up.   Disney was fun, but this motel was a big disappointment!

We stayed here 4 nights with kids. The location was pefect, directly across from the main entrance of Disneyland. The parking was horrible, very limited spaces. The rooms were nice, but cockroaches keep showing up on the floor every day. The value for the price was reasonable.

The only concern that I had was the cleaning service left our hotel room door open while we were away. When we came back, luckily nothing was missing. I would suggest using the safe the hotel provides at NO additional charge. All in all, I found that for the price the location was great. It is directly across the street from the tram entrance and main gate entrance to the two parks. The best thing I found was the Denny's restaurant located at the entrance to the hotel parking lot.

Clean rooms, comfortable beds and steps from Disneyland all at a very affordable price.  My only advice is to call the hotel's 800# for a rate quote.  The price they quoted me on the phone was cheaper than the one on their website.

My husband, daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights last September.  We loved it for the location and the value.  It was such a quick hike to Disneyland and California Adventure, the room was clean and quiet, and the staff was friendly. We would definitely stay here again!
The mattresses were terrific. The rooms may be older but were very clean and well maintained.  Breakfast was limited but that was ok.  The staff were very nice.  Excellent location and a good price.

Summary Heading: del sol great for the price/location
Summary: We spent 4 nights at the Del Sol and were pleased with how clean the rooms were and the location to the park.  Located right behind Dennys, it is probably the 3rd closest motel to the park.  The staff was helpful and there was ample parking but we were there midweek.  We will stay again.  The breakfast was simple but there is juice, coffee or milk. Toast or danishes.  We brought oatmeal packets and hot cocoa packets to supplement. It took up little space and just added hot water can make a more hearty breakfast. Highly recommended.

Just returned from 6 nights at the Del Sol Inn.  Stayed in connecting 2 queen bed rooms.  The rooms were larger than your average motel room although the bathrooms were a little small.   The TVs were little and only got a few channels.  The motel was extremely clean.  They clean the rooms promptly each morning and leave plently of clean towels.  The beds were very comfortable.  The fridge and microwave provided were large and new.  There aren't irons or ironing boards in the rooms but they can be requested from the front desk.  We found the staff to be extremely pleasant and friendly.  The let us check in 2 hours early and accomodated our request for connecting rooms on the first floor.    We had a problem with one of the toilets when we first checked in.  It wasn't flushed and

It was cheap, but it was a place to crash.  The staff was very nice, rooms were very nice sized.  But the walls were SO thin.  There is no vent in the bathrooms, so the bathroom really steamed up.  It was close to DIsneyland and it was cheap.  Didn't get to experience the breakfast, so can't rate it.  We travel with a service dog, and they were very accomodating.

Well I should have known by the smell of the raid or chemicals that I was in for a nightmare. The first night was a good indication of why the rooms were so cheap.  I guess ya get what ya pay for.  Anyway, I awoke at around 7:00AM to the sound of water pouring out.  I turned on the light to find my sink overflowing with stench-smelled water that apparently was coming from the drain and poured out onto the carpet and continued to pour out all over the room.  I raced to find two waste baskets that filled to the brim with the nasty stenched smelled water.  I called the front desk and told them of the emergency problem I was experiencing.  They sent over a maid that didn't speak any English.  What a way to solve the problem.  Then the maintenance guy showed another 15 minutes later,

Summary Heading: Good Location-Great price, new carpet and mattresses
Summary: We stayed here just after they had installed new carpets and new mattresses in all the rooms- so I felt that it was nice and clean.  The price was exceptional and you can't beat the location. I thought the service was alright.  The breakfast was fine, a bit simple as posted, but it was nicely kept.   Pool is not heated. (pretty cold, when the sun is not out)

During a stay of family and friends, March 21 -23, 2005, our stay was mediocre.  We accepted a bump of two rooms with a king and rollaway for a discount on our nightly rate from two rooms with two queens, due to an overbooking by the hotel.  The room was average, the microwave and mini-fridge came in handy on our second morning.  We decided to purchase milk, juice and donuts which we kept in our room due to the continental breakfast being so simple and basic.  One of our rooms rollaway was so concaved that we decided to lay the mattress on the floor.  Room service replaced the rollaway on the second night for a tolerable rest.  Hot water is very limited in the late afternoon and night as it was for both of our rooms.  The bathroom fan in one of our rooms did not work-anytime we

We stayed at Del Sol Inn Feb 20-25, 2005, in room 218, just above the swimming pool area. In short, it's a great price for a great location if you're willing to put up with a couple of deficiencies, including:   - Slow dataport speeds (21-24kbps).  - No garbage bags provided in room.  - No extra toilet paper paper in room.  - No 'do-not-disturb' sign provided in room.  - Laundry room needs new light bulb.  - Inadequate bathroom ventilation fan (often necessary to open the front door after someone takes a shower or uses the loo).  - Inadequate sound insulation on doors connecting suite-paired rooms. (Baby cries and loud voices carry through the connecting door.)  - Inadequate sound insulation for the bathroom pipes. (Water flowing through shower next door creates signifigant

We stayed at Del Sol Inn because it is very close to Disneyland. Soon after we entered the room, my 2.5 years old daughter started itching her body badly. By next morning she had rashes over her body and because of the itch, she even had bad scratches. We stayed there for 3 nights and my daughter was miserable. I felt it could be because of the carpet. It looked really dirty. Also, I saw 3-4 dead ants in the bath tub when we had checked in. I would never ever stay at this place again.

Stayed for 8 nights Oct 6-14, 2004.  We decided to book based on reviews and location.  We were not disappointed, in fact, when we drove up, we realized that it was the same motel we had stayed in 14 years ago (then, Marco Polo).  Though it is dated compared to some of the relatively new places around it, it is clean and offers more than just danish and coffee for breakfast (toast, juice, coffee, tea, cereal and fruit), which saves on the pocketbook first thing in the morning.  It is off the road (behind Denny's) and very quiet considering it is across the street from the Main entrance to Disneyland.  The pool, though small, was not busy, eventhough the motel was fully booked.  The parking, however, was full and did not appear to have enough stalls for all guests.  Close enough

I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Del Sol Inn in Anaheim directly across from the entrance to Disneyland.  I wanted to share with others that it is a very clean Inn and an excellent location.  Everyone was very professional and I had a great stay.  The price was extremely reasonable.  Not a fancy room but very well maintained.    I will go back again in the future and will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.  The best place to stay for the money and location.

My family of three stayed there at Dec 18-21, 2004. Nice place with the great location, friendly staff. Cons -musty odor in the room and loud airconditioner, yes, even though it was end of December, outside temperature was 89 F. There was no problem with the hot water or parking. Breakfast was ok, two choices of cereal, danish, toast. Well... hotel next door had bacon, eggs and potatoes ( I felt kinda jellaus about it, but they do pay more for the room). In conclusion, if you need safe, clean and close located to the park place to stay--that's it. If you want granite countertops in the bathroom and crowns on your snow-white towels, look for something elce. For us it was enough to sleep in and take a shower, you go to Disneyland, what  elce do you need?  Btw, internet service is

This would be a one star review but the hotel's saving grace is its location. I realize you do not go to Disneyland to sleep but don't expect to get any if you stay here. Hotel walls are paper thin. We could hear the next door neighbor's conversation as if they were in the room with us. I also had the water pipes to someone's room right next to my head and you would have thought someone in my room was using our shower. Bedding was also very worn.  Hotel is right across from the parks and rate included a continental breakfast of juice, danish and cereal. Location is great but I don't think I could have tolerated the noise for more than the one night we were there.

You simply cannot beat the price and convenience of this motel.  We have stayed at the Grand Californian.  After realizing that we spent about 2 total "waking" hours at the hotel, I felt perhaps we could stay somewhere else.  Based on the Trip Advisor rating, we booked the Del Sol and I was shocked.  The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was also extremely friendly.  This hotel is as close as you can get to the main entrance of the park. We won't ever waste the money again to go "first class" when you can have this motel for so little!

We read all the reviews, and had originally decided to go with Howard Johnsons, and then needed to change our dates.  The price at Howard Johnson's went up $30.00 a night, so we decided to go with the Del Sol Inn.  Pros:  They matched Expedia's price online, without adding on Expedia's extra charges, so we paid $46.76 a night Sep 20-25.  It was pretty dead during the week, so parking was not an issue.  Room was large enough for my two toddlers to run around a little, but not a suite by any means.  The free breakfast is nice to have right there.  Which consists of toast, cheerios, corn flakes, sweet roll, coffee, milk, orange juice and raspberry lemonade.  The laundry is also nice, 75 cents for wash and 75 cents to dry.  They also only have one of each.  The biggest pro was the

Just returned from a vacation to So. Cal and after reading the reviews for the Del Sol, decided to give it a try.  We arrived on Sunday night and stayed three nights.  We found the management very kind and helpful.  There were nine of us in our party and had two adjoining rooms on the first floor.  The rooms were very clean and large enough for the time we were there.  The cont. breakfast was enough to get us through the morning.  The only thing that really bothered us was the noice of the people above us and outside our door.  The hotel is set back away from the traffic of all the cars but the walls and floors were pretty thin.  We definitely stay there again!  It was really close to the parks and the price was great.  We would just stay on the second floor next time.

We stayed 2 nights here in July 2004 and would definitely come back.  The price was right, the room was clean and spacious, the breakfast was well above the average we had been having in other motels, it was quiet and the best part was that it was so close to Disneyland.  This was an absolute positive for us as we were able to walk to and fro and come back easily for a quick swim to cool off.  On our last day our taxi failed to show up, and knowing we would miss our train, one of the staff drove us to the train station himself - excellent service!

Summary Heading: You won't be disappointed at the Del Sol Inn
Summary: After wading thru many internet sites trying to find the best Southern CA deal, we found this site and booked our reservation thru expedia.com. This was the only hotel that had mostly all positive reviews compared to other places in the same price range.   Our experience was the same as others have mentioned.  We enjoyed the close proximity to Disneyland, the rooms were large, clean and well kept.  The friendly staff, clean pool and hottub, laundry facility, continental breakfast, and in-room microwave and fridge were all big selling points for us.  The hotel was very family-friendly and there were many other families enjoying the comforts of the DEL SOL.  With small children (7,5 and 2), it was easy and convenient coming to and from the park throughout the day as needed.  It

We were a bit worried after reading previous reviews of this hotel but when we arrived the service and friendliness of staff were wonderful.  The room was large and comfortable, water pressure and temperature in the smallish bathroom were great.  You need to ask for coffee from reception but the fridge and microwave in the room were indispensable. The hotel's location was superb - 300m from the Disneyland main entrance.  We travelled with young kids (5 & 7) and there was no trouble in getting them to walk to and from Disneyland (sometimes a couple times a day).   Granted there is no room service but with such a huge range of places to eat in so close a range it made no difference.  There is a good breakfast in the mornings - coffee, juice, danish, 3 types of bread/toast and 2

We were in Disneyland yet again, and stayed at the Del Sol, yet again.  This is our second year in a row, and plan to stay there again next year.  I am also a travel agent, and am recommending this hotel to all my customers with familys.  The location and service is by far the best.  We have travelled to this area 4 years in a row, and am glad I found the Del Sol last year.  The breakfast is the best I have found also.  The staff and Jamal, are the best ever!!!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!!

I booked the Del Sol Inn after reading the reviews and considering the fairly low cost of the room. The hotel is very close to Disneyland. The room was a good size room but the washroom was tiny. The overall cleaniness of the room is ok but the carpet is stained. The swimming pool is small and is not heated but is kept clean. There was a surprised charge for the use of the in-room safe deposit box and so you may enquire about that at check in. Given that I used the hotel mainly for sleep and shelter, I would definitely stay there again considering the price I paid for the room.

We had read good reviews of the Del Sol Inn in the Trip Advisor, decided to book a room, and were not disappointed. We stayed three nights--Thurs, Fri, and Sat-- for an average $60 night with tax! The motel is behind Dennys and very quiet. In addition to the usual amenities, the room had a microwave, large refrigerator, and coffee pot. The motel also offered a continental breakfast. It was a 5-minute walk to Disneyland so the car stayed under the covered parking for the whole visit. We would stay there again and recommend it to anyone who wants a clean, decent room for an excellent price. Be sure to check the motel's website for the best rate.

Your reviews are accurate. It is SO nice to be directly across the street from the gates. The carpets are stained, and they should also replace the blankets because they are quite thin and show their age. The pool was a pleasant surprise. Much larger than the pictures online. Also, a child had a diaper accident in the pool (use your imagination) and the motel staff quickly shut it down, cleaned it, shocked it, closed it, and allowed you to go next door to its sister property that had an indoor pool. That is good sanitary care, and accomodation at its best. Clean rooms. For these rates, we will return. In Florida at Disneyworld, I strongly suggest staying in the park. But Disneyland is a smaller property and the Del Sol is a great place to stay.

The location is as good as you can get, unless you stay at Disney's own hotels. A 5 minute walk gets you to the front gate.
